For her 6th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Merlie is now borrowing PHP 20,000 in order to purchase more clothing stock to sell. Her previous loan of PHP 15,000, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Merlie hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Eufemia

texts.en:
Eufemia D., who lives in Brgy. Ubo, Dalaguete, Cebu, earns her living by operating a buy and sell vegetable business. Her husband, Joselito D., 47, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have eight children ranging in age from 7 to 22 years old.

Eufemia joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2007 because she aspired to something better for her family. With the help of her past five loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Eufemia has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 10000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 5600, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her sixth loan, she is borrowing PHP 10000, which she intends to use to fund her business operations so that she can continue to save up for her children's future. Eufemia D. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work.

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: For business operations

loans.name: Mehujayme

texts.en:
Mehujayme P. is a married woman who lives in  Brgy. Cansalongan, Isabella, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating two business ventures: a rice mill and a general store. Her husband Hernani, who is 60 years old, works as a driver to earn his living, and also helps in his wife's business activities.  They have two children who are 28 and 29 years old. 

Mehujayme joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 16 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Mehujayme has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,000 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000,  uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 17th loan, she is borrowing PHP 20,000, which she intends to use as additional working capital for the rice mill and to purchase stock for the general store so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs . Mehujayme P. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF:

 In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed on a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. 

Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Fund the operations of her rice  mill and general store

loans.name: Maali

texts.en:
Maali is a young woman who is married to Nael and the mother of four daughters and four sons. Maali and her husband own a shisha (an oriental tobacco pipe) place. Maali took out a loan from FATEN to buy a large amount of shisha supplies and coffee to sell and increase their profit. The store is located in the heart of the city and attracts a good number of clients. That's why the increased stock would improve the family's finances.

Maali's husband, Nael, appears in the picture here as Maali is a conservative woman.

loans.use: To purchase large amounts of nuts and coffee

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is a young woman from Palestine. She has been married for years and she and her husband have been trying to have a baby for a long time. They have decided to do a fetA. implantation. Helen came to FATEN and took out a loan to pay for the implantation expenses.

Helen's husband appears in the picture here, as she is a conservative woman and doesn't want her picture posted.

loans.use: To pay for fetal implantation

loans.name: Hani

texts.en:
Hani is a Palestinian National Authority employee. He is the father of one daughter, who is 12 years old, and three sons who are 15, 8 and 6 years old. Hani started another business to support his big family. He has a goat farm now, where he takes care of goats and prepares them for sale. This is a very successful business in his area due to the large population.

Hani appears in the picture here at his farm.

loans.use: To purchase more goats to increase the production and sell more goats

loans.name: Aminah

texts.en:
Aminah is a young woman from Gaza city in Gaza Strip, married to Fayez M. and the mother of four daughters and two sons. Aminah's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee. He also has a poultry farm where egg-laying hens are. Aminah took out a loan from FATEN to purchase egg-laying hens and a hatcher to increase production and be able to serve a bigger number of customers.

Aminah's husband appears in the picture here as she is a religious woman.

loans.use: To purchase hens and a hatcher

loans.name: Carmen

texts.es: Carmen, 45 años, casada con Herminio, de 44 años. Ambos tienen 4 hijos, pero solo viven con una de ellas Merly, de 14 años. En unión familiar los tres viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). La hermosa sonrisa de Carmen, muestra la vitalidad que posee, pues cuenta que hace 8 años se dedica a la agricultura; donde sus principales sembríos constan de café, plátanos, y palta. Lo que más le gusta a ella, es poder sacar el quillo (tipo de maleza que crece entre los cultivos) que crece constantemente, pues así asegura que sus cultivos crecerán sin mayores inconvenientes. El trabajo esforzado que diariamente proporciona a sus cultivos principalmente de plátanos, hace que 2 veces al mes viaje a las ciudades de La Merced y Villa Rica, donde vende sus frutos. Pero como sabe que las épocas de cosecha de café son una vez al año, ella desea mejorar e incrementar la siembra de diferentes frutas, así está segura que no tendrá inconvenientes en su economía. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y espera que muy pronto puedan lograr sus objetivos como un banco comunal independiente.Con el crédito que solicita, planea comprar varios sacos de abono orgánico, y si el dinero le alcanza comenzará a realizar un vivero de café de un promedio de 4 mil plantas.
texts.en: Carmen is 45 years old. She is married to Herminio, who is 44. They have 4 children, but only one, 14 year old Marly, lives with them. The three of them live as a family in their own home, located in the community of Unión Palomar (Central Peruvian jungle). Carmen's beautiful smile shows off her vitality. She has been farming for 8 years. Her main crops are coffee, plantains, and avocado. What she likes the most is being able to take out the quillo (a type of weed that grows between the plantings) that grows constantly. Thus, she ensures that her crops will grow without big problems. The hard work that she does every day for her crops, mainly the plantains, results in her travelling twice a month to the cities of La Merced and Villa Rica, where she sells her products. But since she knows that the harvest for coffee is once a year, she wants to improve and increase the plantings of different products. In this way, she will ensure herself against financial problems. This is the first time that she has had a loan with MFP and she hopes that they can acheive their goals as an independent communal bank.  With the loan she is asking for, she plans on buying various sacks of organic fertilizer. If there is enough money, she will start a coffee nurery with an average of 4 thousand plants.

loans.use: To buy sacks of fertilizer and make a nursery with 4 thousand coffee plants.

loans.name: Norca

texts.es: Sonia, de 48 años, convive con Jaime, de 51 años. Ambos tienen 6 hijos, pero solo viven con 2 de ellos: Karina, de 15 y Juan, de 10 años. En unión familiar ellos viven en su casa propia, ubicada en la localidad de Unión Palomar (selva central peruana). Desde muy niña, Sonia, incursionó en la agricultura, ahí, gracias a sus padres pudo aprender las técnicas de cultivo, como también a tener buen tacto en la manera de comercializar sus cultivos. Ahora ella tiene más de 20 años sembrando sus propios frutos, que constan de plátanos, palta y café, los cuales cuida con mucho esmero, pues no quiere defraudar las enseñanzas de sus padres; su esfuerzo y constancia, hacen que Sonia, venda sus cosechas a buen precio; tanto así que en temporadas agrícolas, los comerciantes que visitan la zona, ofrecen por sus cultivos mayor precio de venta, por ello está planeando mejorar la calidad de sus cultivos, para comenzar a vender su grano a los exportadores de café. Esta es la primera vez que tiene un crédito con MFP, y como socia de su banco comunal, augura muchos éxitos en la iniciación de este nuevo proyecto. Con el crédito que recibirá, planea comprar 8 sacos de abono orgánico, los cuales esparcirá en sus cultivos de café.
texts.en: Sonia, 48, lives with Jaime, 51 and both have 6 children but only 2 live with them, Karina, 15 and Juan, 10.  They are in a common-law marriage and live in their own house, located in Unión Palomar (the central Peruvian jungle).  Since she was a small child, Sonia worked in farming there, and thanks to her parents she learned cultivation techniques.  She tends to them with a lot of care because she doesn’t want to go against what her parents taught her.  Her efforts and perseverance  let her sell her crops for a good price.  During the growing season the buyers who come to this area offer her better prices for her produce and that is why she wants to improve the quality of her crops.  She would like to sell her coffee beans to exporters.  This is the first time that she has a loan with MFP, and as a member of her communal bank, she hopes for success with the start of the new project.  She will use the loan to buy 8 sacks of organic fertilizer that she will spread on her coffee plants.

loans.use: To buy 8 sacks of organic fertilizer

loans.name: Bibiana

texts.es: Bibiana tiene 65 años, vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Hace más D. 10 años se dedica a vender leche fresca. Es así que cada mañana orD.ña su vaca llegando a recolectar gran cantidad D. leche que será vendida a una empresa láctea. D. esa manera obtiene ingresos económicos para cubrir los gastos D. su casa, eso le motiva continuar trabajando, además que le gusta mucho lo que hace ya que lo considera una actividad que no requiere D. mucho esfuerzo físico es por esta razón que seguirá dedicándose a la ganadería por más tiempo. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta D.  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte D. su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso D. su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra D. una ternera para criarlo.
texts.en: Bibiana is 65 and she lives with her husband in their own house.  She started selling fresh milk more than 10 years ago and every morning she milks her cows and collects a large amount that will be sold to a dairy business.  This is how she gets earnings to cover household expenses and that is why she wants to continue working.  Besides she enjoys what she does very much since it doesn’t require much physical effort and thus she will keep working with cows in the future.  This is her first loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes to be part of the communal bank because all of the members are people that she knows, and they are responsible and united.  She thanks those people who will be offering the loan that she is requesting and it will be very useful for her earnings.  She will use the moeny to buy a calf to raise.

loans.use: To buy a calf.

loans.name: Bonifacia

texts.es: Bonifacia tiene 49 años vive con su esposo en su casa propia. Desde hace 15 años se dedica a la agricultura cultivando papa y avena, asimismo cría vacas ya que así se abastece de leche, producto que es vendido en su zona. Su esposo es quien le ayuda en éstas tareas, y con el paso de los años han logrado tener estabilidad en sus ingresos. Afirma que le agrada trabajar en el campo porque se siente libre, también porque le permite tener ganancias necesarias ya que la venta de los productos que cultiva y de la leche le ayudan a mantener a su familia. Es por esta razón que desea seguir perseverando en esta actividad por varios años más. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, comprará una vaca lechera más.
texts.en: Bonifacia is 49 and she lives with her husband in their own house.  For the past 15 years she has been farming growing potatoes and oats and she also raises cows so that she gets milk, all products that are sold in her area.  Her husband helps her with the work and with the passing years they have been able to stabilize their earnings.  She says that she likes to work in the fields because she feels free.  Also it is because this allows her to make the necessary income since she can sell what she grows and the milk helps her support her family.  These are the reasons that she wants to continue working for some more years.   The loan is her first with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes to be part of the communal bank because all of the members are people that she knows and they are responsible and united.  She thanks those who are offering the loan that she is requesting and it will be very helpful in improving the earnings from her work.  Bonifacia will use the money to buy another dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a cow

loans.name: Eva

texts.es: Eva tiene 48 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Hace más de 15 años vende leche fresca, producto que extrae de sus vacas. Desde entonces se levanta muy temprano por la madrugada para preparar el alimento de sus animales y limpiar su establo, ordeña  a sus vacas y después lleva la leche a sus compradores que viven cerca de su zona. Asimismo su esposo y sus hijos también trabajan en esta actividad, pues saben que le permite tener buenas ganancias y eso le da mucha satisfacción. En adelante desea mejorar las instalaciones de su establo y adquirir cantidad de animales, así logrará incrementara su capital de trabajo. Es su primer crédito con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, será invertido en la compra de remedios para sus vacas.
texts.en:
Eva is 48 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and three children.

Eva has been selling fresh milk from her cows for 15 years.  She gets up very early in the morning to prepare the feed for her animals and to clean out their stable.  She milks her cows and then delivers the milk to her customers who live nearby.  Her husband and children also take part in this work because they know that it provides them with good money and this makes them very happy.

In the future, Eva would like to improve her stable and acquire some animals.  This will enable her to increase her working capital.

This is Eva's first loan with MFP and she is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being part of her community bank because all the members are people that she knows and they are all responsible and very supportive of each other.  Eva is grateful to the people who will help fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying medicines for her cows.

loans.use: To buy medicines for her cows

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 44 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Desde que era niña se dedicaba a la agricultura, hoy se ha convertido en su fuente de ingresos. Es así que cultiva papa, habas trigo entre otros productos más y junto con  su familia la ayudan en la siembra y en la cosecha. Todos trabajan arduamente, ya que de ello depende para que obtengan regulares ganancias. Por otro lado, cría animales, como: ovejas, asnos y  bueyes que cada cierto tiempo lo venden. En estos últimos años ha recuperado lo invertido en sus cosechas  por lo que desea seguir dedicándose a la agricultura por muchos años más. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para sembrar.
texts.en:
Francisca is 44 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and two children.

Francisca has been farming since she was a little girl.  It has now become her source of income.  She grows potatoes, beans, wheat and other crops.  Her family help her with her sowing and harvesting.  They all work very hard together since they depend on this work for regular income.  Francisca also raises animals such as sheep, donkeys and oxen which she sells every so often.  Recently Francisca has recouped the money that she has invested in her harvests and, for this reason, she would like to continue farming for many more years.

This is Francisca's first loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being part of her community bank because all its members are people that she knows.  They are all responsible and very supportive of each other.  Francisca is grateful to the people who will fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying sacks of manure for her crops.

loans.use: To buy sacks of manure for the upcoming sowing season

loans.name: Lilia

texts.es: Lilia tiene 38 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Vende leche de vaca que ordeña de sus propias vacas, actividad que lo realiza desde hacia varios años. Su familia la ayuda en esta actividad, llevan a pastear a sus animales en el campo, asimismo la alimentan con el forraje que ellos mismo producen. Por otro lado, elabora quesos, producto que es llevado a vender en las ferias comerciales de su localidad, de esa manera logra tener ingresos semanales o quincenales. Considera que su trabajo es rentable por lo que continuará dedicándose a la venta de leche, ya que desea más adelante tener una vaca más.  Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito, lo invertirá en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus animales.
texts.en:
Lilia is 38 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and two children.

Lilia sells milk from her own cows.  She has been in this business for several years.  Her family help her in her work.  They take the animals out to pasture in the fields and also feed them with fodder that they produce themselves.  Lilia also makes cheese which she takes to sell in the markets in her area.  This makes her income every week or fortnight.

Lilia considers that her work is profitable and so she would like to continue selling milk.  In the future, she would like to buy another cow.  This is her first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and she likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are people that she knows.  They are all responsible and very supportive of each other.  Lilia is grateful to the people who will help fund her loan because it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan in buying balanced feed for her animals.

loans.use: To buy feed for her animals

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.es: Rosalina tiene 30 años, vive en casa de sus padres. Tiene más de 10 años de experiencia en la venta de leche, siendo su principal fuente de ingresos; sin embargo hace 5 años empezó a vender productos de primera necesidad (alimentos) a sus vecinos. Su madre, quien es su principal apoyo, siempre la ayuda en ambas actividades que desarrolla día a día. Se siente muy satisfecha con el trabajo que realiza, ya que así logra ser independiente económicamente, y puede disponer de sus horarios, es por esta razón que espera para los próximos años tener un establo más amplio y una tienda más grande y surtida. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de una vaca lechera de buena raza.
texts.en:
Rosalina is 30 years old and lives in her parents' home.  She has more than 10 years experience in selling milk.  This is her main source of income.  However, 5 years ago she also started essentials (food) to her neighbors.  Her mother, who is her main source of support, always helps her in both of the businesses that she carries out every day.

Rosalina feels very satisfied with the work that she does since it allows her to be financially dependent and she can set her own working hours.  For this reason, she hopes in the future to have a bigger stable and a bigger and better stocked store.  This is Rosalina's first loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support and she likes being part of her community bank because all the members are people that she knows.  They are all responsible and very supportive of each other.

Rosalina would like to thank the people who will fund her loan because it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan money in buying a good breed of dairy cow.

loans.use: To buy a good breed of dairy cow

loans.name: Teva

texts.es: Teva tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Toda su vida se ha dedicado a la venta de leche que extrae de sus vacas, ésta actividad le enseñó a sus 3 hijos, quienes también le apoyan en el ordeño de vaca todas las mañanas. Asimismo estos productos son llevados a vender a una compañía de productos lácteos, en donde le pagan buenas ganancias, permitiéndole así cubrir con los gastos de su familia. Es por ello que lo considera una actividad muy rentable ya que no necesita de suficiente capital para invertir, pues ella misma produce el alimento para sus animales. En adelante desea tener más vacas y otros animales para criar. Es su primer crédito que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de ovejas.
texts.en:
Teva is 46 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and three children.

Teva has been selling milk from her own cows her entire life.  She taught this business to her three children and they help her to milk the cows every morning.  Teva takes her products and sells them to a company that sells dairy products.  The company pay her very well which allows her to cover her family's expenses.  Teva considers her business to be a very profitable one.  She doesn't need to invest too much money in it because she produces the feed which she gives to her animals herself.  In the future, she would like to have more cows and other animals to raise.

This is Teva's first loan with MFP and she is happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being a member of her community bank because all the members are people that she knows.  They are all responsible and very supportive of each other.

Teva is grateful to the people who will fund her loan as it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan money in buying some sheep.

loans.use: To buy sheep

loans.name: Crispina

texts.es: Crispina tiene 56 años, vive con su hija en su casa propia. Vende muebles de metal (camas, literas y repisas) desde hace más de 30 años, junto con su esposo comenzaron con este trabajo, hoy es su fuente principal de ingresos, permitiéndole así tener ganancias semanalmente. Durante los días de semana fabrica los muebles, para luego venderlos sólo los domingos en la feria comercial de su localidad. La calidad y el buen acabado que tiene sus muebles le han dado mucha ventaja frente a los competidores, así asegura una buena venta. Es por esta razón que esta siempre al tanto de innovar con variados y nuevos diseños. Afirma que le agrada realizar esta actividad porque tiene amplia experiencia en este rubro y su deseo para el futuro es mejorar su taller. Es su crédito numero 4 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de materiales para la fabricación de muebles como fierros y electrodos.
texts.en:
Crispina, age 56, lives with her daughter in her own house.  She has been selling metal furniture (beds, bunk beds, and shelves) for over 30 years.  She and her husband started this work, and now it is her main source of income.  It allows her to have weekly earnings.

During the days of the week she makes the furniture.  She later sells it only on Sundays at the commercial fair in her area.  Because her furniture is of good quality and has a good finish, she has a big advantage over the competitors.  That is how she is assured of a good sale.  That is why she is always up to date with a variety of innovations and new designs.  She states that she likes this activity because she has a lot of experience in this field.  In the future she wishes to improve her shop.

This is her fourth loan with MFP.  She is very happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being a member of her communal bank because all of the members are people she knows; they are responsible and very supportive.  

She thanks those people who will be lenders of the loan she is requesting.  The loan will be very useful to the progress of her business activity.  She will use the loan she is requesting to buy materials like iron and electrodes to make furniture.

loans.use: To buy iron and electrodes

loans.name: Domitila

texts.es: Domitila tiene 46 años, vive con su esposo y la menor de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde niña ha estado siempre ligada a las actividades agrícolas, proviene de una familia netamente agrícola y ganadera,  todas estas lecciones de vida han hecho de ella ejerza de una manera eficiente en sus campos de cultivo dedicándose a sembrar papa, maíz y verduras. Así mismo ella cría vacas y para ellas cultiva la alfalfa, años tras años gracias a esta actividad puede sostener a su familia y ser una protagonista en su manutención junto a su esposo que ahora también la apoya en estas actividades. A pesar de que en años anteriores a perdido totalmente su cosecha y ganancia cuando cayó sobre sus campos de cultivo la helada, esto no la desanimó y sigue adelante. Para este año Domitila sembrará más verduras así como también espera la cosecha de papa y maíz. En adelante desea mejorar la productividad de sus cosechas. Es el su crédito número 7 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de sacos de abono para la siembra de verduras, alfalfa y papa.
texts.en: Domitila is 46 years old. She lives with her husband and the youngest of their three children in their own house. Since she was a child, she has been involved in agricultural activities as she is from a family of farmers and ranchers. All of these life lessons have made her good at working on the land. She now cultivates potatoes, corn and vegetables. She also raises cows and the alfalfa that they eat. For years and years, thanks to this work, she has been able to support her family and also be a companion, with her husband, in the performance of these activities. In spite of the fact that, in previous years, they have lost all of their harvest and earnings because of a freeze that fell over the countryside, this didn’t deter them and they are moving forward. This year Domitila is growing more vegetables and also she is awaiting the corn and potato harvest. For the future she would like to improve the outcome of her harvests. This is her seventh loan with MFP. She is very glad to know she has the support of this financial organization. She is also grateful to be part of this community bank as all of the members are people that she knows. They are very responsible and supportive. She is thankful for the people that offer her the loan that she is requesting as it will be very helpful in her economic progress. With this loan that she is requesting, she will buy bags of fertilizer in order to grow vegetables, alfalfa and potatoes

loans.use: She will buy bags of fertilizer.

loans.name: Fortunata

texts.es: Fortunata tiene 58 años vive con su esposo y su hijo en su casa propia. Desde hace 10 años vende abarrotes por medio de viajes que realiza semanalmente a la ciudad de Lima para comercializar diversos productos alimenticios nativos de su zona. Tiene clientes fijos que le solicitan ciertos productos específicos y los lleva en buen estado y de calidad, se consideran fieles a los productos que vende. Por su parte Fortunata se siente muy contenta de realizar esta actividad porque le permite  viajar y socializarse siendo de su agrado a la vez que le permite tener ganancias semanales que son de beneficio para su familia. En adelante desea tener más capital de trabajo. Es su crédito numero 2 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más mercadería en menestras y quesos.
texts.en: Fortunata is 58 and lives with her husband and child in her own home. For 10 years she has sold groceries by traveling weekly to the city of Lima to sell diverse food products that are native to her area. She has a customer base that requests certain products, and she provides these products in good quality, so her customers are loyal to her products. Fortunata feels very happy to do this job because it allows her to travel and socialize, while she is grateful for making a weekly income that benefits her family. In the future, she wants to have more working capital. This is her second loan with MFP. She is very happy to know that she has financial support, and she is grateful to be part of her community bank because all of the members are people whom she knows. They are responsible and very supportive of each other. She thanks those who will lend money toward this loan that she is requesting. It will be very useful in the progress of her business. With the loan that she is requesting, she will invest in the purchase of more merchandise: mixed vegetables and cheeses.

loans.use: To purchase mixed vegetables and cheeses, products that are in great demand in the capital.

loans.name: Irma

texts.es: Irma tiene 57 años, vive con el menor de sus 3 hijos en su casa propia. Desde hace 30 años se dedica a la costura, tiene su taller en su misma casa y realiza todo  tipo de costuras tanto para prendas de vestir como para ropa casual. Los buenos acabados que realizan son el mejor prestigio que tiene para seguir ofreciendo este servicio, tiene más cantidad de pedidos en los meses de noviembre y diciembre porque  en estas fechas hay más demanda de prendas de gala y de vestir. Irma disfruta de realizar este trabajo que le permite estar en su casa y disponer de su tiempo es por esta razón que su deseo es tener una capital más estable para  seguir realizando sus costuras. Es su crédito número 9 con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de más telas.
texts.en:
Irma is 57 years old.  She lives in her own home with the youngest of her three children.

Irma has been sewing for 30 years.  She has a workshop in her home and there she sews all kinds of clothes, from formal clothes to casual clothes.  The good work that she does means she has a good reputation. This allows her to continue offering this service.

Irma has more orders to fill in November and December because during these months there is a lot of demand for formal clothes and dress clothes.  Irma enjoys doing this work as it allows her to be at home and set her own hours.  She would like to have more stable capital so that she can continue with her sewing work.

This is Irma's ninth loan with MFP.  She is happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being part of her community bank as all the members are people that she knows.  They are responsible people and very supportive of each other.

Irma is grateful to the people who will fund her loan because it will be very useful to her in making progress in her business.  She will invest her loan money in buying more fabric.

loans.use: To buy more fabric

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es: Rocío tiene 36 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos en su casa propia. Se dedica a la fabricación de muebles desde hace 8 años, los muebles son de metal tales como camas y camarotes, asimismo colchones. Tiene su fábrica de muebles en su misma casa y junto con su esposo trabajan de lunes a sábado, pero los domingos se dedica a la comercialización de los muebles que fabricó. Con el pasar de los años ha visto la rentabilidad de su negocio y la preferencia de las personas que compran y esto compensa el gran esfuerzo físico que requiere de fabricar estos muebles. Siempre trabaja con la mentalidad de mejorar y crear novedosos diseños de estos muebles ya que esto garantiza  las  ventas y para el futuro desea tener una fábrica grande de muebles metálicos. Es su crédito numero 2 que tiene con MFP, esta muy contenta de  saber que tiene un apoyo financiero, además  le agrada ser parte de su banco comunal porque  todos sus integrantes son personas que conoce, responsables y muy solidarias, agradece  a aquellas personas que serán gestoras del préstamo que solicita y le será  muy útil en el progreso de su actividad económica. Con el crédito que solicita, lo invertirá en la compra de calaminas para  techar su taller de fabricación de muebles.
texts.en:
Rocío is 36 years old.  She lives in her own home with her husband and 2 children.

Rocío has been making furniture for 8 years.  She makes metal furniture such as beds and bunk beds.  She also makes mattresses.  Rocio has her furniture workshop in her own home and she works there with her husband from Monday to Saturday.  On Sundays she sells the furniture that she made during the week.

Over the years Rocío has seen the profitability of her business and the fact that the people who buy from her like her products best.  This rewards the great physical effort that making these items of furniture requires.  As she works, Rocío is always thinking of improving and creating new designs for her furniture as this is what guarantees sales.  In the future, she would like to own a bigger workshop for making her metal furniture.

This is Rocío's second loan with MFP and she is happy to know that she has financial support.  She also likes being part of her community bank because all the members are people that she knows.  They are responsible and very supportive of each other. 

Rocío is grateful to the people who will fund her loan because it will be very useful to her in making progress with her business.  She will invest her loan money in buying corrugated metal sheets to put a roof on her furniture workshop.

loans.use: To buy corrugated metal sheets to put a roof on her furniture workshop

loans.name: 15.1.2 Nam Ngan Group

texts.en:
Coi L. T. (7) is a 58-year-old woman living in the town of Thanh Hoa. Coi is the group leader of a 6-member group loan offered by Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. WhiL. each member of the group receives an individual loan, they all are responsibL. for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is 15.1.2 Nam Ngan (02.15.1.2 Nam Ngan).

Coi is widowed and has 3 adult -aged children. She owns and operates a business making and selling a variety of food products in the local community. Coi has been engaged in this business for over 7 years and earns approximately 2,500,000 VND a month from it.

In 2010, Coi joined Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Coi is requesting a new loan of 4,248,000 VND which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for saL.. This will be the 1st loan Coi has taken from Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's general living conditions.

About the other borrowers in the group:

1.  D. N. Anh (8) is a 29-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business running a food stall.

2.  L. T. Lan (9) is a 55-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business making and selling food.

3.  L. T. Hanh (10) is a 56-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business operating a specialized retail store.

4.  V. T. P. Lan (11) is a 37-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her business operating a specialized retail store.

5.  C. T. Binh (12) is a 60-year-old woman who is requesting a 4,248,000 VND loan to support her fishing business.

About Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

The mission of Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women (FPW) is to provide sustainabL. financial services to disadvantaged women in rural areas in the Thanh Hoa province.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in Vietnamese whiL. providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.


 Coi L. T. (7) là 58 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy sống ở thành phố Thanh Hoa.   Coi là trưởng nhóm của nhóm vay gồm có 6 các thành viên.  Mặc dù mỗi thành viên trong nhóm nhận được từng khoản vay cá nhân, nhưng tất cả họ đều chịu trách nhiệm hoàn trả lại khoản vay của các thành viên trong nhóm của mình nếu một người nào đó trễ hạn hay không trả được nợ..  Tên chính thức của nhóm vay này là 15.1.2 Nam Ngan (02.15.1.2 Nam Ngan).


Trong khi không phải chỉ có các phương thức tạo nên thu nhập, mà nguồn thu nhập chính của công việc kinh doanh chủ yếu từ bán các loại thực phẩm khác nhau trong cộng đồng địa phương.   Coi thực hiện công việc kinh doanh này trong hơn 7 năm.  Từ các hoạt động này,  Coi kiếm được khoảng 2.500.000 VND.  Vào 2010,  Coi đã tham gia Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women để có thể tiếp cận với các dịch vụ tài chính giúp cải T.ện  sinh hoạt và khả năng tham gia vào các hoạt động kinh doanh của cô ấy/ anh ấy.   Coi đã hoàn trả hết khoản vay trước đây từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.    Cô ấy hiện đang đề nghị một khoản vay mới là 4.248.000 VND.


Khoản vay sẽ là 1st khoản vay của người vay từ Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.


Về Những Người vay khác trong Nhóm:


1.  D. N. Anh (8) là 29 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là buôn bán quầy thực phẩm.


2.  L. T. Lan (9) là 55 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là sản xuất & buôn bán thức ăn.


3.  L. T. Hanh (10) là 56 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


4.  V. T. P. Lan (11) là 37 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực bán lẻ.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là kinh doanh cửa hiệu bán lẻ chuyên dụng.


5.  C. T. Binh (12) là 60 tuổi nữ.  Cô ấy đề nghị khoản vay là 4.248.000 VND.  Khoản vay này sẽ được sử dụng để hỗ trợ công việc kinh doanh trong lĩnh vực thực phẩm.  Mục đích chính của việc kinh doanh là vận hành công việc kinh doanh hải sản.


Về Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women:

Nhiệm vụ của Quỹ vì Phụ Nữ Nghèo Thanh Hóa (FPW) là cung cấp các dịch vụ tài chính bền vững cho những người phụ nữ kém may mắn ở các vùng nông thôn tỉnh Thanh Hóa.


*Lưu ý: Để phát huy tối đa hiệu quả & giảm chi phí, khoản vay này đã được thông báo bằng biểu mẫu để có thể được Kiva tự động biên dịch. .  Do việc biên dịch thủ công các danh mục rất tốn kém, nên Kiva đã tạo biểu mẫu này cho phần Field Partner (Trường Đối Tác) cho phép họ tiếp tục thông báo các khoản vay bằng  Vietnamese trong khi cung cấp thông tin có chất lượng & chính xác cho người cho vay Kiva.  ."

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Ofelia's Group

texts.en:
Ofelia T. is from the village of Minallo. She is 37 years old. Ofelia is the group leader of a ten-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Ofelia T..

Ofelia is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Ofelia runs a general store. The main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community. Ofelia has been engaged in her business for over ten years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2005, Ofelia joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Ofelia has successfully repaid a previous loan of 30,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Ofelia is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used for the same purpose. This loan will be the 11th loan taken out by Ofelia from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue to expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Norlito

texts.en:
Norlito B. is from the village of Brgy. Inaban,Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya.  He is 29 years old.  Norlito is married and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Norlito owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting  a variety of vegetables for sale.  Norlito has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 6,500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2008, Norlito joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Norlito has successfully repaid a previous loan of 15,000 PHP from ASKI.  This previous loan was used to pay for services to increase crop yield.  Norlito is requesting a new loan of 22,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure.  This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Norlito from ASKI.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to financially support immediate members of his family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Byambaa

texts.en:
Byambaa L. is 49 years old and a single mother with three children.  She lives with her youngest daughter in the Suhbaatar province of Mongolia in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence.  Her oldest son attends University.  

Byambaa operates a construction business specializing in interior and exterior decoration of buildings.  Byambaa has owned this business for almost 20 years and over this long time she has gained a lot of experience.  She also works as a contract worker for the construction companies and builds and decorates local individual houses and buildings according to customer orders.  Her earnings have enabled her to pay her son's tuition fees.  For the future, she plans to work with other constructor people.  She is a hardworking woman and is requesting a 200,000 MNT loan in order to pay her son's tuition fees.

loans.use: To pay her son's tuition fees

loans.name: Eugene

texts.en:
Eugene D. G. is from the village of Mapuroc, San Mateo.  She is 29 years old.  Eugene is single.  To make a living, Eugene owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling a variety of different products in the local community.  Eugene has been engaged in her business for over 2 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Eugene joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Eugene is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell.  This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Eugene from ASKI.  She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.name: Dexter

texts.en:

To make a living, Dexter owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising livestock.  While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from raising pigs for breeding.  Dexter has been engaged in his business for over 5 years and earns approximately 9,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Dexter joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.  Dexter has successfully repaid a previous loan of 20,000 PHP from ASKI.  This previous loan was used to purchase breeding livestock.  Dexter is requesting a new loan of 50,000 PHP which will be used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies.  This loan will be the 2nd loan taken out by Dexter from ASKI.  He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. 

About ASKI:

texts.en: Rose Marilyn M. is from the village of Marannao. She is 38 years old. Rose Marilyn is married and has five adult children. To make a living, Rose Marilyn plants and harvests corn for sale. Rose Marilyn has been engaged in her business for over 28 years and earns approximately 20,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) per harvest. In 2007, Rose Marilyn joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rose Marilyn is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will also be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to raise. This will be the seventh loan taken out by Rose Marilyn from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. loans.name: Gantulga

texts.en: Gantulga J. is 39 years old and lives with his wife and daughter in Suhbaatar province in central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian home tent, inside his brother's fence. His wife is currently unemployed and his daughter attends a local primary school. Gantulga operates a wooden products and furniture-production business in his town. He produces materials and wooden furniture used in gers according to his customers' orders. He started his ger-material and furniture-production business in 2006 and has gained much experience as a carpenter. For the future, Gantulga hopes to continue to grow and expand his business and have his own stable work place. He is requesting a 1,500,000 Mongolian tugriks loan to purchase wood and supplies for his ger and wooden-furniture business.

loans.use: To purchase wood and supplies

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence L. is from the village of Marannao. She is 53 years old. Florence is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Florence owns & operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting & harvesting corn for sale. Florence has been engaged in her business for over 19 years and earns approximately 30000 PHP per harvest or every four months.

In 2007, Florence joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Florence has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. Florence is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise. This loan will be the 8th loan taken out by Florence from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional seeds, seedlings & young crops to raise

loans.name: Hurelbaatar

texts.en: Hurelbaatar D. is 35 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent and fence in the Bayanhongor province of Mongolia. His wife works as a teacher for a local school, his oldest daughter is university student and his youngest daughter attends a local secondary school. He operates a transportation business between local towns and cities. He started his own business in 1996 by operating a consumer goods trading business at the local market which is currently managed by his wife during summer months. After years of successful operation, he was able to start new business of transportation business in 2004 and has since built a stable operation with his new business. One day, Hurelbaatar would like to be able to purchase a larger bus in order to transport more people between towns. He is a talkative, open minded and hardworking man and is requesting a 1,500,000 MNT loan so that he can purchase new machinery parts for his car.

loans.use: To purchase a larger bus in order to transport more people

loans.name: Naranhuu

texts.en: Naranhuu Y. is 57 years old and lives with her husband and five children and grandchild in Hovd province of Mongolia. She and her family live in a teacher's apartment. One child is a university student and one child attends a local school. Naranhuu operates a bakery production business in her town with the help of her daughter. She produces a variety of pastries and breads and sells her products through the local market. She started her business in 1995 and has since gained a lot of experience as a businesswoman. After almost 15 years of operation, her earnings have enabled her to provide her family and helped her daughter to get married. She is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan to purchase flour in bulk in order to make traditional cookies for the Tsagaan Sar, Mongolian lunisolar New Year festival.

loans.use: To purchase flour in bulk in order to make traditional cookies

loans.name: Rosalie

texts.en:
Rosalie C. is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. She is 34 years old. Rosalie is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Rosalie owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling both food & daily use products in the local community. Rosalie has been engaged in her business for over four years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2006, Rosalie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Rosalie has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional products to sell. Rosalie is requesting a new loan of 30000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. This loan will be the 7th loan taken out by Rosalie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand the borrower's business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional inventory & working capital

loans.name: Tsogtbaatar

texts.en: Tsogtbaatar D. is 43 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in the Hovd province of western Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His two sons both attend a local high school. Tsogtbaatar operates a retail meat business in his town with the help of his wife. He began his business in 1993 and after several years of operation, he has managed to establish himself in the business community. They purchase livestock, slaughter those livestock and sell the meat at retail prices at the local market. Tsogtbaatar is a talkative businessman and says, "This year, (the) price of livestock has increased greatly. Only four cows can be bought at 2,000,000 MNT (Mongolian tugriks)." He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan in order to buy more livestock to sell the meat for profits.

loans.use: To buy more livestock to sell the meat

loans.name: Ihbayar

texts.en: Ihbayar S. is 34 years old and lives with his wife and two sons in the Tuv province of central Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent, within his father's fence. His oldest son attends a local secondary school and his youngest son is in a kindergarten. His wife is a seamstress and produces a variety of clothes out of her home according to her customers' orders. Using his own truck, Ihbayar operates a coal-trading business in his town. He began his business in 2008, and since then, he has made enough money to buy a new truck for his transportation business. His business earnings have enabled him to provide for his entire family. For the near future, he plans to buy his own house and fence. He is requesting a 800,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT) loan in order to purchase necessary machinery parts for his truck and a large amount of coal to sell.

loans.use: To purchase necessary machinery parts and a large amount of coal

loans.name: Togtoh

texts.en:
Togtoh S., age 57, lives with his wife and three children in his own apartment in the Selenge province. His oldest daughter helps him with the business while his middle daughter is currently unemployed and his youngest son attends university in Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia. His wife is a trader between two border cities of Russian and Mongolia. 

Togtoh operates a grocery business in his town with help of his oldest daughter. Depending on sales, Togtoh procures food two times a month and in each procurement, he purchases grocery products worth between 3,000,000 and 4,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). 

He has been engaged in this business since 1995 and has built a stable operation. After many years of owning this business, he has not only gained a lot of experience as a businessman but also established a large customer base. His business earnings have enabled him to buy two cars, a garage and an apartment for his family and business. 

For the future, he plans to expand his business by selling clothing items based on his wife's business. His working capital has decreased due to the devaluation of Russian currency, the ruble. He also wants to purchase a car and therefore he is requesting a 3,000,000 MNT loan in order to increase his working capital for his grocery trading business.

loans.use: To increase his working capital

loans.name: Thelma

texts.en: Thelma B. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. Sta. Rosa, Danao City, Cebu. She earns her living by operating three business ventures: buying and selling charcoal, pig fattening and vegetable vending. Her husband, Federico B., who is 50 years old, works as a farmer to earn his living and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have seven children who are 9 to 25 years old. Thelma joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2008 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past four loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Thelma has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loans from NWTF helped her earn a monthly profit of 11,500 Philippines pesos (PHP), uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her fifth loan, she is borrowing PHP 13,000, which she intends to use to fund her various business operations so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and for the expansion of her pig-fattening business. Thelma B. is a Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means honorable) woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon. Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Funds for business operations

loans.name: Nuraly

texts.en:
Nuraly U. is 30 years old and married with three sons. He was born in the Batken region, in the south of Kyrgyzstan in a farm-worker’s family. From early childhood, he helped his parents in farming. After finishing school, he started to engage in land cultivating, but it was not very profitable because of the deficiency of cropland. 

In 2002, in order to find better place to live, Nuraly decided to move to the Chui region in the north of the country. Gaining a wide experience in raising livestock, Nuraly started his business in cattle breeding, which became the main source of income for his family. With initial capital of 10,000 Kyrgyzstan soms (KGS), he managed to earn about 12,000 KGS monthly.  Due to his strong efforts, Nuraly has established his farm and today it has two bull calves and still needs to be developed.  

Nuraly plans to use the loan of 80,000 KGS to broaden his business through buying three bull calves. With the revenues from the loan, he plans to broaden his business by purchasing more cattle.

Nuraly is doing his best to provide good conditions for his children. 

Bai-Tushum and Partners uses Kiva funding to target the especially vulnerable population. Bai-Tushum and Partners is one of the leading microfinance institutions in Kyrgyzstan. As a reliable financial partner, Bai-Tushum contributes to the economic development of the Kyrgyz Republic through the delivery of microfinance services in rural and urban areas that lead to increased employment and meet the interests of its clients and investors.

loans.use: To purchase cattle

loans.name: Marciana

texts.en: Marciana R.'s main source of income comes from fattening pigs for sale. She is 57 years old, married and has four grown-up children. She is from the village of Nungnungan, Cauayan City, Isabela. Marciana has been in her business for over six years and earns approximately 4,500 Philippine pesos (PHP) when she sells one of her animals. In 2007, Marciana joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Marciana has successfully repaid a previous loan from ASKI which was used to purchase livestock feed and other supplies. Marciana is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase breeding livestock. This will be her eighth loan from ASKI. She plans to use additional income to improve and expand her business. About ASKI: ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the central and northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs. loans.name: Harutyun

texts.en:
Harutyun G. is 45 years old. He lives in Tsovagyugh village in the Sevan area with his wife and his grown-up son. 

Harutyun is a cook and from 1984 until 1997, he worked on the Sevan lake coastal strip’s different cafés as a cook. Since 1997, Harutyun and his family have been engaged in animal breeding. On their farm, they have cows, sheep, goats, pigs and chickens that they rear on their own small plot of land.
 
Harutyun is asking for a 600,000 Armenian Dram loan to buy five calves for his farm, which will allow him to increase his family’s income in the near future. 

This is Harutyun’s second loan from Nor Horizon, and he made his repayments without delay.

loans.name: Amarjargal

texts.en: Amarjargal S. is 42 years old and lives with her husband and three children in Hovd province of Mongolia. She and her family live in their own house with a fence. Her two children attend a local school and her husband operates a transportation service in his town to supplement his family's income. Amarjargal operates a bakery-production business in her town. She produces a variety of pastries and breads and sells her products through the local market. She started her business in 2000 with insufficient equipment and tools by making her products in her ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic home tent where she and her family used to live. After years of successful operation, she managed to expand her business and purchased all the necessary equipment and tools worth 3,000,000 Mongolian tugriks (MNT). Moreover, she was able to have her own workplace over the years. With her business profits, she has improved her family's standard of living and her earnings have enabled her to build a two-floor house inside her fence. She is requesting a 2,500,000 MNT loan to purchase flour in bulk from Ulaanbaatar, a capital city of Mongolia, in order to make a variety of pastries and breads.

loans.use: To purchase flour in bulk from Ulaanbaatar

loans.name: Ganhuyag

texts.en: Ganhuyag D. is 49 years old and lives with his wife and two children in the Hovd province of Mongolia. He and his family live together in a ger, a traditional Mongolian nomadic tent and fence. His one child attends a local school while his son helps him with the business. He operates a car repair service out of his fence. Ganhuyag started this business in 1996 and has built a stable operation since then. Over the many years of operation, he has gained a lot of experience as a repairer who is specialized in repairing diesel engines. He is teaching his skills to his son. Ganhuyag is requesting a 700,000 MNT loan to purchase more machinery parts for his car repair service.

He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of his family. AAbout ASKI: ASKI is one of the pioneer microfinance institutions in the Philippines committed to serve the needy in Central and Northern Luzon through socio-economic development and holistic transformation. *Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

location.town: Brgy. Inaban, Dupax del Norte, Nueva Vizcaya

loans.name: Merlinda

texts.en:
Merlinda L. is a 46-year-old married woman who supports her family by operating 3 business ventures: tobacco sales, pig fattening and coffee sales. She lives in Brgy. 9, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She has been a member of NWTF-Project Dungganon since 1997 and has improved her living conditions with the help of her loans from NWTF and through her own efforts. By working hard in her three businesses, she is gradually making her family more economically stable. She now earns an average monthly income of PHP 10,000. Merlinda is now borrowing PHP 30,000 in order to fund the operations of her tobacco business. This will be her 19th loan from NWTF-Project Dungganon. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500, which she paid off well within its term, was just another step in her journey toward economic freedom. Merlinda hopes to elevate her family's living conditions and ensure their future well-being by following the Dungganon way.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking the link to the NWTF Kiva lending team on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: to fund the operations of her tobacco business

loans.name: Galbadrah

texts.en:
Galbadrah N. is a married man and lives with his two adult children in the Chingeltei district of Ulaanbaatar, the capital of Mongolia. His two children both attend university. Galbadrah and his wife operate a construction business specializing in the interior and exterior decoration of buildings. He has owned this business for the past 9 years and over this time he has gained a lot of experience.

Before starting his business, he worked as a teacher until 2001 (after graduating from university as a teacher in 1991). After years of successful operation, he was able to buy a new car which enabled him to start operating a new transportation service business to supplement his earnings. Today his working capital exceeds 2,000,000 MNT and monthly sales has reached a level of 800,000 MNT.

Galbadrah is a business man and says, "I want to build a house for my oldest son in the future." He is requesting a 1,200,000 MNT loan in order to purchase necessary materials and supplies for his construction decoration business.

loans.use: To purchase necessary materials and supplies

loans.name: Marietta

texts.en: Marietta B. is a widow who lives in Barangay 9, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a tobacco business. Marietta joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 12 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Marietta has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 18,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 5,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 13th loan, she is borrowing 20,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy more tobacco for her business so that she can continue to save up for the future education of her children and to buy home appliances. Marietta B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress out of earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue in its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by visiting the NWTF lending team on Kiva to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase tobacco to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth T. is a married woman who lives in Brgy. 7, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating 2 business ventures: a butcher shop and salt sales. Her husband, Roberto, 50 years old, earns his living as a vendor and also helps in his wife's business activities. They have three children who are between the ages of 14 and 20.

Elizabeth joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1997 because she hoped for something better for her family. With the help of her past 19 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon and her own efforts, Elizabeth has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty. Her previous loan of PHP 29,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 10,000, raising the family's standard of living. This time, for her 20th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 30,000, which she intends to use to buy more meat and poultry to sell to help her save up for her children's future education. Elizabeth T. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams.

About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF) is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). loans.use: to fund the operations of her butcher shop

loans.name: Elisa

texts.en: Elisa B. is a widow who lives in Barangay 8, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a food vending (native delicacies) business. Elisa joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 1999 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 18 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Elisa has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of 15,000 PHP helped her earn a monthly profit of 9,000 PHP, uplifting the family's standard of living. This time, for her 19th loan, she is borrowing 15,000 PHP, which she intends to use to buy ingredients for the food she makes so that she can continue to save up for future home repairs. Elisa B. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. About NWTF: In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable).
