loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 41-year-old married woman. She is from Lebanon, living with her husband and three young children who are attending school. She used to work with her husband who has owned a tailoring and clothing shop for the past ten years. Currently, she is the proud new owner of a gift and accessories shop which she opened in 2009. She is thankful for her new business income; it helps with the family’s finances. 

Today, she is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase additionA. products to serve her clients better by offering new items in order to expand her profit.

loans.use: to purchase additional products

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna J. is from the village of Brgy. Homestead, Bambang,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 57 years old. Myrna is married and has 5 adult-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business venture in the retail sector running a general store. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap & toothpaste in the local community. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 12 years and earns approximately 4000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Myrna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ailliene

texts.en:
Ailliene N. is a married woman who lives in Crossing Moises, Brgy. Camangcamang, Isabela, Negros Occidental. She earns her living by operating a pig raising  business.  Her husband Nestor, who is 40 years old, works as a driver to earn his living, and also helps with his wife's business activities.  They have five children who are between 1 to  20 years old. 

Ailliene joined NWTF-Project Dungganon in 2000 because she aspired for something better for her family. With the help of her past 13 loans from NWTF-Project Dungganon, Ailliene has been incrementally lifting her family out of poverty by the sweat of her brow. Her previous loan of PHP 19,500 helped her earn a monthly profit of PHP 4,500, uplifting the family's standard of living.  This time, for her 14th cycle loan, she is borrowing PHP 10,000, which she intends to buy feed and vaccines for her pigs so that she could continue to save up for future home repairs and the education of her children. 

Ailliene N. is a Dungganon woman who is following an honorable path toward the achievement of her dreams. 

About NWTF: 
In a world full of challenges, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation (NWTF), is making a difference in the lives of thousands of women through Project Dungganon (a Hiligaynon word that means Honorable). Through the alleviation program, NWTF is empowering these women to progress from earning less than $1 a day to achieving realities that surpass even their dreams. They have taken a life path that will ultimately make them Dungganon - a title of esteem that is bestowed to a member of a community who has earned the respect through a lifetime of hard and honest work. Help NWTF continue its mission to help the poorest in the Philippines by clicking  the link to the   NWTF Kiva lending team  on Kiva.org to join our team.

loans.use: Purchase feed and vaccines for the pigs

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
Myrna S. is from the village of Brgy. Homestead, Bambang,Nueva Vizcaya. She is 46 years old. Myrna is married and has 4 school-aged children. To make a living, Myrna owns & operates a business venture in the food sector making & selling food. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from preparing and selling cooked food for daily meals. Myrna has been engaged in her business for over 5 years and earns approximately 4500 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Myrna joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Myrna is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This loan will be the 1st loan taken out by Myrna from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay the tuition fees for her children. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly of farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase more equipment and tools

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 37-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two little school-aged children. He works as a sugar, dairy and food products distributor in the east and north of Lebanon. He works as a traveling salesman, selling products to local markets wholesale. He has also worked as a local school driver since 2003. In Lebanon, it is common at all levels of society for people to have multiple businesses. It is often not enough to have an office salary or small shop to cover the increasing costs of food, housing, and other family expense. He has obtained a first Kiva loan and he is thankful for the results.

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to increase his inventory, his business sales and therefore his profits. He believes that his business will improve over the long term.

loans.use: to increase his inventory

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 38-year-old married man. He is from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and three children. He has been working as an experienced taxi driver since 2001. He offers his private transportation services to students and employees.  He obtained his first Kiva loan, and he was an excellent client with payments on the dot. He represents the only financial support to his family.

 Today, he is requesting to borrow a bigger amount of $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to change his car’s engine and complete the needed amends so he can grant his clients an enhanced and more comfortable service.

loans.use: to change his car’s engine and complete the needed amends

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 27-year-old married man from Lebanon. He lives with his wife and two children. He works as a products distributor and he uses a delivery van as his mean of transport. He delivers various types of products to different places. He obtained his first Kiva loan and he was a very good client with payments on time. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $2000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to make the necessary repairs on his vehicle and replace his van’s trunk with a new one to preserve his products in a good and healthy space.

loans.use: to make the necessary repairs on his vehicle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase additional products

loans.name: Grigor

texts.en:
Grigor D. was born in 1960 in Ijevan city, where he now lives. He is married and has 3 children: two sons and a daughter. Grigor’s daughter is a student, while Grigor, his wife and their sons are engaging in a fruits and vegetable business, which they have run since 1993. 

During these years, thanks to his business income, Grigor was able to buy a van which he uses for fruits and vegetables delivery from various villages to the Ijevan market where he carries out his business. He uses his car as a stall from which he sells his merchandise. 

With his business incomes Grigor is able to meet his family needs and pay for his daughter’s education.  

Grigor is seeking an 800.000 AMD loan to increase his trading assortment: he intends to buy citruses which are in popular demand before New Year along with other fruits and vegetable. 

Grigor has received loans from Nor Horizon 3 times and he has never missed a loan repayment.

loans.use: To buy citrus and other fruits and vegetables to resell

loans.name: Harriet

texts.en:
Harriet is 34 years old and married with four children. She works in the transportation sector, which is very lucrative for her, and she hopes to own at least two taxis. 

Harriet lives in her own house in Fort Portal Uganda and she is longing to finish building it. She is requesting a loan to complete her house.

loans.use: to complete house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to renew his construction tools

loans.name: Manal

texts.en:
Manal is a housewife and the mother of four daughters and four sons. Manal's husband is a Palestinian National Authority employee with a decent salary; however, the salary doesn't cover house expenses and school tuition fees. Therefore, her husband, Muhammad, works in the evening as a taxi driver in the city. The second source of income helps the family live a better life. Manal came to FATEN and took out a loan to pay for car licencing fees and regular car maintenance.

Manal's husband, Muhammad, appears in the picture as Manal is a conservative woman who is not comfortable with having her picture posted on the web.

loans.use: To pay for car licencing fees and regular car maintenance

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 33-year-old married man and the father of two young children. He has helped his brother who works as a blacksmith over the past eight years. In 2008, he started working independently from his brother’s shop. In addition to his private work, he still helps him from time to time.  

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1200 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to purchase an iron welding machine to be able to take more orders. He is optimistic about his business prospects and he is certain that with the help of the loan, his business income will grow. In the future, he hopes to put aside the needed savings to be able to open his own shop.

loans.use: to purchase an iron welding motor

loans.name: John

texts.en: John is 40 old and married with six children. He and his family live in a permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. John has been selling and buying maize for fifteen years and the business is profitable, as he has been able to build a house. John’s major challenge is the high cost of rent and electricity for his business. John is requesting a loan to buy maize to sell. In the future, he would like to own a store and become a central supplier.

loans.use: to buy maize

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is 27 years old and married with a child. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda, with a dream of building a permanent house in the next five years. 

He has worked in motorcycle transport for four years now and this has enabled him to meet his daily family expenses. His dream is to buy a motorcycle as he is currently just an employee. Francis needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle for transport business.

loans.name: Jimmy

texts.en:
Jimmy is a 38-year-old married man with three children living in a rented  house in Fort Portal. Uganda, with a desire to build his own home in the next three years. 

He has been working in the retail trade for seven years now and the business is still profitable amidst challenges, such as limited finances to meet customer demands. Jimmy needs the credit  to buy soft drinks, rice and groundnuts for sale.

loans.use: Buying soft drinks, rice and groundnuts to sell

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon living with his parents. Despite his young age, he has gained good experience working as a house painter, starting six years ago. He works on a freelance basis upon the customers’ request. As is common in Lebanon, he helps his father with the family income. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase a compressor and paint for a new project. He needs to be prepared to satisfy the client and build a good business reputation. In the future, he hopes to continue the growth of his business and be able to take on construction projects in order to expand his business operation.

loans.use: to purchase a compressor and paint

loans.name: Adolf

texts.en:
Adolf is 41 years old and married to a teacher with three children. He lives in Fort Portal, Uganda. He owns a permanent house for residence and his family's dream is to build a bigger house. 

He is a motorcycle cyclist and has been in the transport business for two years now with a challenge from high license fees. His vision is to own at least three motorcycles. Adolf needs the loan to buy a motorcycle.

loans.use: Buying a motorcycle

loans.name: Ben

texts.en:
Ben is a 42-year-old married man with four children renting a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. His family goal is to build a house of his own and educate his children. 

He is a farmer and has a very big banana plantation and cows, which have enabled him to educate his two children up to the university level amidst challenges of seasonal changes. Ben needs the loan to buy chickens and their feed.

loans.use: Buying chickens and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: Buying maize for selling

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 44-year-old single man with two school-aged children. He is from Lebanon.  Beginning 25 years ago, he has build up good experience working as a plumber. He works on a freelance basis upon the customers’ request. 

Today, he is requesting to borrow $1000 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l to purchase special power machinery and additional tools. He needs to be prepared to satisfy his clients and have a good business reputation. In the future, he hopes to continue the growth of his business and be able to take on construction projects in order to expand his business operation.

loans.use: to purchase special power machinery and additional tools

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a 21-year-old single woman living with her parents in Fort Portal, Uganda. Her desire is to be economically independent from her family. Jackline has a retail shop and has been in business for two years now, first as an employee and now as the shop owner. Jackline is requesting a loan to buy salt, sugar, and soap.

loans.use: to purchase salt, sugar, and soap

loans.name: Laila

texts.en:
Laila is a 40-year-old Palestinian housewife and the mother of three daughters and four sons. Most of them are school students. Laila's husband is an employee. To have a second source of income, Laila took out a loan from FATEN to help her husband purchase a larger variety of goods to sell in the grocery store.

Laila's husband, Yahia, appears in the picture above as she is a religious woman and doesn't want her picture on the web.

loans.use: To purchase a variety of goods to sell in the store

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William is 26 years old and married with two children. He works as the supervisor of a tea estate and also as an outgrower (small contract farmer). This enables him to generate enough income to meet his family’s needs.

William and his family live a semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. William is requesting a loan to prepare his garden for the next season. In the future, his desire is to complete a permanent house.

loans.use: to prepare garden for next season

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 22-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and one brother. He has been working as a private teacher since 2008 to earn income. With his business income, he is able to help his father with the family expenses. 

As is common among young Lebanese men, he has a job and is pursuing education at the same time. Today, he is requesting to borrow $600 from Kiva partner Ameen s.a.l. to pay his university fees. He is studying Business Administration and this is his second year. 

In the future, he is planning to start his career in a company and be able to help his parents with his income.

loans.use: to pay his university fees

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 23-year-old single man living with his parents. He is from Lebanon. He’s a good-looking man – that’s why he has been working as a publicity and video clips actor for almost three years. He is also attending university. He works hard to manage his time between his business and his education. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1,200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to pay for his university fees. He is studying architecture and is in his first year. He studied three years with a medicine major but he was not happy so he switched to architecture. In the future, he is planning to start working in an architecture company to gain experience and to be able to expand his career.

loans.use: To pay for his university fees

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en:
This Kiva borrower is a 20-year-old single man from Lebanon. He lives with his parents and two siblings. This young man works in a local mini market. His work is very important because with this income he is able to satisfy his needs and help his parents pay for his university fees. As with the majority of Lebanese students, he is faced with the day-to-day challenges of working while at the same time pursuing an education. 

Today, he is requesting a loan of $1000 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to pay for his courses at the university. He is studying biochemistry and this is his second year. In the future, he is planning to start his career in a laboratory to gain experience and be able to help his parents with his income.

loans.use: To pay for his courses at the university

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 52-year-old married man and the father of one child who is attending the university. He started a pastry shop almost 10 years ago. He has been involved in this occupation for the past 25 years. He works hard to be able to provide a good education for his child. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1500 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to pay for his daughter's courses at the university. She is studying translation and she is in her first year. In the future, his daughter is planning to continue with a Master's degree and work in an embassy.

loans.use: To pay for his daughter's courses at the university

loans.name: Concorde Plus Group

texts.en:
Derlin is the chairman of a community bank named “Concorde Plus,” which is composed of 10 micro-entrepreneurs united in solidarity to receive Kiva loans through IMF HOPE DRC with the goal of developing their businesses. 

Derlin is 42 years old and married with five children between the ages of one and 18. Four of his children attend school. Derlin runs a telephone booth and sells eggs. He started his business in 2003 with 200 USD and it has prospered since then with hard work. Derlin’s business is located in the city of Kinshasa. He has a good credit history with Hope DRCongo and has successfully repaid six loans.

Derlin is requesting a loan to purchase prepaid telephone cards and increase his inventory of eggs. He makes a weekly profit of 65 USD and wants to increase his working capital. In the future, Derlin’s ambition is to become the sole telephone card and egg provider in his area.

loans.use: to purchase telephone cards and eggs

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay for new house appliances

loans.name: Production Plus Group

texts.en:
Marceline, aged 56, is the manager of the Community Bank named “Production Plus”. It is composed of 12 members united in solidarity for receiving Kiva loans with the goal of developing their businesses.

Marceline has been part of the micro-enterprise world since 1998, having started by selling loaves of bread with a beginning capital of $20. Today, she sells corn and manioc. She has been with Hope since October 2009. Progressively, her business has prospered thanks to accumulated profit and good management. The loan she’ll obtain next will be used to buy some sacks of corn, manioc and charcoal to resell with the goal of increasing her profits. Her business generates a profit of $60 per week. Marceline’s ambition is to become a bread wholesaler.

She is a widowed mother of eight children between the ages 16 and 26, four of whom attend school. She also takes care of two grandchildren.

loans.use: To purchase some sacks of corn and manioc for resale

location.country: The Democratic Republic of the Congo

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 52-year-old married man and the father of four children. One of his children is attending university. He has been working in the agriculture field for the past 24 years. He sells agricultural products such as fertilizers and seeds. He works hard to be able to provide a good education for his child. Today, he is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to pay for his son's courses at the university. His son is studying Business Administration and is in his second year.

loans.use: To pay for his son's courses at the university

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.en: This Kiva borrower is a 21-year-old married woman from Lebanon, living with her husband. She's been the owner of an accessories and clothes shop since 2008. Because of her reputation, she has built up a good number of customers who are very satisfied with her work. She contributes with her husband to the family’s income. She is willing to have a baby in the near future, so she hopes to earn some additional income to get ready for the maternity period. Today, she is requesting a loan of $1200 from Kiva's partner, Ameen s.a.l., to purchase new clothes and accessories for her clients who are asking her to offer them the new collections.

loans.use: To purchase new clothes and accessories

loans.name: Alvard

texts.en:
Alavard N. is from the village of Gharibjanyan in the Shirak region of Armenia.   She is married with three children.  Alavard’s three sons are twenty, twenty three and twenty four years old.  She has a high school education and has been working as a farmer, growing vegetables and raising cattle for the past twenty two years.  

She dreams of saving enough money to help her sons build their own homes.  She currently supports her son, who is serving in the army, and provides agricultural produce to relatives living in the city.  She is looking for a loan to purchase seeds, fertilizer and feed.  With this investment she is expecting the family income to increase by twenty percent.  She likes the convenience of microfinance loans and is pleased with the services.  By growing her business she can continue living in Gharibjanyan, the place of her birth.

loans.use: To purchase seeds, fertilizer and feed.

loans.name: Aida

texts.en:
Aida lives in the village of Anoushayan in the Shirak region of Armenia.  She is the proud mother of three children: a thirteen year old son, sixteen and seventeen year old daughters.  Aida has a college education.  With her husband they have been working on the family farm for over twenty years.  

Aida considers herself to be a hard working sincere person and would like to grow her business.  She also helps relatives living in the town of Artik with produce from her farm.  She is looking for a loan to purchase additional calves.  According to her business plan, this investment will increase the family income by around twenty five percent.  In additional to growing the family business she dreams of saving enough money for her children to go to college.  Currently her oldest daughter is studying at university.  Aida enjoys living in Anoushayan close to her relatives and good friends.

loans.use: To purchase calves.

loans.name: Arevhat

texts.en:
Arevhat B. lives in Ljevan city.  She is married and has 3 sons.  Her two sons are already married and live separately from their parents. 
Arevhat works at Ljevan city’s court as a secretary and at the same time she is engaged in land cultivation and animal breeding. 

Arvehat says her husband and parents-in-law (who are already retired on a pension) helps her a lot in this occupation.  On her farm she has some cows, chickens and turkeys; and in her garden she grows prolific trees such as apple and pear trees, etc.
 
Arevhat says farming take a lot of time, but it is profitable.  She wants to organize swine breeding on her farm, so she is asking for a 900.000 AMD loan, which she will spend to buy some pigs.  She also wants to buy fodder for her farm animals.  She plans on using the future income for barn repairs.  
This is Arevhat's 3rd loan from Nor Horizon.

loans.use: To buy some pigs and fodder for her farm animals.

loans.name: Antonio Isaias

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Antonio Isaias; el tiene 72 años de edad y es casado y tiene 6 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos como papa y maíz, el vende en el mercado de Huancaro de forma independiente desde los 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,el socio quiere ampliar el negocio de venta de papa y maíz. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar papa y maíz al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Antonio Isaias belongs to the “Buena Esperanza” (Good Hope) Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the Cusco province and Cusco department.

Antonio Isaias is 72 years old, married, and has six children.  He alternates his daily activities with the business of selling products like potatoes and corn.  He sells independently at the Huancaro market from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  He wants to expand his business of selling potatoes and corn.

He is requesting the loan to buy potatoes and corn wholesale.  He is happy about the loan, and he pledges to make his payments on time.

loans.use: To buy potatoes and corn wholesale

Delia Ruth belongs to the “Buena Esperanza” (Good Hope) Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the Cusco province and Cusco department.

Emilia; ella tiene 52 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como perfumes,lápiz labiales,cremas para el rostro y entre otros,ella vende en forma independiente ofreciendo al publico en general. She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.name: Los Arbolitos Group

texts.es:
El siguiente grupo se llama los "Arbolitos", el grupo es de la comunidad de Tres Estrellas, Municipio de San José del Rincón. La comunidad es de muy escasos recursos, hay mucha milpa, la gente se dedica a sembrar, cuidar animales, regularmente los hombres trabajan como albañiles, lo van aprendiendo de sus papás y ahí se va de generación en generación. 

El grupo lo integran 8 personas, 7 mujeres y 1 hombre:
1.-Feliciana José A. de 37 años de edad, el préstamo lo solicito para criar borregos.

2.-Crescencia C. A., 28 años de edad, solicito el préstamo para comprar borregos

3.-Magdalena M. S., 37 años de edad, solicito el préstamo para comprar pollos y  borregos

4.-Damarid L. P., 28 años de edad, va ocupar el dinero en invertir en su tienda de abarrotes

5.-Maria Catalina S. C., 64 años de edad, solicito su préstamo para comprar animales para criar

6.-Maximo M. I., 55 años de edad, pidió su préstamo para comprar becerros de cría

7.-Leonor M. S., 33 años de edad, solicito su préstamo para comprar tela para bordar

8.-Maura José Alvino, 45 años de edad, solicito su préstamo para telas de bordado.

Como pueden ver los integrantes se dedican a la agricultura, siembran maíz, crían animales y los venden, de esta forma se mantiene la gente del grupo, y de alguna entrada que el esposo de las señoras lleguen a tener, por lo general son albañiles en esta comunidad, es gente trabajadora, gente sencilla y humilde, tienen la costumbre en sus fiestas de dar mucho de comer, en ese sentido a pesar de su condición no son nada codos, todo lo contrario.

Doña Maura es la tesorera del grupo, tiene 45 años de edad, vive con su esposo que se dedica a la construcción, de hijos en total son 8, lamentablemente ya falleció uno, solo tiene 7, 2 de sus hijos ya se juntaron, 2 más trabajan, 3 aun dependen de doña Maura, son dos niños y una niña, los tres están estudiando. Doña Maura tiene casa propia y vive con su esposo.
Doña Maura para apoyarse económicamente vende bordados que hace, necesita mucho material por esa razón solicito un préstamo para poder comprar la tela, el hilo y las agujas, sabe bordar manteles y hacer chalecos pero lo que más vende son servilletas, nos platica que lo más difícil de vender son los manteles por lo grande y porqué son más caros, también es complicado vender las servilletas ya que la mayoría de la gente sabe bordar, y es un obstáculo para doña Maura, lo que hace doña Maura es salir a otros lado en donde la gente no borde y compre lo que hace, por ejemplo se va al centro del municipio o le busca, porque hay zonas en donde se perdió la costumbre y es diferente tipo de gente pero que le gustan las servilletas o algún mantel para decorar la casa. 
Doña Mura tiene la esperanza de comprar con ganancias unos pollos y algún borrego para criar y después vender, pero quisiera obtener ese beneficio sin necesidad de deber dinero.
También quiere beneficiar a su familia con la escuela de sus hijos, ya sea para comprarles el uniforme o los útiles escolares. 
Doña Maura quiere una mejor vida, y quiere que sus hijos no tengan la misma suerte que ella, por eso quieren que se preparen para que tengan mejores oportunidades y una mejor vida. Y doña Maura sabe que para que pase eso depende mucho de ella y su esposo.
texts.en:
This group is called "Los Arbolitos" ["The Little Trees"]. The group is from the Tres Estrellas community, in the Municipality of San J. del Rincon. The community has very few resources. There are many fields, and the people work sowing crops and caring for animals. Usually men work as bricklayers, learning the trade from their fathers from generation to generation.
The group is made up of 8 people; 7 women and 1 man:
1.- Feliciana José A., age 37, is requesting the loan for raising sheep.

2.-Crescencia C. A., 28, is requesting the loan to purchase sheep.

3.-Magdalena M. S., 37, is requesting the loan to purchase chickens and sheep.

4.-Damarid L. P., 28, will use the money to invest in her grocery store.

5.-Maria Catalina S. C., 64, is requesting her loan to purchase animals to raise.

6.-Maximo M. I., 55, is requesting his loan to purchase calves to raise.

7.-Leonor M. S., 33, is requesting her loan to purchase fabric to embroider.

8.-Maura José Alvino, 45, is requesting her loan for fabric to embroider.

As we can see, the members work in agriculture, sowing corn and raising animals to sell. This is how they make their living, along with any income that the women's husbands obtain; in general, they are bricklayers in this community. They are hard-working people, unassuming and humble. In their festivities, their custom is to provide much food. Thus, despite their conditions they are not at all stingy; on the contrary.
Mrs. Maura is the group's treasurer. She is 45 and lives with her husband who works in construction. She had 8 children, but unfortunately one has passed away and she only has 7 children. 2 of her children are already married, 2 others work, and the other three, two little boys and one little girl, still depend on Maura. They are in school. Maura has her own home and lives with her husband. In order to support herself economically, Maura sells embroidery that she makes. She needs a lot of material, and so she is requesting a loan to be able to purchase fabric, thread and needles. She knows how to make tablecloths and make sweaters, which are more expensive. It is complicated to sell napkins because the majority of people know how to embroider, and this is an obstacle for Maura. She goes to other areas where the people to not embroider and will buy what she makes. For example, she goes to the center of the municipality, because there are areas where they have lost the custom and there are different types of people who wante napkins or tablecloths to decorate their homes. She hopes to use her earnings to buy some chickens and a lamb to raise and then sell, but she would like to do this without having to borrow money. She also wants to provide her family with the benefit of having her children in school, through buying them uniforms or school supplies. Maura wants a better life, and she doesn't want her children to have the same luck that she had. Thus she wants them to prepare themselves to have better opportunities and a better life. Maura knows that this depends greatly on her and her husband.

loans.use: To purchase embroidering cloth, threads and needles to sell napkins.

loans.name: Alejandrina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal”VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alejandrina; ella tiene 62 años D. edad, casada y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio D. tienda D. abarrotes donD. la socia venD. productos D. primera necesidad como arroz, azúcar y leche entre otros productos más, a la vez la socia venD. anticuchos por la noche en su mismo negocio.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación D. su negocio y para la compra D. insumos como carne, papa, entre otros.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota
texts.en:
Alejandrina belongs to the Virgen del Rosario Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the Cusco province and Cusco department.

Alejandrina is 62 years old, married, and she has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business.  She sells basic needs products like rice, sugar, milk, and more products.  In the evenings she also sells “anticuchos” (a Peruvian dish consisting of meat that is marinated in a dressing maD. of aji peppers, skewered on sticks or metal rods, and cooked on a grill) in her store. 

She is requesting the loan to stock her business and to buy ingredients like meat, potatoes, and others.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To stock her business and to buy ingredients like meat, potatoes, and others

loans.name: Mara Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Mara Cecilia R. A. es una laboriosa mujer que vive en el barrio el Bosque de la turística ciudad de Cartagena. Vive con su esposo y dos hijos de 16 y 12 años. Se dedica a producir y vender  almuerzos a empleados y obreros de algunas construcciones. Antes de ésta actividad, ella se dedicaba a lavar y planchar ropa a domicilio, pero en una ocasión, uno de sus clientes le propuso que preparara varios almuerzos para algunos obreros extras que habían contratado en una empresa, y ella aceptó. Le fue tan bien, que se ganó en un día lo que devengaba en tres días de lavado y planchado. Actualmente ella genera el 70% de los ingresos de su hogar.El negocio funciona en su casa, esto le permite estar cerca de su familia todo el día, pero planea el próximo año alquilar un local para independizar la microempresa y trabajar con más comodidad. Hoy en día vende un promedio de 30 almuerzos a un precio de $ 4.000 COP cada uno. El margen promedio de ganancia es del 40%. Para lograr los despachos oportunamente debió contratar los servicios de su hermana que le ayuda en picar verduras y relajar las carnes. Este es el primer crédito que la señora Mara tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y se propone invertirlo en su totalidad en la compra de víveres al por mayor para obtener descuentos por volumen de compra y pago en efectivo. La señora Mara dice que el éxito de su negocio está en la calidad de sus comidas, porque las prepara con muchas verduras frescas que le dan un toque original y nunca le hacen daño a nadie. El plato que más le encargan es arroz de coco con pescado frito, patacón y ensalada de aguacate. Esa es la comida insignia de la hermosa ciudad de Cartagena.
texts.en:
Mara Cecilia R. A. is a hard-working woman who lives in El Bosque neighborhood, in the tourist city of Cartagena.  She lives with her husband and two children aged 16 and 12.  Mara makes and sells lunches to employees and workmen on construction sites.  Before she started this business, she used to wash and iron people's clothes in their homes but one of her customers once suggested that she make some lunches for some extra workmen who had been hired in a nearby company and she accepted.  Mara's business did so well that she managed to make in just one day what she normally made in three days of washing and ironing.

Mara currently makes 70% of her household's income.  Her business is located in her home which allows her to be near her family all day.  However, next year she plans to rent premises so that she can make her small business more independent and work more comfortably.  Mara sells an average of 30 lunches at 4,000 Colombian pesos each.  Her average profit margin is 40%.  In order to make her deliveries on time she had to hire her sister to help her chop vegetables and cure the meat. 

This is the first loan that Mara has taken from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she will invest all of it in buying foodstuffs wholesale so that she can obtain discounts by buying in bulk and paying cash.  Mara says that the success of her business lies in the quality of her meals because she prepares them with a lot of fresh vegetables which gives them an original touch.  They never harm anyone.  Her most requested dish is coconut rice with fried fish, fried plantain slices and avocado salad.  This is the flagship dish of the beautiful city of Cartagena.

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs wholesale

loans.name: La Ilusion De Huitzililla Group

texts.es:
Este grupo solidario se llama La Ilusión de Huitzililla, se encuentra localizado en la comunidad de Huitzililla, Ayala, en el estado de Morelos, México. este grupo está conformado por 9 integrantes mujeres que se conocen y son vecinas, ellas son la señora Ángela F. L. va a comprar con su préstamo una vaca, azúcar, fruta para hacer el yogurt para surtir su negocio, la señora Marlen T. P. va a comprar refrescos, carne, verduras para la venta de los tacos, para surtir su negocio, la señora Adriana M. Pérez va a comprar escobas, cepillos, sosa liquida, ganchos de ropa para surtir su negocio, Félix G. Azorín va a comprar huaraches por mayoreo para surtir su negocio, la señora Petra E. Anzurez va a comprar topper para surtir sus pedidos y va a comprar de abarrotes aceite, jabón, azúcar, la señora Delfina F. M. va a comprar topper para tener bien surtido su negocio, la señora Rosalía L. S. va a comprar artículos como fibras, estropajos, escobetas, cepillos, lazos, y pinzas par la ropa, la señora Lucila Hernández Cárdenas va a comprar Brasier, pantimedia, lencería para surtir sus pedidos que tiene, la señora María Eugenia M. Pérez va a comprar aceite, jabón, azúcar, papel higiénico, chiles, mayonesa, refrescos para surtir su negocio. 
La señora Lucila Hernández Cárdenas es la representante del grupo, ella tiene 31 años de edad, estudio hasta el 2º. Año de preparatoria, ella es casada y tiene 2 hijos Abrahán tiene 4 años y va a preescolar, Ismael tiene 3 años, la señora Lucila solicitó su préstamo para surtir su negocio de Lencería va a comprar brasier, panty, lencería, ella inicio su negocio hace 10 años aprendió sola, vende lencería por catálogo anda ofreciendo sus productos fuera de su casa con sus vecinos y las personas que viven en Huitzililla, su negocio es ambulante va caminando o en bicicleta, su negocio es importante porque le da beneficios, ella maneja como quiere su negocio y se siente orgullosa de vender de lo mejor, sus clientas son las muchachas, las señoras y los caballeros y les ofrece blusas, sostenes, pantaletas, baby dool, tangas, pantalones deportivos, su negocio es conocido porque anda casa por casa y por la marca de los productos que vende. 
Su negocio enfrenta la competencia y otras 2 personas que venden los mismos productos en Huitzililla, las ganancia a veces las va ahorrando y a veces las vuelve a invertir, la señora Lucila quiere ampliar su negocio meter más mercancía de otras marcas y lo piensa lograr a través de los prestamos, su negocio ha ayudado a su familia económicamente, ella tiene planes de progresar y sus sueños de seguir adelante, seguir creciendo en su negocio y está feliz con este préstamo que le dan porque va a surtir su negocio, las mejorías que desea para el futuro de sus hijos son que vivan mejor, tratar que no les falte nada y piensa que este préstamo le va a ayudar invirtiéndolo y echándole ganas al negocio. 
Las integrantes del grupo quieren decirle a Kiva y a Fundación Realidad “gracias a ustedes podemos tener nuestros negocio, gracias por apoyarnos y ayudarnos”. Huitzililla es un pueblo de clima caluroso y seco, en tiempos de lluvia se pone verde y les gusta porque es el lugar donde viven.
texts.en:
This solidarity group is called 'La Ilusión de Huitzililla'.  It is located in the community of Huitzililla, Ayala, in the State of Morelos, Mexico.  The group has 9 female members who know each other and are neighbors.  The members are:
Ángela F. L. who will use her loan to buy a cow, sugar and fruit for making yogurt to stock her business
Marlen T. P. who will buy soft drinks, meat and vegetables for making tacos, to stock her business
Adriana M. Pérez who will buy brooms, brushes, caustic soda and clothes hangers, to stock her business
Félix G. Azorín who will buy rubber sandals wholesale, to stock her business
Petra E. Anzurez who will buy sports shoes to fill her orders and also groceries, oil, soap and sugar
Delfina F. M. who will buy sports shoes to keep her business well stocked
Rosalía L. S. who will buy items such as scouring pads, small brooms, brushes, rope and clothes pegs
Lucila Hernández Cárdenas who will buy bras, pantyhose and lingerie to fill her orders
María Eugenia M. Pérez who will buy oil, soap, sugar, toilet paper, chilis, mayonnaise and soft drinks to stock her business.

Lucila Hernández Cárdenas is the group's representative.  She is 31 years old and studied up to the second year of high school.  She is married and has two children: 4 year-old Abrahán who goes to pre-school and 3 year-old Ismael.  Lucila requested her loan to stock her lingerie business.  She will buy bras, pantyhose and lingerie.  She set up her business 10 years ago and is self taught.  She sells lingerie through a catalog.  She walks outside offering her products for sale to her neighbors and the people who live in Huitzililla.  Her business is itinerant, she walks or travels by bicycle.  Her business is important because it provides her with benefits.  She manages her business as she wishes and she feels proud of selling the best products.  Her customers are girls, women and men.  She offers them blouses, bras, underpants, baby doll pajamas, tanga briefs and sports pants.

Lucila's business is well known because she goes door to door and it is also well known for the brand of products that she sells.  Her business faces competition and there are another 2 people who sell the same products in Huitzililla.  She sometimes saves her profits and sometimes she re-invests them in her business.

Lucila would like to expand her business, stocking more merchandise of different brands.  She is planning to achieve this goal through loans.  Her business has helped her family financially.  She has plans to make progress and has dreams of getting ahead in life and, continuing to grow her business.  She is happy to be receiving this loan because she will use it to stock her business.  The improvements Lucila would like to make in the future are for her children to live better and to ensure that they don't want for anything.  She believes that this loan will help her.  She will invest it in her business and it will help improve her business.

The members of the group would like to say to Kiva and Fundación Realidad "Thanks to you we can have our own businesses.  Thank you for supporting us and helping us".  Huitzililla is a town with a warm, dry climate.  When it rains everything becomes very green and the women like it because it is the place where they live.

loans.use: To buy bras, pantyhose and lingerie to fill her orders

loans.name: Fabiana

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Fabiana; ella tiene 25 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de artesanía elabora aretes, collares pulseras para distribuirlo a sus clientes que le solicitan, a la vez tiene su carreta donde vende todo tipo de golosinas como galletas, dulces, chocolates entre otros.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la implementación de sus negocios.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Fabiana belongs to the "VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Fabiana is 25 years old.  She lives with her partner and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her handicrafts business.  She makes earrings, necklaces and bracelets which she distributes to her customers who request them.  She also has a small cart where she sells all kinds of sweet treats such as cookies, candies, chocolate, etc.

Fabiana is requesting this loan to keep both her businesses running.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To keep both her businesses running

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es: La señora Martha Cecilia A. R. vive en el barrio el Prado de la ciudad de Cartagena en compañía de su esposo y una hija de 9 años. Ese barrio es muy tradicional y famoso por ser el escenario de uno de los mejores desfiles folclóricos que se realizan en la semana del 11 de noviembre, cada año. La microempresaria se dedica a fabricar fritos como empanadas, arepas, deditos de queso y buñuelos. El negocio comenzó hace 15 años por recomendación de su mamá e impulsada por el hecho de querer generar otros ingresos familiares. Al principio utilizaba sólo un caldero pequeño, pero con el incremento de las ventas debió comprar otros implementos de cocina más grandes. Actualmente emplea a dos mujeres que le colaboran en preparar todos los ingredientes que llevan los fritos. Todos los días la señora Martha se levanta a las 3:30 de la mañana para iniciar su jornada laboral, porque debe entregar su producción a 7 tiendas del barrio y una cafetería antes de las 8 A.M.  Este es el quinto crédito que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra de una estufa industrial, una nevera e insumos para preparar sus productos. En promedio, la microempresaria vende 250 fritos a un precio de $500 COP cada uno. El margen de utilidad es del 40%. La señora Martha informa que gracias a su actividad  le está colaborando a su esposo en los gastos del hogar, puede darle su hija una buena educación y algunas comodidades que ella nunca tuvo cuando niña. Ella cree que el éxito de su negocio está en la calidad de los ingredientes que utiliza y el conocimiento de la temperatura que debe tener el aceite de cocina para poder  freír  y lograr que todo quede delicioso y crocante.
texts.en:
Martha Cecilia A. R. lives in the El Prado neighborhood, in the city of Cartagena, together with her husband and 9 year-old daughter.  This neighborhood is very traditional and famous for being the scene of one of the best folk parades which takes place on November 11th every year.

This small businesswoman makes fried goods such as empanadas, 'arepas' (corn fritters), 'deditos de queso' ('little cheese fingers') and doughnuts.  She started her business 15 years ago.  It was her mom who suggested the business and Martha was motivated by the fact that she wanted to make some additional family income.  At first she used only a small pot for preparing her food but as her sales increased she had to buy other, bigger cooking implements.  She currently employs two women who help her to prepare all the ingredients for her fried goods.

Every day Martha gets up at 3.30am to start her work day because she must deliver her goods to seven stores in the neighborhood and a cafeteria before 8.00am.

This is Martha's fifth loan from Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to invest it in buying an industrial stove, a refrigerator and supplies for preparing her food.  She sells on average 250 fried products at 500 Colombian pesos each.  Her profit margin is 40%.  Martha informs us that, thanks to her business, she is able to help her husband with their household expenses, provide her daughter with a good education and also some small conveniences that she never had when she was a little girl.  She believes that the success of her business lies in the quality of the ingredients that she uses and knowing the right temperature at which to have the cooking oil when she fries so that everything turns out delicious and crispy.

loans.use: To buy an industrial stove, a fridge and supplies for preparing her products

loans.name: Ruth Evelin

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Ruth Evelin; ella tiene 31 años de edad y es soltera y tiene 4 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de cerveza,ella tiene un deposito donde vende la cerveza,ella trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,ella quiere tener una tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar cajas de cerveza.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Ruth Evelina belongs to the “Buena Esperanza” (Good Hope) Communal Bank.  The bank is located in the Cusco district, which belongs to the Cusco province and Cusco department.

Ruth Evelina is 31 years old, single, and she has four children.  She alternates her daily activities with her business of selling beer.  She has a warehouse where she sells beer.  She works from 8:00 a.m. until 6:00 p.m.  She wants to have a grocery store.

She is requesting the loan to buy cases of beer.

She is happy about the loan, and she pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: To buy cases of beer

loans.name: Sugey Cecilia

texts.es: LA SEÑORA SUGEY L. T. TIENE ACTUALMENTE 31 AÑOS DE EDAD, ELLA VIVE CON SU CONYUGUE  Y CON SUS TRES HIJOS, TODOS ELLOS  EN EDAD ESCOLAR,  SU CONYUGUE TRABAJA COMO CHOFER DE UNA UNIDAD MENOR (TAXI), LA SEÑORA SUGEY SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ABARROTES Y ROPA EN UNA PEQUEÑA BODEGA UBICADO EN SU MISMO DOMICILIO, POR LO CUAL LA MAYORIA DE SUS VENTAS ESTAN ORIENTADAS A SUS VECINOS, GRACIAS AL NEGOCIO DE SU BODEGA LA SEÑORA SUGEY PUEDE SOSTENER LOS GASTOS DE SU FAMILIA Y LA EDUCACION DE SUS HIJOS, ELLA REQUIERE EL PRESTAMO PARA LA COMPRA DE MERCADERIA PARA ABASTECER SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Sugey L. T. is 31 years old.  She lives with her husband and their three school age children.  Her husband works as a taxi driver.  Sugey sells groceries and clothes in a small store located in her house.

Therefore, most of her sales are geared towards her neighbors.  Thanks to her store, Sugey is able to help with the family expenses and her children’s education.

She needs the loan to buy merchandise to stock her store.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to stock her store

loans.name: Gabriel Eusebio

texts.es: El señor Gabriel Eusebio Martínez Sánchez  tiene 44 años y vive con su esposa y su hijo de 21 años en el municipio San Juan Nepomuceno en el norteño departamento de Bolívar. Esta localidad es famosa por sus hermosas artesanías como hamacas y  sombreros. El microempresario vende carne de cerdo y carnero. El mismo compra los animales en fincas cercanas y los sacrifica. Este oficio lo aprendió desde muy joven porque sus padres también hacían lo mismo. Los días de mayor venta son los sábados, domingos y festivos. Tiene una clientela acreditada en el barrio desde hace varios años. Semanalmente vende de 6 a 8 animales que en total le dejan una utilidad de $150.000 a $ 200.000 COP. Con la temporada de fin  de año, las ventas se han incrementado considerablemente. Este es el tercer  préstamo que recibe de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra de cerdos y carneros. El señor Gabriel planea en el futuro organizar un local para trasladar su negocio y ofrecer, además de carne de cerdo y carnero, carne de res y gallinas criollas. En algunas temporadas del año, el usuario, tiene dificultad para conseguir los animales que sacrifica porque escasean y se encarecen. Para resolver este inconveniente suele comprar mayor cantidad en época de abundancia y pacta con algunos campesinos la manutención de los animales mientras los sacrifica. El microempresario  dice que ha podido sobrevivir tantos años en el negocio porque es un experto al momento de escoger los mejores animales. Estos no deben ser ni muy jóvenes ni muy viejos y tampoco deben estar muy gordos ó muy flacos. Definitivamente el señor Gabriel conoce y ama su oficio.
texts.en:
Gabriel Eusebio Martínez Sánchez is 44 years old.  He lives with his wife and his 21 year old son in the San Juan Nepomuceno municipality in the northern department of Bolívar.  This place is famous for its beautiful handicrafts like hammocks and hats.

This small businessman sells pork and mutton.  He buys the animals himself at nearby farms, and he slaughters them.  He learned this job when he was very young because his parents did the same thing.  He sells the most on Saturdays, Sundays, and holidays.  He has had an established customer base in his neighborhood for many years.

He sells between six and eight animals a week.  This gives him a profit of between $150,000 and $200,000 COP.  During the end of the year season sales have increased considerably.

This is his third loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo.  He plans to use the loan to buy pigs and sheep.  In the future, Gabriel plans to arrange a place in order to move his business and offer beef and chicken in addition to pork and mutton.

During some seasons of the year it is difficult to get animals to slaughter because they are scarce and more expensive.  To resolve this inconvenience, he generally buys a greater quantity during the times that they are more abundant.  He makes an agreement with some farm workers to keep the animals until he slaughters them.

This small businessman says that he has been able to survive so many years in the business because he is an expert at selecting the best animals.  They should not be very young or very old.  They should not be very fat or very thin.  

Gabriel is definitely a man who knows and loves his trade.

loans.use: To buy pigs and sheep

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Magdalena; ella tiene 62 años de edad, casada y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de compra y venta chuño, moraya y maíz entre otros para luego venderlo a sus clientes en los diferentes mercados de Cusco, y de esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más productos para su negocio. 

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en: This member belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario del Cusco" Community Bank; the bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. The member is Mrs. Magdalena; she is 62, married and has 5 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business where she buys and sells potato flour, moraya [a freeze-dried potato product], corn, and other items. She sells to her customers in the different markets of Cusco. This is how she gets her family ahead. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of more products for her business. She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: She is requesting this loan for the purchase of more products for her business.

loans.name: Otoniel

texts.es:
Otoniel P. N., es apenas un joven de 19 años de edad, el actualmente no estudia ya que por falta de recursos tuvo que truncar sus sueños de seguir estudiando, ésto lo motivo a iniciar algunas labores de trabajo para la obtención de recursos económicos. Él terminó el tercer año de bachillerato y actualemte vive con su madre, en la poblacion llamada San Jaun Cacahuatepec, en mixteco "yuko sihgva". A él le empezo gustar el mundo de las manualidades, y es por eso que desde hace 4 años se dedica a elaborar bordados y manualidades.
Otoniel se intereso por un credito para comprar fomi, papel mache, diferentes tipos de papeles, listones, tela de manta, zatin, botones, agujas, hilos, pagamento blanco, silicón, estos son algunos materiales que utiliza en la elaboracion de bolsas, arreglos, detalles, y otras cosas en comun, nos paltica que este es su primer credito en la vida y que por ese motivo él lo tomara con mucha responsabilidad y cuidado, ya que de esto depende su continuidad en continuar con su negocio.
Por el momento lo que mas le gustaria a Otoniel es consolidar su negocio, teniendo un establecimiento donde pueda poner a la venta sus productos que le elabora, pero el mas anhelado de sus sueño es el de seguir estudiando, el desea con todo su corazón el continuar con su preparación, el espera que en este año pueda ingresara  a alguna escuela para continuar, pero sin descuidar su pequeño negocio.
Le da las gracias a los que apoyan su proyecto, a kiva, a fundacion realidad y a los que hacen posible sus sueños.
Con su apoyo , gracias por la confianza que le brindan en el credito les manda un abrazo y un cordial saludo.
texts.en: Otoniel P. N., a very young man of only 19 years, does not currently study; since he does not have the resources, he had to cut short this dream. This motivated him to start various jobs to secure the necessary economic resources. He has finished his third year of undergraduate studies and currently lives with his mother in the village of San Juan Cacahuatepec, called Yuko Sihgva in Mixteco. He has begun to like the world of handicrafts, and for this reason he has made handcrafts and embroidery for 4 years. Otoniel would like this loan to purchase foam, paper mache, different types of paper, strips, blanket fabric, satin, buttons, needles, thread, white glue, and silicone. These are some of the materials that he uses in the making of purses, baskets, details and other items. He tells us that this is his first loan ever, and so he will be very responsible and careful, since his ability to continue with his business depends on it. At the moment, what he would most like would be to strengthen his business, and to have a store where he could sell his products. However, his greatest wish is to continue studying. He wants with all his heart to continue his education, and hopes that this year he will be able to enroll in a school, but without leaving his small business. He thanks Kiva, those who support his project, Fundacion Realidad, and those who are making his dreams possible. He thanks you for your support and confidence in him through this loan. He sends you a hug and a friendly greeting.

loans.use: The requested loan will be invested in the purchase of materials for the making of crafts and tokens. The materials to be bought are shell paper, foam sheets, felt, white glue, silicon for gluing, quilt fabrics, satin, ribons, skeins, threads, needles, and clasps.

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eugenia; ella tiene 50 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de tienda de abarrotes,ella vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz,azúcar,leche entre otros,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el engocio de tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para la tienda de abarrotes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the "Buena Esperanza" Community Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. The member is Mrs. Eugenia; she is 50 years old, married and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with her grocery store business. She sells basic staples such as rice, sugar, and milk among others. She wants to expand and improve her grocery store business. She is requesting this loan to purchase products for her grocery store. She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of her quotas.

loans.use: She is requesting this loan to purchase products for her grocery store.

loans.name: Digna Fidela

texts.es:
Digna Fidela A. C. tiene 38 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y con los hijos,  vive en el Cantón de Moncache  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 27 DE OCTUBRE   se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto santa Sofía, Todos los socios se dedican al cultivo de ciclo corto especialmente siembran maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.


Digna Fidela se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul.. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Briones  y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz, y fréjol gandul.. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa un terreno y tener un negocio propio.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en: Digna Fidela A. C. is 38 and in a common-law marriage. She lives with her partner and children in the Moncache Canton, Los Rios Province. She has 3 children. The members of the V. R. C. 27 de Octubre group are located in the Santa Sofia district. All of the members are short-cycle cultivators. They mainly sow corn, rice and gandul beans. They spend a lot of time doing this work. Digna Fidela works in agriculture, sowing corn, rice and gandul beans. She purchases her products in the Briones Market and sells them in the Vaca Market. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn and rice and gandul beans. The support of the loan will help her economically to supply her necessities. They have to confront challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. Her dream is to purchase a house and a plot of land and to have her own business. She likes sports.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Dona María

texts.es: La señora Dona María C. V. es una emprendedora mujer que vive con 2 hijos y 5 nietos en el centro del municipio de San Jacinto, al norte de Colombia. Ella desde hace 30 años se dedica a la elaboración de fritos como arepas, empanadas, buñuelos y deditos de queso. La  mayoría de sus clientes son vecinos del barrio y algunas tiendas. Con este negocio y la ayuda de su esposo logró criar a sus 10 hijos. Desde hace dos años y gracias al primer préstamo que le otorgó la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo decidió probar suerte con la venta de mercancía como jeans, camisas, vestidos, calzado y artesanías. El éxito fue total porque vendió todos sus productos aprovechando que ella es muy popular en su municipio. La mercancía la compra en ciudades como Montería  y Cartagena. Normalmente exige el pago de una cuota inicial y el saldo se lo cancelan en dos o tres partidas. Este es el tercer crédito que tramita con la Fundación y planea invertirlo en la compra de ropa y calzado para hombres y niños. Sus pedidos han crecido tanto que prácticamente todo lo que compra ya lo tiene encargado. Las ventas diarias de fritos son aproximadamente de $ 40.000 COP y le generan una utilidad de $ 16.000 COP. El negocio de la mercancía le generan una utilidad mensual aproximada de $400.000 COP y la rotación de las cuentas por cobrar es de 45 días. La señora Dona dice estar contenta con sus dos negocios porque los fritos la ocupan en las noches y la mercancía en las mañanas. En un futuro no muy lejano planea abrir al público un pequeño almacén de variedades para atender mejor su clientela.
texts.en: Dona María C. V. is an enterprising woman who lives with with two children and five grandchildren in the center of the San Jacinto municipality, in the north of Colombia. For 30 years she has made fried food such as arepas [corn bread], pies, fritters, and cheese fingers. The majority of her customers are her neighbours, and some stores. With this business and her husband's help she was able to raise her 10 children. For two years, and thanks to the first loan that the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo gave her, she decided to test her luck with the sale of merchandise such as jeans, shirts, dresses, shoes and crafts. She had complete success because she sold all of her products as she is very popular in her area. She buys her merchandise in cities such as Monteria and Cartagena. She normally requests payment of an initial amount and then full payment in two or three parts. This is her third loan with the Fundacion and she plans to invest it in the purchase of clothing and shoes for men and children. Demand for her products has increased so much that practically all of what she buys is already spoken for. The daily sales of her fried food total approximately $ 40.000 COP and generate her an income of $ 16.000 COP. Her merchandise business generates her an approximate monthly income of $400.000 COP and the turnover of accounts receivable is 45 days. Dona says that she is happy with her two businesses because the food occupies her nights and the merchandise occupies her mornings. In the near future she plans to open a small variety store to better serve her customers.

loans.use: the purchase of clothing and shoes for men and children

loans.name: Leonor

texts.es:
La siguiente persona que hableremos a continuacion sellama Leonor S. B., quien es soltera y tiene 26 años de edad, desde hace mas de 2 años Leonor empezó a dedicarse a la venta y recomendación de productos naturistas, ella a raíz de un padecimiento de salud fue el motivo por el cual inicio la venta de estos productos , primero ella los empezó a consumir, después los recomendó y es de esa manera como empezó con la venta de estos productos, ella es instructora de educacion inicial en una dependencia llamada CONAFE(comision nacional del fomento a la educacion), Leonor vive con su madre a la cual ella apoya economicamente.
Leonor solicito un credito para la compra de mercancia que ella vende mismos como; productos naturistas, suplemento alimenticio, vitaminas, calcio, malteadas, té, bebidas energizantes, fibra, tatamienos para diferentes padecimientos, como son aloe vera, compuestos de plantas medicinales.
A lo que aspira Leonor es a tener una casa propia, gozar de buena salud, tener un establecimiento en el acual pueda ofrecer de manera permanente sus productos, por lo pronto ella les da las gracias a los que apoyaron el financiamiento de sus credito a ellos le mada un afectuoso abrazo.
texts.en: Leonor S. B. is 26 and single. Over 2 years ago she started selling and promoting natural products. She was motivated by a health issue which got her started selling these products. She started off consuming them, then later recommended them and began selling them. She is an early childhood educator in a school called CONAFE (Comision Nacional del Fomento a la Educacion- National Commission to Promote Education). Leonor lives with her mother whom she supports economically. Leonor is requesting a loan for the purchase of merchandise that she sells such as: natural products, dietary supplements, vitamins, calcium, milkshakes, tea, energy drinks, fiber, and treatments for various ailments such as aloe vera and compounds from medicinal plants. Leonor aspires to having her own home, enjoying good health, and having a fixed location to sell her products. Right now she is grateful to those who will support the financing of her loans and sends you a warm hug.

loans.use: The money from this loan will be invested in the purchase of the following natural products: milkshakes, fiber, vitamins, energy items, supplements, energy drinks and aloe vera products.

loans.name: Felix Alfredo

texts.es:
Felix Alfredo S. D. tiene 35 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la compañera y con los hijos,  vive en el Cantón de Moncache  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 3 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 27 DE OCTUBRE   se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Santa Sofía, Todos los socios se dedican al cultivo de ciclo corto especialmente siembran maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Felix Alfredo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Briones  y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca y García.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa un terreno y poder sembrar.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Felix Alfredo S. D. is 35 and lives with his common law wife and their 3 children in Moncache canton, in Los Ríos province.

The members of the V.R.C. 27 de Octubre communal bank are located in the Santa Sofía district.  All have been farmers for a long time and work with short cycle crops,  especially corn, rice and beans

Felix Alfredo farms corn and rice.  He buys the seeds in Comercial Briones  (store) and sells his products in Comercial Vaca y García (store).
He is requesting the loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers to plant corn and rice and beans.   The financing  will help him purchase what he needs.  He has to deal with problems such as infestations, plant diseases and the changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a house, and a field where he can plant.

He enjoys sports.

loans.use: agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Sonia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
La socia es la Sra. Sonia; ella tiene 43 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de desayunos como manzana con kinua,maca,leche y también emolientes esto quiere decir mates a base de plantas naturales la socia vende por las mañanas, a la vez la socia vende salchipapas por la noche en su casa y de esta manera la socia saca a su familia adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
The member belongs to the communal bank "Virgen del Rosario del Cusco" (Our Lady of the Rosary of Cusco). The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco in the region of Cusco.

The member is Señora Sonia. She is 43, lives in a common-law marriage and has three children. She alternates her daily activities between her two businesses. In the morning she sells breakfast dishes, namely apples with quinoa (edible seeds), maca (Peruvian ginseng), milk and also emollients (matés or infusions with natural plants). This is what she sells in the morning. In the evening she sells from her home salchipapas (Peruvian fast food dishes that consist of thinly sliced pan-fried beef hot dogs or sausage and French fries, mixed together and served on a plate or in a paper cone, served with different sauces and chili peppers). Thus she enables her family to get along.

The member applies for this loan to buy more ingredients for her dishes.

The member is appreciative of the loan and is committed to repay it on schedule.

loans.use: To buy more ingredients for her dishes

loans.name: Jose Rodrigo

texts.es:
José Rodrigo Q. Gutiérrez 
Asesor: Marta Lucía Mejía Rojas    
Fecha historia: Diciembre 22 de 2010 

José Rodrigo Q. Gutiérrez conoce perfectamente el significado de trabajar en la calle, pues desde hace 25 años inició su aventura como emprendedor vendiendo dulces en la calles de Medellín-Colombia como su única opción laboral, pues la falta de oportunidades lo obligaron a subsistir como independiente. 

Aunque José Rodrigo ha sabido sobrevivir en este camino de empresario en las calles que nos es nada fácil, debido a los factores externos como el clima, la competencia y otras adversidades con las que día a día se enfrenta, actualmente este luchador necesita del apoyo económico para adquirir más surtido como dulces, galletas, confites y chicles que son los que le generan sus ganancias para el sustento diario. 

Como un gran visionario, José Rodrigo sueña con tener en el futuro un local propio donde además de vender sus dulces pueda montar una cafetería para ofrecer otros productos.
texts.en:
José Rodrigo Q. Gutiérrez
Advisor: Marta Lucía Mejía Rojas
Date: December 22, 2010

José Rodrigo Q. Gutiérrez knows perfectly well what it means to work on the street.  Twenty-five years ago he started his adventure as an entrepreneur by selling sweets on the streets of Medllín, Colombia.  This was his only work option.  The lack of opportunities obliged him to be an independent worker.

Although José Rodrigo has known how to survive on this business path in the streets, it is not easy.  External factors like the climate, the competition, and other adversities that he faces every day make it difficult.

This hard-worker now needs financial assistance to stock his business more.  He will buy things like sweets, cookies, candy, and gum.  Those items generate a daily household income.

As a great visionary, José Rodrigo dreams of having his own place in the future.  In addition to selling sweets, he would be able to set up a cafe in order to sell other products.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Galo Evaristo

texts.es:
Galo Evaristo A. G. tiene 42 años de edad, Es soltero, vive con el papá  en  el  Cantón de Moncache  Provincia los Ríos. No tiene hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 27 DE OCTUBRE   se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Santa Sofía, Todos los socios se dedican al cultivo de ciclo corto especialmente siembran maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.


Galo Evaristo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Briones  y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca y G..

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa un terreno.

Le gusta el deporte y la música.
texts.en:
Galo Evaristo A. G. is 42 years old.  He is single and lives with his dad in Moncache canton, in Los Ríos province.  He doesn't have any children.

The members of the '27 de Octubre' community bank are located in Santa Sofia.  All the members work in short-cycle agriculture.  They grow corn, rice and pigeon peas.  They have been in this business for a long time.

Galo Evaristo is a farmer.  He grows corn, rice and pigeon peas.  He buys his products in Briones shopping area and makes his sales in Vaca and Garcia shopping area.  He is requesting a loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for his corn, rice and pigeon pea crops.

The support of this loan will help Galo Evaristo to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a house and plot of land.  He likes taking part in sport and music.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Elina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eugenia; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza,ella vende perfumes,cremas y lápiz labiales,la socia vende en forma independiente y por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza en stock.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eugenia belongs to the "BUENA ESPERANZA" (Good Hope) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Eugenia is 40 years old, married and has 2 children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling beauty products.  She sells perfume, creams and lipsticks.  She sells independently and through her business she manages to get her children ahead in life.

Eugenia is requesting this loan to buy beauty products to have in stock.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy beauty products to have in stock

loans.name: Ruth Elena

texts.es:
Ruth Elena 
Asesor: Flor     
Fecha historia: Diciembre 22 de 2010
