De domingo a domingo desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 8:00 p.m. labora Ruth Elena en su propio negocio, una tienda en la que ofrece a sus vecinos legumbres, granos y snaks, así es como recibe mejores ingresos para subsistir diariamente y aportar a su hogar, pues tener 6 hijos implica una lucha constante para salir adelante. 

Desde hace año y medio Ruth Elena tomó la decisión de convertirse en microempresaria y aportar con su trabajo a los ingresos del hogar, pues cada vez se hacía más difícil la subsistencia, hoy puede decir con alegría que aporta para mejorar la calidad de vida de su numerosa familia. 

Ruth Elena espera adquirir más surtido para su tienda con el fin de mejorar sus ventas y aumentar sus ingresos familiares.
texts.en:
Ruth Elena
Advisor: Flor
Date: December 22, 2010

From Sunday to Sunday Ruth Elena works from 6:00 a.m until 8:00 p.m. in her own business.  She has a store, and she sells vegetables, grains, and snacks to her neighbors.  That is how she gets better earnings to contribute daily to her household income.  She has six children, and this involves a constant struggle to get ahead.

A year and a half ago Ruth Elena made the decision to become a small businesswoman.  She did this to contribute, through her work, to the household income.  Survival becomes more difficult each day.  She can now happily say that she contributes in order to improve the quality of live for her large family.

Ruth Elena hopes to get more stock for her store.  She wants to do this in order to improve her sales and to increase their family income.

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Carlos Raul

texts.es:
Carlos Raul A. C. tiene 34 años de edad, Es casado vive con  la esposa y con los hijos en el Cantón Moncache Provincia de los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 27 DE OCTUBRE   se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Santa Sofía, Todos los socios se dedican al cultivo de ciclo corto especialmente siembran maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Carlos Raul se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Briones  y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca y García.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa un terreno.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Carlos Raul A. C. is 34 years old, married, and lives with his wife and children in the canton of Moncache, in Ríos province.

The members of the October 27th rural communal bank are based in the precinct of Santa Sofía.  All of the group's members work in short-cycle agriculture, and in particular, they plant corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  Collectively, they have been doing this work for a long time.

Carlos Raul plants corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  He buys products in the Briones market and sells what he produces in the Vaca y Garcia market.

He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for cultivating corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  With the economic support provided by this loan, he will be able to meet his needs.  He faces challenges like insect plagues and crop illnesses, as well as the changing climate.  His dream is to buy a house and his own plot of land.

He likes sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Efigenia

texts.es:
Efigenia, tien 56 años de edad y esta casada eon el señor Raul quien tiene 55 años, ellos tienen 6 hijos tres de ellos ya estan casados y tres son solteros, ellos viven en la poblacion de San Juan Cacahuatepec, Oaxaca.
La venta de flores es el principal ofico de esta pesona, pero si nos adentramos mas en su vida personal,nos enteramos, que Efigenia no es la unica actividad que realiza para la obtencion de recurso, ella prepara barbacoa de chivos para la venta en los fines de semana, tambien es instructira de un programa para la educacion llamado CONAFE (comision nacional de fomento educativo), ella instruye a los niños en educacion inicial, de alguna u otra forma ella es una mujer muy trabajadora y digna de admiracion.
El motivo por  el cual inicio en la venta de las flores, es que hace como 10 años, su esposo sufrio un accidente por el cual ya no le permitio trabajar de manera normal, obligandola a ella a buscar maneras de como mantener a sus pequeños hijos y cubrir los gastos medicos de su esposo, ella nos comparte que se aventuro un dia a la venta de las flores y la preparacion de barbacoa, al principio fue muy dificil,pero ahora su negocio esta marchando bien.
Solicito un credito para invertir en la compra de variedaades de flores, que en esta temporada hay mucha demanda de flores por motivos de bodas y fiestas,de la diversidad de flores estan, lirios, rosas de diferentes colores, crisantemos, lilis, claveles, margaritas, gladiolas, girasoles, solidago y tulipanes. Ademas comprara chiles secos, cebollas, ajos, hoja de platano, leña y chivos.
Lo que mas anhela Efigenia es que nunca le falte salud y que ese ánimo con el que ella trabaja jamas decaiga, le gustaria tener un local fijo donde pueda vender comidas .
Le dalas gracias a los responsables del recurso que ella recibe, a ellos les agradece por su confianza.
texts.en:
Efigenia is 56 years old and married to Sr. Raul, age 55. They have six children, three of whom are already married while the other three are single. Efigenia and her husband live in the town of San Juan Cacahuatepec, Oaxaca.

Selling flowers is Efigenia’s main job, but looking deeper into her personal life one can learn that this is not the only means by which she earns income. She prepares barbecued goat to sell on the weekends and is also an instructor for an educational program called CONAFE (National Commission of Education). Efigenia teaches pre-school children in one way or another. She is a hardworking woman who is worthy of admiration.

Efigenia started selling flowers ten years ago because her husband suffered an accident that prevents him from working a normal schedule. She was forced to find ways to support her children and pay for her husband’s medical expenses. Efigenia says that one day she ventured to sell flowers and prepare barbecue. At first it was very difficult, but now her business is doing well. She is requesting a loan to invest in the purchase of a variety of flowers. This season there is demand for flowers for weddings and parties. The diversity of flowers includes lilies, roses in different colors, chrysanthemums, carnations, daisies, gladiolas, sunflowers, goldenrods, and tulips. She will also buy dried chili peppers, onions, garlic, banana leaves, and goats.

What Efigenia desires most is to maintain her health and motivation so that her work does not suffer. She would like to have an established location from where she can sell food. Efigenia expresses her thanks to those responsible who provided her with these resources. She appreciates the confidence being placed in her.

loans.use: Purchase a variety of flowers to sell and dried chili peppers, onions, garlic, banana leaves, and goats for her food business

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra.Angelica; ella tiene 60 años de edad, viuda y tiene 5 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de comida por las noches, la socia vende en forma ambulatoria, la socia lleva años en este negocio siendo esta la única actividad que realiza y de esta forma saca a su familia adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio de venta de comida.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Mrs. Angelica belongs to the Virgen del Rosario del Cusco Community Bank. The bank is located in the city of Cusco in the province of the same name. 

She is a 60-year old widow and has five children. After completing her daily activities she begins to work selling food on the street. She has had this business for many years and it is the only job she has to help her family.

She will use the loan to purchase supplies for her food stall. She appreciates the loan and pledges to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Purchase of supplies for food stall business

loans.name: Justina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Eugenia; ella tiene 45 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza como cremas,lápiz labiales,perfumes y lápiz para ojos,ella trabaja en forma independiente llevando a diferente lugares como instituciones,por medio de este negocio la socia saca adelante a sus hijos,la socia quiere tener una tienda para vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza al por mayor.  

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Eugenia belongs to the Buena Esperanza Community Bank. The bank is located in the city of Cusco in the province of the same name. 

She is 45 years old and is married with two children. 
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco. She alternates her daily activities with the business of selling beauty products like creams, lipstick, perfume, and eyeliner. She works independently bringing her goods to different places like schools. This business helps her provide for her children. She wants to start a shop to sell her beauty products. She will use the loan to buy beauty products at wholesale prices.

Eugenia is pleased with this loan and she promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: Wholesale purchase of beauty products

loans.name: Luz Maria

texts.es:
Luz Maria S. B. es una señora de 29 años de edad, esta casada con Jesus quien es un poco mayor que ella, pues tiene 40 años y se dedica al oficio de chofer de taxi, Luz tiene un hijo de nombre Jose Antonio de 3 años de edad, ella se dedica a la venta de pescado, que hace mas de 3 años que inicio con esta actividad comercial.
Luz Maria solicito un credito para la compra de mas productos dentro del cual figuran diferentes tipos de pescados, como es muy en comun la mojarra tilapia y blanca, el pargo, el huachinango, el robalo, el cuatete, el sacamiche, lisa, jurel, también el camaron y los mejillones conocidos como "tichindas"estos pescados son de mayor consumo y los comercializa frescos, salados y asados, cabe mencioner que esta activiodad es un poco difícil ya que cuando escazea el producto los que dependen de esto se ven afectados ellos y sus familias.
Luz comercializa sus productos fuera de su comunidad, recorriendo otras poblaciones. Para hecer posible sus ventas, no tiene problemas para colocar su mercancia ya que en la zona donde ella vive y vende, no es muy usual encontrar pescados y es por eso que es una ventaja que ella tiene.
Los sueños mas deseados de Luz es tener un establecimiento fijo de comercio, por el cual ya no tenga que ambular de un lugar a otro, ella quiere mejorar su vivienda y que su niño estudie para que mañana no carezca de preparacion.
Luz Maria les manda un saludo a los que apoya a kiva,a fundacion relaidad y todo el equipo de trabajo, les desa una feliz navidad y que DIOS los guarde.
texts.en:
Luz Maria S. B. is 29 years old, and is married to Jesus, who is a bit older than she is; Jesus is 40 years old, and makes a living as a taxi driver.  Luz has a son named Jose Antonio, who is 3 years old.  Luz makes a living selling fish, which she has done since she started in this commercial activity more than 3 years ago.  Luz is asking for a loan so that she can purchase more products, which include different types of fish such as mojarra (including tilapia and white mojarra), sea bream, red snapper, sea bass, cuatete, sacamiche, mullet, and scad in addition to shrimp and mussels that are known as “tichindas”.  These fish sell well and Luz sells them fresh, salted, and roasted.  It is worth mentioning that this activity is a bit difficult, since whenever there is a fish shortage it affects those who depend on the products as well as their families.   

Luz sells her products outside of her community by travelling to other towns.  It is unusual to find fish in the area where Luz lives and sells her products, and that is to Luz’s advantage, and a reason why she has no problem selling her merchandise.  

What Luz wishes for the most is to have her own regular place of business, since then she would not have to walk from one place to another.  She also wants to improve her home, and wants her son to study so that he will be prepared for the future.  Luz sends her greetings to those at the Kiva Foundation who have helped her, and is grateful to everyone on the work team.  She wishes them a Merry Christmas and hopes that God will look after them.

loans.use: Purchasing seafood products such as mojarra, red snapper, sea bream, scad, mullet, cuatete, sacamiche, shrimp, and mussels.

loans.name: Yenny María

texts.es: La señora Yenny  María G. B. sigue elaborando prendas de vestir y artesanías en su casa ubicada en el municipio de San Jacinto, departamento de Bolívar.  Ya canceló su anterior Credikiva con gran puntualidad gracias al cual logró aumentar sus ventas, sus utilidades y empezar a construir su vivienda para vivir con su esposo y su pequeño hijo. Con el actual préstamo planea comprar telas, hilos y  accesorios. En un futuro no muy lejano piensa comprar una moderna máquina de coser para darle un mejor acabado a las prendas de vestir  y reemplazar la que tiene actualmente. La señora Yenny le manda un saludo muy especial a todos sus financiadores de Kiva, deseándoles mucha salud y prosperidad en compañía de sus familiares y agradeciéndoles la generosidad de ayudar a personas humildes y trabajadoras en los más apartados confines de la tierra. Para conocer la anterior presentación de la microempresaria, pueden acceder a través del siguiente link:																								http://www.kiva.org/lend/180569
texts.en:
Yenny María G. B. makes clothes and handicrafts in her home which is located in the town of San Jacinto, in Bolívar department.  She repaid her previous Kiva loan on time and, thanks to that loan, she has managed to increase her sales and profits and has begun to build a home for herself, her husband and her small son to live in.

Yenny plans to use her current loan to buy fabric, threads and accessories.  In the not-so-distant future she plans to buy a modern sewing machine so that she can do a better job of finishing off the clothes she makes and replace her current machine.

Yenny sends a special greeting to all Kiva lenders.  She wishes them and their family members good health and prosperity, and thanks them for their generosity in helping humble and hard-working people in the most far-flung places on earth.  If you would like to read the previous description of this small businesswoman and her business, you can access this through the following link: http://www.kiva.org/lend/180569

loans.use: To buy fabric, threads and accessories

loans.name: Maria Angelica

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Maria Angelica; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de desayunos,ella prepara dieferentes desayunos como leche,chocolate,café y sandwichs,ella trabaja desde las 5:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el negocio de desayunos.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para preparar desayunos. 
 
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower is a member of the "Buena Esperanza" ["Good Hope"] communal bank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Maria Angelica.  She is 29 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children.  Maria Angelica divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling breakfast.  She prepares a variety of breakfasts, such as milk, hot chocolate, coffee, and sandwiches.  She works from 5:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She hopes to expand and improve her breakfast business.  She is requesting a loan to buy products for preparing breakfasts.

Maria Angelica is happy to receive this loan and promises to comply with the established repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing breakfast

loans.name: Nely

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nely; ella tiene 34 años de edad, conviviente y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de comida por las noches, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria,a la vez la socia trabaja por las mañanas como boletera de servicio público siendo estas dos actividades que realiza por el momento y espera mas adelante poder encontrar un mejor trabajo.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más insumos para su negocio de venta de comida.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Nely belongs to the "VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Nely is 34 years old and lives with her partner and three children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling food in the evenings.  She sells her food as an itinerant street vendor.  She also works in the mornings as a ticket seller in the public sector.  These are the two  activities that she carries out at the moment and she hopes, in the future, to find better work.

Nely is requesting this loan to buy more supplies for her business selling food.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments in a timely manner.

loans.use: To buy supplies for her business selling food

loans.name: Hernan

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Hernan; el tiene 31 años de edad y es soltero; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agencia de viajes,el tiene una sociedad con su amigo y juntos abrieron una agencia de viajes,el socio por medio de este negocio saca adelante a sus hijos,el socio quiere ampliar la agencia de viajes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para implementar la agencia de viajes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Hernan is a member of the "BUENA ESPERANZA" (Good Hope) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.  

Hernan is 31 years old and single.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his travel agency business.  He and his friend opened the travel agency together.  Through this business he gets his children ahead in life.  He would like to expand his travel agency and is requesting this loan to make progress in his travel agency business.

Hernan is happy to be receiving this loan and he pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To make progress in his travel agency business

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy soft drinks and snacks

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Alicia; ella tiene 30 años de edad, casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de productos de belleza de las marcas Esika,Avon,Dupre y Unique, la socia lleva años en este negocio siendo esta la única actividad que realiza por el momento la socia vende a sus familiares ,amigos y vecinos ,ella se siente feliz en este negocio ya que le permite hacer lo que le gusta pero también espera poder encontrar otro tipo de trabajo más adelante. 

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más productos de belleza para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Alicia is a member of the "VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Alicia is 30 years old, married and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling Esika, Avon, Dupre and Unique beauty products.  She has been in this business for years and it is the only activity that she carries out at the moment.  She sells to family members, friends and neighbors.  Alicia is happy with her business as it allows her to do what she likes doing but she is also hoping to find another type of work in the future.

Alicia is requesting this loan to buy more beauty products for her business.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products for her business

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Luz Marina; ella tiene 34 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de snack cafetería y también se dedica al negocio de llamadas telefónicos en forma ambulatoria,la socia atiende  desde las 6:00 hasta las 5:00 p.m y las llamadas telefónicas trabaja desde las 6:00 p.m hasta las 10:00 p.m,la socia quiere mejorar y ampliar el snack.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para el snack cafetería.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Buena Esperanza" ["Good Hope"] communal bank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Ms. Luz Marina.  She is 34 years old, in a common-law marriage, and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and and her two businesses.  She runs a snack cafeteria as well as a traveling phone call business.  Luz Marina tends her snack cafe from 6:00 a.m. until 5:00 p.m. and runs her phone call business from 6:00 p.m. until 10:00 p.m.  She would like to improve and expand her snack cafe.  Therefore she is requesting this loan to buy products for her snack cafe.

Luz Marina is happy to receive this loan and she promises to comply with the established repayment schedule.

loans.use: to buy products for her snack cafeteria

loans.name: Milton David

texts.es:
Milton David A. G. tiene 28 años de edad, Es soltero, vive con los padres  en  el  Cantón de Moncache  Provincia los Ríos. No tiene hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 27 DE OCTUBRE   se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Santa Sofía, Todos los socios se dedican al cultivo de ciclo corto especialmente siembran maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.


Milton David se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Briones  y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca y G..

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa y un terreno.

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en:
Milton David A. G. is 28 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in the canton of Moncache, which is in Ríos province.  He does not have any children.

The members of the October 27th rural communal bank are based in the precinct of Santa Sofía. All of the group's members work in short-cycle agriculture, and in particular, they plant corn, rice, and pigeon peas. Collectively, they have been doing this work for a long time.

Milton David plants corn, rice, and pigeon peas. He buys products in the Briones market and sells what he produces in the Vaca y Garcia market.

He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for cultivating corn, rice, and pigeon peas. With the economic support provided by this loan, he will be able to meet his needs. He faces challenges like insect plagues and crop illnesses, as well as the changing climate. His dream is to buy a house and his own plot of land.

He likes sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Giannina  Daysi

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Srta. Giannina; ella tiene 19 años de edad, soltera; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con su negocio de venta de juguetes navideños, la socia vende de forma ambulatoria, la socia a la vez es estudiante de la carrera profesional de turismo en la Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Cusco, la socia espera poder abrir su propia agencia de viajes.

La socia solicita el préstamo para la compra de más juguetes para su negocio.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota
texts.en:
Giannina is a member of the "VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO" community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Giannina is 19 years old and single.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling Christmas toys.  She makes her sales as an itinerant street vendor.  Giannina is also studying a degree in tourism at the Universidad Nacional San Antonio Abad del Dusco.  She hopes to be able to open her own travel agency.

Giannina is requesting this loan to buy more toys for her business.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy more toys for her business

loans.name: Irma Cristina

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irma Cristina; ella tiene 29 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de pintura cusqueña,ella pinta diferente cuadros de la pintura cusqueña,ella tiene una tienda que atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m,la socia también vende estas pinturas en forma independiente,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar la tienda de venta de pinturas cusqueñas .La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales para hacer las pinturas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Irma Cristina is a member of the "BUENA ESPERANZA" (Good Hope) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Irma Cristina is 29 years old and lives with her partner and son.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling Cusqueña paintings (Cusco-style paintings).  She paints Cusqueña paintings and has a store where she serves from 8.00am to 7.00pm.  She also sells her paintings independently.  She would like to expand and improve the store where she sells her paintings.

Irma Cristina is requesting this loan to buy materials for her paintings.  She is happy to be receiving this loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy materials for her paintings

loans.name: Chivas De Corazon Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama "Chivas de Corazón", está ubicado en el Estado de Morelos en México, en una comunidad que se distingue por su  balneario llamado El Rollo que es un atractivo turístico del estado, el grupo está conformado por 10  integrantes. Lorena Báez es integrante del grupo,ella se dedica a la venta de ropa, negocio que inicio hace 4 años. Solicita su préstamo para comprar más prendas, tiene 36 años, estudió hasta el tercer año de secundaria, es soltera y no tiene hijos, sus clientes están a gusto  porque siempre encuentran lo que necesitan. Al momento de solicitar el préstamo se siente contenta porque con el crédito podrá comprar mercancía para surtir sus pedidos, y tendrá mayores ganancias con las que comprará un aparador  que necesita para su negocio, también espera que su negocio crezca para cuando se case y lleguen los hijos tenga la posibilidad de mandarlos a la escuela y dedicarles tiempo en casa.
texts.en:
This group is called "Chivas de Corazón" and is located in the Mexican state of Morelos, in a community that is known for the "El Rollo" water park, one of the state's major tourist attractions.

The group is comprised of ten members, one of whom is Lorena Báez.  Four years ago, she started a business selling clothing.  She is requesting this loan to buy more garments.  She is 36 years old, studied through the third year of secondary school, is single, and does not have any children.  Her customers like her business because they tend to find what they need.

As she requests this loan, she feels content because this loan will make it possible for her to buy merchandise to fill her customers' requests, and she will bring in more income.  She will use the additional earnings to buy a cupboard she needs for her business.  She also hopes that her business will grow so that when she gets married and has children, it will be possible to send them to school and to dedicate time to them at home.

loans.use: to buy merchandise and stock more items of clothing

Le gusta el deporte.
texts.en: Luis Humberto C. M., 19, is single and living with his parents in Monacache Canton, Rios Province.  He has no children.  The members of the V.R.C. 27 DE OCTUBRE Group, located in Santa Sofia enclosure, earn their living in short-season agriculture, especially corn, rice and beans, spending a great deal of time at their work.  Luis Humberto also grows corn, rice, and beans.  He buys his supplies in the Comercial Briones and sells his products in the Comercial Vaca y García.  He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers to grow corn, rice, and beans.  This loan will help him economically to provide for his necessities.  They face challenges such as infestations and diseases, and weather variability.  His dream is to buy a house and land.  He enjoys sports.

loans.use: Agricultural supplies and fertilizers

Los miembros de la V.R.C. 27 DE OCTUBRE   se encuentra ubicada  en el recinto Santa Sofía, Todos los socios se dedican al cultivo de ciclo corto especialmente siembran maíz, arroz y fréjol gandul, esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Luis Enrique se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Briones  y vende los  productos en el Comercial Vaca y García.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz y fréjol gandul. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. texts.en:
Luis Enrique Y. N. is 30 years old.  He is single and lives with his siblings in the canton of Moncache, which is in Ríos province.  He does not have any children.

The members of the "27th of October" rural communal bank are based in the precinct of Santa Sofía.  All of the members work in short-cycle agriculture, planting corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  Collectively, they have many years of experience in this activity.

Luis Enrique plants corn, rice, and pigeon peas. He buys products in the Briones market and sells what he produces in the Vaca y Garcia market.

He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for cultivating corn, rice, and pigeon peas.  With the economic support provided by this loan, he will be better able to meet his needs.  He faces challenges like insect plagues, crop illnesses, and variations in the climate.  His dream is to buy a farm and his own house.

He enjoys sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Antonio Segundo

texts.es: El señor Antonio Martínez Ramírez tiene 43 años, vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla en compañía de su esposa y 5 hijos. Tiene un puesto estacionario de comidas en el cual vende carne asada, pechuga de pollo a la plancha, perros calientes, embutidos, hamburguesas y bandejas de papitas fritas con salchichas. El negocio tiene 13 años de existencia y está ubicado en las afueras del centro comercial Metrocentro, a una cuadra del estadio Metropolitano de fútbol, el más grande de Colombia. Todos los días empieza a vender sus alimentos a las 4 P.M. y su jornada se extiende hasta después de media noche. Los días de mayor venta son los viernes,  sábados y domingos, especialmente cuando juega el equipo local de fútbol, Junior  de Barranquilla. La esposa del microempresario le ayuda a preparar las salsas y los ingredientes con que sazona sus comidas. Este es el quinto crédito que tramita en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra al por mayor de víveres. Siempre se ha distinguido por su puntualidad en los pagos. Antes de vincularse a la Fundación, El señor Antonio se financiaba con créditos personales de usureros que diariamente llegaban a cobrarle al negocio. La tasa de interés que pagaba era altísima y nunca le quedaba algún excedente para poder ahorrar.  El promedio de ventas diarias es de $ 70.000 COP y el margen de utilidad es del 45%. Aunque la reciente temporada invernal afectó negativamente sus ingresos, el microempresario se muestra optimista hacia el futuro porque ya tiene una clientela acreditada. La competencia que tiene en el sector es fuerte y por eso se esmera en ofrecer un buen producto, a un precio justo y sobre todo, con una esmerada atención.
texts.en:
Antonio Martínez Ramírez is 43 years old.  He lives in the city of Barranquilla with his wife and five children.  He has a stationary food stall where he sells roasted meat, grilled chicken breast, hot dogs, sausages, burgers and trays of French fries with sausages.  He has had his business for 13 years and it is located just outside the Metrocentro shopping mall, one block from the Metropolitano soccer stadium, the biggest in Colombia.

Every day, Antonio starts selling his food at 4.00pm and his work day continues until after midnight.  His best days for sales are Fridays, Saturdays and Sundays, especially when the local soccer team, Junior de Barranquilla, are playing.  This small businessman's wife helps him to prepare his sauces and the ingredients with which he seasons his food.

This is Antonio's fifth loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he plans to invest it in buying ingredients wholesale.  Antonio has always stood out for his punctuality in making his loan repayments.  Before he came to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, Antonio took personal loans through loan sharks who called at his business daily to collect payment.  The interest rate that he paid was very high and he never had anything left over so he couldn't make any savings.

Antonio's average daily sales are 70,000 Colombian pesos and his profit margin is 45%.  Although the recent winter season negatively affected his income, this small businessman is optimistic for the future because he already has an existing customer base.  The competition in his field is strong and for this reason he takes care to offer a good product at a fair price and, above all, with very good customer service.

loans.use: To buy ingredients wholesale

loans.name: Annelyn

texts.en:
Annelyn G. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 40 years old, married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Annelyn plants and harvests rice for sale. Annelyn works hard to support her family – especially her children's education.

Annelyn joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Annelyn is requesting a new loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to pay for her children's school fees.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Nivaldo Enrique

texts.es: El señor Nivaldo Enrique B. Benítez tiene 41 años y vive en la ciudad de Barranquilla en compañía de su esposa y dos hijos de 13 y 7 años. Tiene un estadero en el barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio, uno de los más populares por albergar al estadio de fútbol más grande de Colombia. En su negocio, el microempresario vende cervezas, gaseosas, pasabocas  y comidas rápidas. El negocio lo inició hace 12 años en casa de su suegra, luego lo trasladó a un local entregado por la alcaldía de la ciudad, el cual es más amplio y está ubicado en un sector de mayor  tráfico de personas. El horario de atención al público es de 7 A.M. a 10 P.M. Los fines de semana suele extender la jornada hasta las 3 A.M. La competencia en el sector es grande, pero todos los estaderos venden y cada uno tiene una clientela habitual. Este es el quinto crédito que el señor Nivaldo tramita en la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra  al por mayor  de cervezas, bebidas y víveres para sus comidas.  El promedio de ventas semanales es de $ 800.000. El margen de utilidad es del 30% y el nivel de endeudamiento es del 21%. La temporada de mayores ventas comienza en Diciembre y se extiende hasta finales del mes de Febrero cuando terminan los carnavales de Barranquilla, la más importante fiesta folclórica de Colombia y declarada por la UNESCO patrimonio oral e inmaterial de la humanidad. El próximo año el microempresario planea hacer unas reformas al local del negocio para aumentar la comodidad y estimular las ventas. Ya comenzó a ahorrar para enchapar el baño y la cocina de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado, esa es su próxima meta a lograr.
texts.en:
Nivaldo Enrique B. Benítez is 41 and lives in the city of Barranquilla with his wife and two children ages 13 and 7. He has a kiosk in the Ciudadela 20 de Julio neighbourhood, one of the most popular because it is home to the largest soccer stadium in Colombia. In his neighbourhood, this businessman sells beer, pop, snacks and fast food. He started his business 12 years ago in his mother-in-law's home, and later moved it to a building given by the city town hall. This location is bigger and located in a sector with greater foot traffic. His store is open to the public from 7 am to 10 pm. On the weekends he usually extends the sale day to 3 am. Competition is strong, but everyone sells and they all have a customer base. This is his fifth loan with the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, and he plans to invest it in the wholesale purchase of beer, drinks and supplies for his food. His average weekly sales are $ 800,000. The margin of utility is 30% and the level of indebtedness is 21%. The season in which sales are the best starts in December and extends to the end of February when the carnivals of Barranquilla, the most important folk festival of Colombia, declared oral heritage by UNESCO, end.
Next year this businessman plans to make improvements to his business to increase comfort and stimulate sales. He has already started saving for improving the bathroom and kitchen of his home which are in bad condition- this is his next goal.

loans.use: the wholesale purchase of beer, drinks and supplies for his food.

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina B. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 43 years old. Divina is married and has 5 children. Her eldest child is 22 years old and the youngest is 12. To make a living, Divina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Divina's husband also manages a tricycle transportation business. He says the income from it helps in their daily needs. 

Divina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Divina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Divina is requesting a new loan of 17,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers such as manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Alvaro Antonio

texts.es: El señor Alvaro Hernández G. es un alegre microempresario que vive con su esposa y 4 hijos menores de edad en el barrio Siete de Abril de Barranquilla. El tiene un puesto estacionario en el cual vende cocteles de mariscos como: ostras, camarón, caracol, chipi-chipi, pulpo y calamar. Su negocio está ubicado frente al antiguo estadio municipal de futbol Romelio Martínez, donde el equipo local, Junior de Barranquilla, se coronó campeón nacional en dos ocasiones. El señor Alvaro tiene 30 años de experiencia en el oficio y aunque ha cambiado de ubicación en varias oportunidades su kiosco, siempre conserva una clientela acreditada. El secreto de su éxito está en la calidad de los ingredientes que llevan sus cocteles como: salsa de tomate, cebolla blanca, extracto de ajo con vinagre blanco, picante, limón, mayonesa, mostaza, salsa negra, aceite de oliva y sal. Este es el primer préstamo que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra al por mayor de mariscos e ingredientes. Los días de mayor venta son los viernes y sábados. El promedio de ventas diarias es de $ 80.000 COP y el margen de utilidad es del 40%. El señor Alvaro dice que gracias a su negocio está sacando adelante a su familia. Todos sus hijos estudian, compró la casa en la que actualmente vive y la está remodelando poco a poco. El disfruta su trabajo porque la mayoría de sus clientes son sus amigos con los cuales conversa mientras degustan su coctel. Definitivamente, este microempresario ama su oficio y esto se evidencia en la destreza que tiene para preparar sus productos y la cara de felicidad que siempre lo embarga.
texts.en: Mr Alvaro Hernández G. is a happy businessman who lives with his wife and 4 grown children in the Siete de Abril neighbourhood of Barranquilla. He has a stationary kiosk where he sells seafood cocktails such as: oysters, prawns, snails, clams, octopus and squid. His business is located in front of the old Romelio Martinez municipal soccer stadium, where the local team, Junior de Barranquilla, was crowned national champion on two occasions. Alvaro has 30 years of experience in this business, and although he has changed locations at several occasions, he always conserves his customer base. The secret of his success is in the quality of the ingredients that he uses in his cocktails such as: tomato sauce, white onion, garlic extract with white vinegar, hot spices, lemon, mayonnaise, mustard, black sauce, olive oil and salt.  This is his first loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, and he plans to invest in the wholesale purchase of seafood and ingredients. The best sales days are Fridays and Saturdays. The average daily sales are $ 80,000 COP and the margin of utility is 40%. Alvaro says that he is getting his family ahead thanks to his business. All of his children study. He bought the house where they currently live and he is remodeling it bit by bit. He enjoys his work because the majority of his customers are his friends and he talks with them while they eat. He clearly loves his job and this is evident in the care that he takes in preparing his food and the face of joy that he always wears.

loans.use: the wholesale purchase of seafood and ingredients.

loans.name: Mujeres Buscando Un Futuro Group

texts.es: Hortensia es la presidenta del grupo “MUJERES BUSCANDO UN FUTURO” formado por 9 socias, ella es casada  uno D. sus 4 hijos también integra el grupo, el negocio al que se dedica es la venta D. productos D. belleza, lo que mas le agrada D. su trabajo es que ella misma dispone D. su tiempo por ser independiente, debido a esto pueD. dedicarse a otras cosas, su hija pronto dará a luz un bebe y Hortensia lo que mas desea es cuidar a su nieto, mientras su hija trabaja pero ella también quiere poder seguir en su negocio que es una ayuda mas para la familia, la forma en que capta clientes es visitándolos casa por casa ofreciéndoles  diversos productos como perfumes, maquillaje, talcos, cremas etc. con su trabajo ella pueD. cubrir el pago D. los pedidos que sus clientes le hacen, D. esa manera les da  facilidades D. pago y también sus ganancias son mejores,  lo que hará con su reciente préstamo es abastecerse D. mas productos sobretodo perfumes y maquillaje  que es lo que mas se venD. por estas fechas.
texts.en:
Hortensia is the president of the "Mujeres Buscando un Futuro" ["Women Seeking a Future"] group, which has nine members.  Hortensia is married and one of her four children is also a member of the group.

Hortensia's business is selling beauty products.  Having time to be independent is what she most appreciates about her job.  It allows her time to dedicate herself to other things.  Her daughter is about to give birth and what Hortensia most wants is to take care of her grandchild while her daughter works. However, she also wants to be able to continue with her own business because it provides an additional help to the family.

She wins clients by going house to house offering a variety of products, such as perfumes, makeup, powders, creams, etc.  With income from her business, Hortensia is able to cover the costs of her customers' orders.  This makes it easier for her customers to pay and it also improves her earnings.  She will use this loan to stock up with more products, especially perfumes and makeup, since those are what she sells the most of these days.

loans.use: to buy perfumes, makeup, etc.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
Maria Luz C. T. tiene 51 años de edad, Es casada vive con  el esposo y con los hijos en el Cantón Chillanes Provincia Bolívar. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. UNION SAN ANTONIO, Recinto San Antonio parroquia San José del Tambo distancia de la oficina a 150 minutos de la comunidad se encuentra dentro de los límites del Cantón Chillanes. Esta Ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Maria Luz se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz, cacao, naranja, yuca. Compra sus productos en el Comercial  Matilde Ester y vende los  productos en Bucay.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz, cacao, naranja yuca. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una finca.

Le gusta recorrer varios lugares.
texts.en:
Maria Luz C. T. is 51 years old, married, and lives with her husband and their children in the canton of Chillanes, in Bolívar province.  She has four children.

The members of the "Union San Antonio" rural communal bank are based in the precinct of San Antonio, which is in San José del Tambo parish and Chillanes province. Their community is located approximately 150 minutes from the office of Cooperativa San Jose. The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn, cocoa, oranges, and cassava. Collectively, they have many years of experience in this type of work.

Maria Luz plants corn, cocoa, oranges, and cassava.  She buys products in the Matilde Esther market and sells her produce in Bucay.

She is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural supplies and fertilizers for cultivating corn, cocoa, oranges, and cassava. With the economic support provided by this loan, she will be able to better meet her needs. She faces challenges like insect plagues and crop illnesses, as well as changes in the climate. Her dream is to buy her own plot of land.

She enjoys visiting different places.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
44-year-old Gemma E. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is married and has two children aged 16 and 17. Gemma is engaged in farming. She plants rice crops and sells her harvest at the market. She also planted coconut trees on a part of her land. Gemma works hard to build her business and sustain her family.

Gemma needs fertilizers and other farm inputs. She applied for a loan of 17,000 PHP from CEVI, a KIVA partner. She will use the loan to buy what she needs for her farm. She is hopeful that this loan will help her maintain and improve her business.

loans.use: To buy farm inputs such as fertilizers

loans.name: Arnoldo Jose

texts.es:
El Señor Arnoldo H., es agricultor, tiene 36 años de edad, vive en la Comarca El Coyolito en Estelí, casado y tiene 2 hijos; con mas 20 anos de experiencia en este sector. Inicio su experiencia ayudando a sus padres a sembrar frijoles y con los bueyes, a la corta edad de 8 años, en sus tiempos libres, usualmente cuando regresaba de la escuela.
Desafortunadamente según el expresa, sus padres nunca le dieron verdadera importancia a los Estudios, por lo que los abandono a los 18 anos de edad y se caso; Desde entonces, se dedico solamente a la agricultura, en sociedad con un amigo, se dedicaron especialmente a la siembra de frijoles y hortalizas tales como Cebolla y Chiltoma y un poco de Tomate; estas cosechas le permitieron obtener su casita y algunas herramientas agrícolas.
Su Esposa horna 2 veces a la semana y estos ingresos ayudan un poco con parte de los gastos de la casa y de los hijos.
El esta realizando este préstamo, para comprar algunos insumos, ya que según el, de esta manera su producción será mas eficiente.
De la ganancia obtenida en esta cosecha, a el le gustaría ampliar  su área de siembra, mejorar un poco su casita y ayudar a su hija con los estudios.
texts.en: Mr Arnoldo H., a farmer, is 36 and lives in the El Coyolito Region in Esteli. He is married and has 2 children. He has over 20 years' experience in agriculture. He began helping his parents at the young age of 8 in his free time, normally when he would come home from school. He would help to plant beans and with the oxen. Unfortunately, he says, his parents never truly valued education, and he abandoned his studies at the age of 18 and got married. Since then, he has worked exclusively in agriculture, with a friend. They sow beans and vegetables such as onions, sweet peppers and some tomatoes. These harvests have allowed him to obtain his home and some agricultural tools. His wife bakes twice a week, and the income from this helps a little with part of the household costs and the costs of maintaining their children. He is taking out this loan to purchase some agricultural inputs, which according to him will make his production more efficient. With the earnings from this harvest, he would like to expand his sowing area, improve his home a little and help his daughter with her studies.

loans.use: the purchase of agricultural inputs

This area is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour: the sowing of corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. They spend a lot of time doing this work. Fausto Absalon works in agriculture, sowing corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. He buys his products in the Matilde Esther Market and sells them in Bucay. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn, cocoa, oranges and yucca. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his necessities. He has to confront challenges such as plagues and diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to buy a plot of land. loans.name: La Benito Juarez Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama la Benito Juárez porque así se llama la colonia en donD. viven ellas ,esta ubicado en MoreL. en México ,esta comunidad se distingue por su tradicional feria del pezcado la cual fue el 28  D. noviembre ,el grupo está conformado por 10 integrantes.Roció Gutiérrez es la tesorera del grupo, ella se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes negocio que inicio hace 1  año .solicita su préstamo para comprar más mercancía para la tienda, tiene 36 años D. edad, estudió la secundaria, es casada  ella tiene 4 hijos: tres mujeres D. 15, 11,5 años y su pequeño hijo D. 3 años, sus clientas se sienten agusto por que siempre encuentran L. productos que necesitan. Al momento D. solicitar su préstamo  se siente contenta por que con el podrá comprar detergentes y productos enlatados que le hacen falta en su tienda  y con las ganancias ella comprara  un refrigerador para su casa.
texts.en: This group is called Benito Juárez because that is the name of the neighborhood where they live.  It is located in Mexico in the state of MoreL., and the community stands out for its traditional fish market which was November 28th.  The group is comprised of 10 members and Roció Gutiérrez is the group treasurer.  She works selling groceries, a business which she began a year ago.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more merchandise for the store.  She is 36 years old, has secondary education, and is married with four children – three girls (15, 11, and 5 years old) and a small 3-year-old son.  Her customers feel at ease because they always find the products that they need.  Upon applying for her loan, she is happy because she will be able to buy detergents and canned goods that she is lacking in her store and with the earnings, she will buy a refrigerator for her house.

loans.use: Merchandise (detergents and canned goods)

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 49 years old. Gloria is married and has three children. She plants rice crops and vegetables. She sells her harvest at her town's market. Gloria wants to grow her business and she works hard to achieve it. She also aims to improve her family's living conditions.

Gloria applied for a loan of PHP 12,000 from CEVI to supply her farm with inputs. She will buy additional seeds and fertilizers using the loan. Gloria hopes to increase her harvest.

loans.use: To purchase additional seeds and fertilizers

He belongs to a group of members of the rural branch of the communal bank "Unión San Antonio" in the neighborhood of San Antonio in the parish of San José del Tambo, located 150 minutes from the head office of the communal bank. This branch is specialized in short-term agricultural loans, mainly to finance corn, cacao, orange and cassava crops. They have been in this activity for a long time.

Fausto Homero is a farmer. He grows corn, cacao, oranges and cassava. He buys his supplies in the Matilde Esther Shopping Center and sells his products in Bucay.

He applies for the loan to buy farm consumables and fertilizer for his corn, cacao, orange and cassava crops. The loan will help him to pay for needed supplies. The challenges he faces are the plagues of insects and rats, the diseases and the variable weather. He dreams to live in his own dwelling.

He likes sport.

loans.use: To buy farm consumables and fertilizer

loans.name: Lenin Antonio

texts.es: El señor Lenin Antonio A. Jiménez sigue elaborando correas, billeteras, monederos y bolsos de cuero en el taller que funciona en su casa ubicada en el municipio de Barranquilla.  Tiene su puesto de venta en las afueras del centro comercial Metrocentro al  sur de la ciudad. Ya canceló su anterior Credikiva con gran puntualidad gracias al cual logró aumentar sus ventas, sus utilidades y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda en lo que se refiere a pisos, pañetes y techo. Con el actual préstamo planea comprar cuero, hilos, herrajes y accesorios. En un futuro no muy lejano piensa comprar una moderna máquina troqueladora para dejar de pagar por ese servicio y darle un mejor acabado a sus productos. Ya está ahorrando para lograr esa meta. El señor Lenin le manda un saludo muy especial a todos sus financiadores de Kiva, deseándoles que tengan un feliz año 2011, pleno de abundancia, mucha salud y prosperidad en compañía de todos sus  familiares. Que siempre continúen apoyando a personas emprendedoras que carecen de recursos económicos en muchos países pobres. Para conocer la anterior presentación del microempresario, pueden acceder a través del siguiente link:	http://www.kiva.org/lend/200668
texts.en:
Señor Lenin Antonio A. Jiménez makes leather straps, billfolds, purses and handbags in his workshop located in his house in Barranquilla.  His sales location is in the outskirts of the Metrocentro commercial center to the south of the city.  He paid off his previous Kiva loan with excellent punctuality thanks to which he was able to increase his sales and profits, and improve the condition of his home (flooring, plasterwork, and ceiling).  With this current loan he plans to purchase leather, threads, hardware, and accessories.  In the near future he hopes to buy a modern stamping machine so he no longer has to pay for this service, to give his products a better finish.  He is already saving to accomplish this goal.  

Señor Lenin sends a special greeting to all his Kiva lenders, wishing them and their families a happy new year for 2011 full of abundance, health and prosperity.  May they always continue helping enterprising people in poor countries who lack economic resources.  To learn about this microentrepreneur's previous loan, you can go to the link http://www.kiva.org/lend/200668.

loans.use: Purchase leather, thread, needles

loans.name: Noe

texts.es:
El Señor Noe F., es agricultor, tiene 31 años de edad, vive en la Comarca Cerco de Piedra, La Concordia, en Estelí, casado y tiene 3 hijos; con mas de 15 años de experiencia en este sector. Inicio su experiencia a la de 14 años, con sus padres y hermanos, quienes le daban una pequeña ayuda para sus gastos personales.
Decidió independizarse a los 18 años, su Papa le regalo 2 pequeños terrenos que le sirvieron para empezar y obtuvo su primer crédito. Comenzó sembrando Cebolla y también se dedica a la Compra Venta de Ganado; esta ultima actividad la hace en pequeña escala, los ingresos que obtiene son para los gastos de la casa.
Con este crédito el quiere comprar insumos para siembra de Cebolla; el piensa que su cultivo será mas vigoroso, para ofrecerlo al mercado en mejor precio.
texts.en:
Noe F. is a farmer.  He is 31 and lives in the Cerco de Piedra region, La Concordia, in Estelí.  He is married and has 3 children.  Noe began farming with his parents and brothers 14 years ago and his family would give him a little money for personal expenses.
He decided to go out on his own when he was 18 and his father gave him 2 small fields that he used to begin, and he took out his first loan.  He started planting onions and he also started buying and selling cattle.  He does the latter on a small scale-the income he uses for household expenses.

With this loan he would like to buy supplies to plant onions. He thinks that his crop will be stronger and he can sell it at the market for a higher price.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Gricelda De La Cruz

texts.es:
Gricelda se dedica al comercio desde hace tres año en la venta de refrescos caseros, casada, su esposo trabaja como mecánico automotriz,  tiene tres hijos, como objetivo principal es que sus hijos sean unos profesionales. Trabajan fuertemente para ofrecerle a sus familia lo mejor dentro de sus posibilidades. En el negocio ha encontrado dificultades como el costo de los precios y la baja que provoca en las ventas. Inicio vendiendo helados y para ayudarse con los gastos de la casa ahora vende refrescos. Para este año quiere lograr aumentar sus ingresos con mayores variedades de refresco agregando repostería. 
Su vivienda es humilde y requiere de mejoras. El préstamo lo utilizara para la compra de materiales de construcción como: cemento, arena, piedrines, hierro, clavos de acero, goloso, bloques, perlines para la construcción de unos de los muros. Estaremos fomentando al desarrollo del mejoramiento de vida ya que obtendrá seguridad y protección.
texts.en: Gricelda has been a merchant for three years, selling homemade drinks. She is married, and her husband is an auto repair mechanic. She has three children, and her main goal is for her children to be professionals. She and her husband work hard to offer their family the best that they can offer. She has encountered difficulties in her business, such as high prices and the low sales that they produce. She started off selling ice cream, and she now sells drinks to help with the household costs. This year, she wants to achieve an increase in her income with a greater variety of drinks, and also start selling desserts. Her home is humble and needs improvements. She will use the loan for the purchase of construction materials such as: cement, sand, stone, iron, steel nails, blocks and timber for the construction of some walls. This loan will promote the improvement of her life as she will obtain security and protection.

loans.use: the purchase of construction materials

loans.name: Glenis Graciela

texts.es: La señora Glenis Graciela Gutiérrez O. tiene 42 años y vive con sus dos hijas en el barrio Moderno de la ciudad de Barranquilla. En su casa tiene un pequeño almacén de miscelánea en el cual vende cremas, perfumes, accesorios femeninos y artículos de papelería. Ahí también funciona una peluquería en la cual ofrece servicio de corte de cabello, tintes, alicer y arreglo de uñas. Ambos negocios comenzaron en el año 2000. En su sector es ampliamente conocida por su jovialidad y buen sentido del humor, eso le ha valido el aprecio de todos sus vecinos quienes siempre recurren a ella cuando necesitan contar un problema y recargarse de energía positiva. Por la temporada decembrina, la afluencia de los clientes a la peluquería los fines de semanas se triplicó y debió contratar a una estilista a la que le paga por producción. Este es el primer crédito que la señora Glenis tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en comprar artículos de papelería para atender la próxima temporada escolar que comienza en Enero. Las ventas promedio semanal de ambos negocios es de $ 600.000 COP , el margen de utilidad es del 40% y el de endeudamiento del 14%. Los planes a mediano plazo de la microempresaria son los de terminar el segundo piso de su vivienda que aún está en obra negra para organizar mejor su peluquería y su almacén. Su hija mayor se ha mostrado interesada en el oficio de estilista y Glenis ya la está entrenando para que le colabore.
texts.en:
Glenis Graciela Gutiérrez O. is 42 years old and lives with her two daughters in Moderno neighborhood, in the city of Barranquilla.  She has a small general store in her home where she sells creams, perfume, ladies' accessories and stationery.  She also runs a hairdressing salon in her home, offering hair cuts, hair coloring, hair straightening and manicures.  She started both of these businesses in the year 2000.

Glenis is well known in her neighborhood for her cheerfulness and good sense of humor.  This has meant that she is held in very high esteem by her neighbors who always come to her when they need to tell someone their problems and recharge themselves with positive energy.  During the month of December, the number of customers to Glenis' hairdressing salon at weekends tripled and she had to hire a stylist to help her.

This is Glenis' first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and she plans to invest it in buying stationery items for the upcoming back-to-school season that begins in January.  The average weekly sales of both of Glenis' businesses is 600,000 Colombian pesos.  Her profit margin is 40% and her debt is 14%.  Her plans in the medium term are to finish off the second floor of her home which is still being built and to better organize her hairdressing salon and her store.  Her eldest daughter has shown interest in becoming a stylist and Glenis is training her so that she can work with her.

loans.use: To buy stationery items

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a farmer from the town of Sto. Niño, Agusan Del Sur. She is 56 years old and already a widow. She has eight children to support. 

Josephine plants and harvests rice crops. She sells her harvest to the community. Josephine does her best to provide what her family needs. She works extra hard as most of her children are still in school.

Josephine needs farm supplies and equipment. She is requesting a loan of 16,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) from Community Economic Ventures, Inc., a Kiva partner in the Philippines. Josephine says this loan would help her farm in a big way.

loans.use: To purchase general farm supplies and equipment

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es: El señor Carlos Alberto G. A. tiene 37 años y vive en compañía de su esposa y tres hijos en el barrio Ciudadela 20 de Julio de Barranquilla. El tiene un puesto estacionario en las afueras del centro comercial Metrocentro, al sur de la ciudad, en el cual vende estuches para teléfonos celular, control remoto de televisores y CD de música y videos. El negocio comenzó en el año 2006 por sugerencia de un amigo quien le prestó un pequeño capital para comprar mercancía. Al principio tuvo dificultad para ubicar los pedidos de los clientes por la enorme cantidad de CD que tiene, pero hoy en día es un experto, e incluso, se atreve a recomendar canciones de artistas populares o películas. Este es el cuarto préstamo que tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo y planea invertirlo en la compra de artículos de papelería como agendas, libretas y lapiceros para atender la próxima temporada escolar que comienza en Enero.  El promedio de ventas semanales es de $ 600.000 COP y el margen de utilidad es del 40%.Antes de estar vinculado a la Fundación, el microempresario se financiaba con créditos de particulares que debía cancelar en cuotas diarias y a unas elevadas tasas de interés. Por la experiencia positiva que ha tenido en la Fundación, ha recomendado a varios amigos comerciantes que también se vinculen. Recientemente  el señor Carlos se capacitó en contabilidad, mercadeo y endeudamiento. Esto le ha permitido llevar un mejor control de sus cuentas que se reflejan en la puntualidad de sus pagos y el mejoramiento de la calidad de vida de su familia. Su sueño en el futuro es comprar una casa propia y para lograrlo ya empezó a ahorrar.
texts.en:
Carlos Alberto G. A. is 37 years old and lives with his wife and three children in 'Ciudadela 20 de Julio' neighborhood of Barranquilla.  He has a stationary stall just outside the Metrocentro shopping mall, in the south of the city, where he sells cell phone cases, television remote controls, music CDs and videos.  He started his business in 2006.  It was his friend who suggested he start his business and this friend also loaned him a small amount of capital with which to buy merchandise.

At the beginning, Carlos had trouble locating his customers' orders because of the enormous quantity of CDs but he is now an expert and he even dares to recommend songs by popular artists, or movies.

This is Carlos' fourth loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo and he plans to invest it in buying stationery items such as diaries, notebooks and pens for the upcoming back-to-school season which begins in January.  His average weekly sales are 600,000 Colombian pesos and his profit margin is 40%.  Before he came to Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, this small businessman financed his business with personal loans that he had to pay back in daily instalments, paying very high interest rates.  As a result of his own positive experience with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, he has recommended us to several friends who are also salespeople and they have joined too.

Recently, Carlos received training in accountancy, marketing and debt management.  This has enabled him to take better control of his accounts and this has been reflected in the punctuality of his repayments and the improvement of his family's quality of life.  His dream for the future is to buy his own home and he has already started to save in order to achieve this goal.

loans.use: To buy stationery items

loans.name: Indira Zaida

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Irma Cristina; ella tiene 33 años de edad y es separada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de restaurant,ella atiende desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m,ella prepara diferentes platos típicos cusqueños como lechon,lomo saltado,caldo de gallina entre otros platos,la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el servicio de restaurant.La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para cocinar para el restaurant.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Irma Cristina is a member of the "BUENA ESPERANZA" (Good Hope) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Irma Cristina is 33 years old, separated and has two children.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her restaurant business.  She serves in her restaurant from 8.00am to 6.00pm.  She prepares different traditional Cusco dishes such as sucking pig, salted pork loin, chicken soup, etc.  She would like to expand and improve her restaurant service.

Irma Cristina is requesting this loan to buy products for cooking in her restaurant.  She is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy products for cooking in her restaurant

loans.name: Yamileth Del Socorro

texts.es:
La Senora Yamileth C., tiene 40 años de edad, casada con el Señor Marvin Davila con el que procreo 3 hijos, originaria de Condega, en Esteli.
Incio sus actividades comerciales de una manera muy humilde, vendiendo una bolsa de pan y café en su pulpería, y poco a poco le fue agregando más productos, luego adquirió su primer crédito y fue mejorando. Además de tener esta pulpería, también vende raspados y con esto se ayuda también con los gastos.
Espera que este crédito le ayude a mejorar sus ingresos; pues dentro de sus planes ahora esta abrir una agencia de venta de agua purificada y ser la distribuidora del Barrio.
texts.en: Mrs Yamileth C., age 40, is married to Mr Marvin Davila, with whom she has 3 children. She is from Condega, Esteli. She started off in business very humbly, selling bread and coffee in her convenience store. Bit by bit she expanded with more products, and later she received her first loan and improved. In addition to having this convenience store, she also sells snowcones. This helps her with her costs as well. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve her income; part of her current plans is to open a purified water sales company and be her neighbourhood distributor.

loans.use: the purchase of items for convenience store

loans.name: Edwin Jonathan

texts.es:
Edwin Jonathan C. V. tiene 19 años, Es soltero, vive con los padres en  el  Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. No tiene hijos. 

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto campo alegre, por la parroquia guare perteneciente al cantón baba, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.  Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Edwin Jonathan se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Cepeda y Comercial Chicaisa y vende los  productos en el Comercial López.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar un terreno.

Le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Edwin Jonathan C. V. is 19 years old.  He is single and lives with his parents in Ventanas canton, in Los Ríos province.  He doesn't have any children.

The members of the SAN JACINTO community bank are located in Campo Alegre precinct, in Guare parish, in Baba canton.  The members of this group work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.  They have been in this business for a long time.

Edwin Jonathan is a farmer.   He grows corn and rice.  He buys his products in the Cepeda shopping area and sells his products in López shopping area.

Edwin Jonathan is requesting this loan to buy farming supplies and fertilizers for growing corn and rice.  The support of this loan will help him to financially cover his needs.  He faces challenges such as insect infestations, plant diseases and changes in the weather.  His dream is to buy a plot of land.

He likes taking part in sports.

loans.use: To buy farming supplies

loans.name: Carlos Vinicio

They spend much time doing this work. Carlos Vinicio works in agriculture, sowing corn and rice. He buys his products in the Cepeda and Chicaisa Markets and sells them in the Lopez Market. He is requesting this loan for the purchase of agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn and rice. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as plagues, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to buy a car and a sheller. He enjoys playing sports.

La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito D. Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia D. Cusco y departamento D. Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Justina; ella tiene 50 años D. edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio D. propietaria D. una banda musical llamada Show F.,ella dirige la banda musical animando diferentes compromisos como bautizos,cumpleaños y matrimonios,la socia quiere mejorar la banda musical. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar los uniformes para la banda musical.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos D. su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the "Buena Esperanza" Community Bank. The bank is located in the district of Cusco, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. The member is Mrs Justina. She is 50, married and has 3 children. She alternates her daily activities with her business. She owns a musical band named Show F.. She manages the band, arranging different engagements such as baptisms, birthdays and weddings. She wants to improve the musical band. She is requesting this loan to purchase uniforms for the musical band. She is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of the quotas.

loans.use: The member is requesting this loan to purchase uniforms for the musical band.

loans.name: Jose Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Señor José M., tiene 33 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Esteli, al igual que su padre es comerciante.
Comenzó a trabajar ayudando a sus padres desde la corta edad de 8 años, pero desde los 17, empezó a trabajar como Guarda de Seguridad, y fue cuando empezó a ahorrar dinero para poner una pulpería muy modesta, comenzó vendiendo únicamente Gas Butano, luego obtuvo su primer crédito y comenzó a expandir un poco mas con productos.
En la actualidad trabaja todavía de Guarda de Seguridad, tiene turno cada 2 días, y su esposa le ayuda atendiendo la pulpería cuando el no esta.
Con este crédito piensa invertir un poco mas en su negocio para mejorar sus ingresos y ampliar el espacio de su casa, para ampliar su negocio, pues la pulpería esta ubicada en su casa.
texts.en: Mr José M., age 33, lives in the city of Esteli, and is a merchant like his father. He started working helping his parents at the young age of 8, but then began working as a security guard when he was 17. This was when he began to save money to open a very modest convenience store. He started selling only butane gas, and later obtained his first loan and started to expand a bit more with products. He currently still works as a security guard. He has a shift every 2 days. His wife helps him by tending to the convenience store when he is not around. With this loan, he will invest a bit more in his business to improve his income and expand the space in his house-- to expand his business, since the convenience store is in his house.

loans.use: to invest in his business to expand a bit
