loans.name: Hernán

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “VIRGEN DEL ROSARIO DEL CUSCO”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.
El socio es el Sr. Hernán; el tiene 27 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; el socio se dedica al servicio de taxi, el trabaja todos los días por el día a veces trabaja de noche pero de preferencia lo hace por el día, esta es la única actividad que realiza por el momento y espera poder encontrar otro tipo de trabajo para así poder brindarles una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.  

El socio solicita el préstamo para la compra de un auto para su uso personal y para algunos días ponerlo como servicio de taxi. 

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to the "Virgen del Rosario de Cusco" ["Virgin of the Rosary of Cusco"] Communal Bank, which is located in the district, province, and department of Cusco.

This borrower is Mr. Hernán.  He is 27 years old, married, and has three children.  He works providing taxi service.  He works every day and sometimes at night, although he prefers to work during the day.  This is his only job right now but he hopes to find another type of work so that he can offer his family a better quality of life.

Mr. Hernán is requesting this loan to buy a car for his own personal use and to also use as a taxi on certain days.

He is happy to receive this loan and promises to make his repayments according to the established schedule.

loans.use: to buy a car for personal use and to use as a taxi

loans.name: Jeffer Omar

texts.es:
Jeffer es un joven emprendedor, padre de una hija.  Dedicándose a su propio negocio la venta de ropa, zapatos, cosméticos, iniciando con apoyo de su mama. 
Quien facilito parte del capital para comenzar a trabajar en ventas ya que no tenía un trabajo fijo. Iniciando con pequeñas compras de mercadería lo que con financiamiento de Afodenic, logro incrementar sus ventas, ganancias a si como la captación de sus clientes.
El vende ambulante en varios lugares de la capital de Managua. Este es su tercer crédito  con la institución el cual, ha demostrado un buen comportamiento de pago. Con este nuevo préstamo comprara ropa como: pantalones, camisas, blusas, carteras, fajas, zapatos y perfumenes variados. Lo que espera cumplir con sus pedidos y expectativas. 
Como meta es lograr tener su propia vivienda.
texts.en: Jeffer is a young entrepreneur and the father of one little girl. He has his own business selling clothing, shoes and cosmetics which he started with the support of his mother, who provided part of the start-up capital for him to start working in sales as he did not have a steady job. He started off with small purchases of merchandise, which with the help of Afodenic allowed him to increase his sales and earnings and gain a customer base. He sells on the street in various spots in the capital of Managua. This is his third loan with the institution, and he has demonstrated a good payment history. With this new loan he will purchase clothing such as: pants, shirts, blouses, wallets, belts, shoes and varied perfumes. He hopes to fill his current orders and expected orders. His goal is to have his own house.

loans.use: He will buy: women's and men's clothing, wallets, and belts, among other products, to improve his sales.

Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una máquina para trabajar.

Le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en: Guillermo Gustavo C. V. is 22, single and lives with his parents in the Ventanas Canton, Los Rios Province. He does not have any children. The V.R.C. San Jacinto is located in the Campo Alegre district, in the Guare Parish belonging to the Baba Canton. This region is dedicated to short-cycle agricultural labour-the sowing of corn and rice. They spend a lot of time doing this work. Guillermo Gustavo works in agriculture sowing corn and rice. He purchases his products in the Cepeda and Chicaisa Markets and sells them in the Lopez Market. He is requesting this loan to purchase agricultural inputs and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn and rice. The support of this loan will help him economically to supply his needs. He confronts challenges such as pests, diseases and the varied climate. His dream is to buy a machine to work with. He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: agricultural inputs and fertilizers

loans.name: Jose Luis

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Jose Luis; el tiene 32 años de edad y es soltero y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de relojes,el vende en forma ambulatoria llevando a las diferentes tiendas que vende relojes,el socio quiere tener otra tienda para vender los relojes. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar relojes.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en: The member belongs to the "Buena Esperanza" Community Bank; the bank is located in the Cusco district, belonging to the province of Cusco and the department of Cusco. The member is Mr Jose Luis; he is 32, single and has 3 children. He alternates his daily activities with his watch sales business. He sells on the go, bringing his watches to different stores that sell watches. He wants to have another store to sell his watches. He is requesting this loan to purchase watches. He is happy to have this loan and promises to honour the payments of his quotas.

loans.use: The member is requesting this loan to purchase watches.

loans.name: Nueva Amistad De Huascar Group

texts.es:
NUEVA AMISTAD DE HUASCAR

Clemencia pertenece al grupo de Alcancía Comunal “NUEVA AMISTAD DE HUASCAR” este grupo esta conformado por 7 personas que por decisión del todo el grupo le otorgaron el cargo de presidenta este grupo tiene ya 7 años ½  trabajando con Edaprospo-Prosperidad este grupo se forme por el aviso de un amigo de la presidenta y así la presidenta fue buscando gente cumplida para formar el grupo.
Clemencia tiene 43 años de edad es madre soltera de 4 hijos los cuales 2 son dependientes (menores de edad) y 2 son independientes (mayores de edad) Clemencia tiene ya 15 años trabajando en un taller de artesanía y confecciona aretes y collares y asta la fecha con el ingreso de dinero que le brinda su negocio a logrado equipar su casa con artefactos y artículos del hogar – (muebles, cómodas, cocina, microondas, TV) Clemencia tiene pensado invertir el préstamo que le a brindado Edaprospo-prosperidad en su taller de artesanía pero su sueño de Clemencia a es poder exportar sus productos de artesanía y así su negocio podrá crecer.
texts.en: Clemencia belongs to the "Nueva Amistad de Huascar" Community Bank. This group is made up of 7 people who all decided to bestow the post of group president upon her. This group has already been working with Edaprospo-Prosperidad for 7 1/2 years. It was formed on the advice of a friend of Clemencia's, and Clemencia searched for people to form the group. Clemencia is 43 and is a single mother of 4 children, of whom 2 are dependent (minors), and 2 are independent (of legal age). Clemencia has worked in a craft workshop for 15 years and makes earrings and necklaces. With her income from this business, she has been able to stock her house with items- furniture, cabinets, a stove, a microwave, a tv, etc. Clemencia plans to invest this loan from Edaprospo-prosperidad in her art workshop, but her dream is to be able to export her products in order for her business to grow.

loans.use: investment in an art workshop.

loans.name: Marlene

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marlene; ella tiene 40 años de edad y es casada y tiene 2 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de agencia de viajes,ella se dedica al turismo,ella trabaja desde las 8.00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de agencia de viajes. La socia solicita el préstamo para implementar la agencia de viajes.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
This member is a part of the communal bank “BUENA ESPERANZA”; The bank is located in the district of Cusco, near the province and department of Cusco.

Mrs. Marlene is 40 years old and married with two children. She alternates her daily activities with the travel agency business.  She works in tourism from 8:00 a.m. until 7:00 p.m.  She wants to expand and improve her travel agency. She is requesting a loan to implement the travel agency. 

She is happy for the loan and agrees to comply with the payment of her dues.

loans.use: This member is requesting a loan to implement a travel agency business.

loans.name: La Capilla De San Lorenzo Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama  LA CAPILLA DE SAN LORENZO, está ubicado en la comunidad de San Lorenzo en Atlacomulco México. El grupo está conformado por 12 integrantes.Marina López es integrante del grupo. Tiene 33 años estudió hasta 3ro de secundaria, ella deseaba seguir estudiando y culminar el nivel medio superior, pero por recursos económicos sólo terminó la secuandaria, es ama de casa y también se dedica a la atención de su negocio de abarrotes tiene 3 hijos:1 mujer y 2 hombres a quienes desea brindarles una mejor calidad de vida. Ella se dedica a invertir en su tienda de abarrotes que inicio hace 1 año. Solicita el prestamo para invertir en ello y satisfacer la necesidad del cliente, con la inversión de su negocio ha atraido más clientes y ha mejorado la calidad de servicio, pero ella espera a futuro aumentar su capital e invertir en recaudería y asi dar un mejor servicio y calidad de producto, con el prestamo espera tener un crecimiento amplio que le permita cumplir sus objetivos y brindarles un mejor futuro a sus hijos y ayudar al desarrollo de la sociedad.
texts.en: This group is called  LA CAPILLA DE SAN LORENZO, and is located in San Lorenzo in Atlacomulco México. The group has 12 members. Marina López is a member of the group. She is 33 years old and studied until her 3rd year of high school.  She wanted to continue studying and complete high school, but because of economic resources she was not able to finish.  She works in a grocery business and is a housewife of 3 children: 1 girl and 2 boys for whom she wants to provide a better quality of life.  She dedicates herself to investing in her grocery business, which she started 1 year ago. She is requesting a loan to invest in her business and satisfy her customers' needs.  This investment will attract more customers and improve the quality of service.  In the future she hopes to raise capital and invest in fruits and vegetables and thus provide better products and services.  With the loan she hopes for growth that can meet her objectives and provide a better future for her children and assist in the development of society.

loans.use: Invest in groceries.

loans.name: Arco Iris Group

texts.es: Roberta tiene 49 años D. edad, es socia D. L. Alcancía Comunal “Arco Iris,” elL. es viuda tiene 6 hijos y participa en EDAPROSPO desD. hace 4 años, se dedica al negocio que heredó D. su madre hace diez años: venD. bebidas como: refrescos, gaseosas y agua ardiente que consumen los comuneros D. su zona, también se dedica  a L. ganadería y venta D. queso. El ingreso D. estos le permitió comprar algunos electrodomésticos que le hacían falta en su hogar, también compró un terreno para chacra, actualmente el ingreso D. dichas actividades cubre los gastos D. su hogar. Solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar comida para los vacunos que elL. cría, Roberta sueña con comprarse un terreno especialmente para criar ganado vacuno. Podemos apreciar en L. fotografía el momento en que se reunieron para su desembolso en las fiestas D. navidad, donD. no pudo asistir  el socio Ámel por motivo D. trabajo.
texts.en: Roberta is 49 years old and a member of the “Arco Iris" township.  She is widowed with 3 children and has participated in EDAPROSPO for 4 years.  She works in the business she inherited from her mother 10 years ago.  She sells beverages such as: soft drinks, soda and hot water consumed by villagers in her area.  She also raises cattle and sells cheese.  This income has allowed her to buy some appliances that were needed at home.  Also, she bought land to farm and the income from such activities cover household expenses.  She is requesting a loan from EDAPROSPO to buy food for the cattle she raises.  Roberta dreams of buying land especially for raising cattle.  We can see in the picture when they met for disbursement in the Christmas holidays, where the partner, Amel was unable to attend because of work.

loans.use: Food for cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basic grains, rice, beans, sugar, cans of oil, candies and other products

loans.name: Grupo Megan Group

texts.es: El grupo se llama Grupo Megan, el nombre se escogió porque cuando el grupo se estaba formando nació la hija de la señora que formo el grupo y así se llama la niña, el grupo esta en el Estado de Hidalgo y es de 12 integrantes.Olga Lidia es presidenta del grupo,tiene 36 años, es madre soltera, cuenta con estudios de secundaria y tiene  2 hijos. Se dedica a la venta de calzado y solicita el préstamo para poder surtir su negocio y elevar sus ventas. Sus clientes nos  comentan que es una mujer trabajadora, amable,de excelente carácter, ella sueña con poder  rentar un local  comercial para poder vivir tranquilamente sin verse en la necesidad de trasladarse a trabajar y  descuidar a sus hijos, dado que es madre soltera y único sosten económico de su familia.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Grupo Megan' (Megan's Group).  They chose this name because when this group was being set up, the lady who started it gave birth to her daughter whom she named Megan.  The group is located in the State of Hidalgo and has 12 members.

Olga Lidia is the president of this group.  She is 36 years old and a single mother.  She has a high school level of education and two children.  Her business is selling footwear and she is requesting this loan so that she can stock her business and increase her sales.  Her customers tell us that she is a hard-working, kind woman of excellent character.

Olga Lidia dreams of renting business premises so that she can live peacefully without having to move around to do her work and neglect her children.  She is a single mother and the only source of financial support for her family.

loans.use: To buy shoes

loans.name: Luz Oliva

texts.es:
MICROEMPRESARIA: Luz Oliva Londoño A.

Luz Oliva Londoño y su esposo durante mucho tiempo no tuvieron un trabajo fijo, lo que les dificultaba tener estabilidad económica en su familia.

Es por esto que hace 6 años Luz Oliva y su esposo decidieron comenzar a vender frutas. 
Su negocio inició en tablas y cajas en un semáforo de la ciudad pero luego de un tiempo por la calidad de sus productos Espacio Público les cedió un punto de venta para que tuvieran un espacio para mejorar su negocio.

Actualmente, Luz Oliva requiere de un crédito para comprar insumos para su negocio y de esta manera puede ofrecer mayor diversidad de productos y puede mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijas y nietas.
texts.en:
Small Businesswoman: Luz Oliva Londoño A.

Luz Oliva Londoño and her husband did not have steady work for a very long time.  That made it difficult to have financial stability in her family.

That is why Luz Oliva and her husband decided to start selling fruit six years ago.  Their business started with boards and boxes at a stoplight in the city.  After a while, “Espacio Público” (Public Space) gave them a sales spot because of the quality of their products.  They did this so that they would have a space to improve this business.

Luz Oliva now needs a loan to buy supplies for her business.  That way she will be able to offer a greater variety of products.  Then she will be able to improve the quality of life for her daughters and her granddaughters.

loans.use: Buy supplies

loans.name: Manuel

texts.es:
Manuel  tiene la edad de 42 años, casado con una familia de cuatro hijos, trabaja a una empresa privada como técnico en mantenimiento desde hace siete años, en donde ha venido mejorando la infraestructura de su casa. 
Cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposa ya que labora como maestra de primaria. 
Hoy mediante el financiamiento es para poder terminar de cerrar todo el techo de su casa, comprara ventana y puerta ya que solo las tiene con verjas lo que le es de gran relevancia poder tener en mejores condiciones de privacidad a su familia. Lo que comprara láminas de zinc, golosos, ventana y puertas hechas para cerrar.
texts.en:
Manuel is 42 years old, married and has four children.  He works in a private company as a maintenance technician.  He has been in this job for seven years and, over this time, he has been improving the infrastructure of his home.

Manuel has the financial support of his wife who works as an elementary school teacher.  He is requesting this loan so that he can finish off the roof of his house and buy a window and door since he only has iron grilles right now. This would help to improve his family's privacy.  He will buy sheets of corrugated metal, bolts, a window and a door so that he can close up his house.

loans.use: To buy sheets of corrugated metal, a door and a window so that he can finish closing up his house

loans.name: Mujeres Emprendedoras Maria Auxiliadora Group

texts.es:
El comité Mujeres Emprendedoras de la Ciudad de Remancito Chaco. 
El comité se  encuentra en el primer ciclo y se encuentran trabajando de forma muy organizada y están con mucha responsabilidad. 
Una de las integrantes es la señora Norma quien se dedica a la venta de cosméticos. Ella es una zona muy humilde, y muy alejada de la zona urbana por lo que elije días para salir y recorrer para ofrecer sus productos. 
Comenta que trabaja con mucho esfuerzo y que desea seguir creciendo. 
Ella solicita el préstamo para la compra de cosméticos como shampoo, maquillajes, perfumes y otros.
texts.en:
The Enterprising Women's Committee of the City of Remancito Chaco.

This committee is in its first loan cycle and its members are working together very responsibly and in a very organized way.  One of the group's members is Norma who sells cosmetics.  She lives in a very poor area which is located a long way from the urban area.  For this reason, she chooses days to go out and travel around offering her products for sale.  She comments that she works very hard and would like to continue growing her business.  She is requesting this loan to buy cosmetics such as shampoo, make up, perfume, etc.

loans.use: To buy perfume, make up, etc.

loans.name: Union Caro Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA UNIÓN CARO PORQUE SINGNIFICA LA UNIÓN DEL GRUPO Y ESTE GRUPO ESTÁ UBICADO EN LA COMUNIDAD DE LA CONCEPCIÓN CARO EN EL ESTADO DE MEXICO, ESTA COMUNIDAD SE CARACTERIZA PORQUE SUS HABITANTES SON POCOS PERO MUY TRABAJADORES Y CÁLIDOS. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 12 INTEGRANTES. LA TESORERA DEL GRUPO SE LLAMA MA. CONCEPCIÓN H.. TIENE 34 AÑOS, ESTUDIO HASTA EL SEXTO AÑO DE PRIMARIA, ES CASADA Y TIENE 3 HIJOS: 1 MUJER Y 2 VARONES. ELLA SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE LENCERÍA EN SU COMUNIADAD Y COMUNIDADES ALEDAÑAS, LO INICIO HACE UN POCO MÁS DE 2 AÑOS. SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PORQUE AL INICIO DE AÑO NUEVO CON LAS TRADICIONES DE INTERCAMBIO DE LENCERIA LA DEMANDA DE SU PRODUCTO ES CADA DIA MÁS. SUS CLIENTES ESTÁN CONTENTOS EN QUE TIENE VARIEDAD DE PRODUCTO A BUEN PRECIO ADEMÁS DE QUE SUS SUGERENCIAS VAN DE ACUERDO A LA NECESIDAD DE CADA CLIENTE, AGREGANDOLE EL CARISMA QUE TIENE PARA OFRECER SUS NUEVOS PRODUCTOS.CON ESTE PRESTAMO SE SIENTE TRANQUILA DE PODER CUMPLIR CON LOS PEDIDOS QUE YA TIENE EN PUERTA PUESTO QUE SUS GANANCIAS SERÁN BUENAS PARA PODER CONTRIBUIR A SUS GASTOS FAMILIARES Y PODER AHORRAR PARA LAS INSCRIPCIONES DE SUS HIJOS EN EL NUEVO SEMESTRE.OBSERVACIONES:LA SEÑORA BEATRIZ HERMENGILDO SI SALE EN LA FOTO PERO SE MOVIO Y NO SE ALCANZA A VER COMPLETO SU ROSTRO.
texts.en:
This group is called "Unión Caro".  The name signifies the unity (unión) of the group which is located in the community of Concepción Caro in the State of Mexico.  The community is noted for the fact that it has few residents but they are very hard-working and warm-hearted people.   The group has 12 members.

The group's treasurer is called Maria Concepción H..  She is 34 years old and studied up to the sixth year of elementary school.  She is married and has 3 children: 1 girl and 2 boys.

Maria's business is selling lingerie in her community and neighboring communities.  She started her business a little over 2 years ago.  She is requesting this loan because at the beginning of the year there is a tradition of exchanging lingerie.  This means that the demand for her products is high.  Maria's customers are happy because she sells a wide range of products at good prices and her suggestions always meet the needs of each customer.  She uses her charisma to sell her new products.

This loan makes Maria feel relaxed because she will be able to fill the orders that she already has.  This means that her profits will be good and she will be able to contribute to her family's expenses and save to pay her children's registration fees for the new semester.

Note: Mrs Beatriz H. appears in this photo but she moved and you can't quite make out her whole face.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

loans.name: Gabriel Abelardo

texts.es:
Gabriel Abelardo L. T.  tiene 20 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con la esposa y con los hijos,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 4 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto campo alegre, por la parroquia guare perteneciente al cantón baba, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.  Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Gabriel Abelardo se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Cepeda y Comercial Chicaisa y vende los  productos en el Comercial López.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es comprar una casa  y un terreno.

Le gusta practicar el deporte.
texts.en:
Gabriel Abelardo L. T. is 20 years old.  He is in a common-law marriage and lives with his wife and children in the canton of Ventanas, in Ríos province.  He has four children.

The members of the San Jacinto rural communal bank are based in the precinct of Campo Alegre ["Joyful Country"], which is in the parish of Guare and canton of Baba.  The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice.  Collectively, they have been doing this work for a long time.

Gabriel Abelardo plants corn and rice.  He buys products in the Cepeda and Chicaisa markets and sells his produce in López market.

He is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn and rice.  With the economic support of this loan, he will be able to better meet his needs.  He faces challenges like insect plagues and crop illnesses, as well as changes in the climate.  His dream is to buy his own house and a plot of land.

He enjoys playing sports.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Valeria Tatiana

texts.es:
Valeria Tatiana C. T. tiene 23 años de edad, Vive en Unión Libre, vive con el compañero y con los hijos,  vive en el Cantón de Ventanas  Provincia los Ríos. Tiene 2 hijos.

Los miembros de la V.R.C. SAN JACINTO, se encuentra ubicada en el recinto campo alegre, por la parroquia guare perteneciente al cantón baba, esta ventanilla se dedica labores agrícolas de ciclo corto siembra de maíz, arroz.  Esta actividad llevan mucho tiempo haciéndolo.

Valeria Tatiana se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y arroz. Compra sus productos en el Comercial Cepeda y Comercial Chicaisa y vende los  productos en el Comercial López.

Solicita el crédito para la comprar de insumos agrícolas y fertilizantes para el cultivo de maíz y arroz. Con el apoyo del crédito le ayudaría económicamente para suplir sus necesidades. Enfrentan desafíos como las plagas y enfermedades y la variedad del clima. Su sueño es culminar sus estudios.

Le gusta practicar la cocina.
texts.en:
Valeria Tatiana C. T. is 23 years old.  She is in a common-law marriage and lives with her partner and their children in the canton of Ventanas, in Ríos province.  She has two children.

The members of the San Jacinto rural communal bank are based in the precinct of Campo Alegre ["Joyful Country"], which is in the parish of Guare and canton of Baba. The members of this communal bank work in short-cycle agriculture, growing corn and rice. Collectively, they have been doing this work for a long time.

Valeria Tatiana plants corn and rice. She buys products in the Cepeda and Chicaisa markets and sells her produce in López market.

She is requesting this loan to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers for the cultivation of corn and rice. With the economic support of this loan, she will be able to better meet her needs. She faces challenges like insect plagues and crop illnesses, as well as changes in the climate. Her dream is to finish her studies.

She enjoys practicing her cooking.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and fertilizers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy zinc sheets for her roof and construction materials to finish the bathroom

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
Mercedes forma parte del banco comunal “Los Pioneros” perteneciente a la ciudad de Linares. Ella tiene un almacén en su casa, en donde vende principalmente abarrotes, desde hace 3 años. Este negocio, aunque no le produce muchas ganancias, debido a que tiene cerca supermercados y ferias libre, le ha servido para vivir, cubriendo sus necesidades básicas (alimentación y pago de cuentas). Vive sola con su esposo. 
Con este préstamo comprará mercadería. 
A pesar que Mercedes, producto del pasado terremoto del 27 de febrero de este año, perdió el 90% de su mercadería, tuvo un pequeño derrumbe de una pared de su casa y padece un dolor constante en una de sus piernas debido a várices,  ha podido mantenerse animada para continuar con su negocio e incluso soñar con tener una pequeña amasandería. 
A Mercedes le han servido mucho los préstamos para seguir adelante con su negocio. Además le gusta mucho la relación que existe entre sus compañeros de grupo, el buen trato de su asesora y las enseñanzas sobre cómo atender correctamente a los clientes. 
 Linares es un importante centro urbano de la región del Maule, ubicado en la zona centro del país. En esta zona se desarrolla de manera importante la producción agrícola y también vitivinícola sobresaliendo en el ámbito de las exportaciones. Destacan los cultivos de cereales (arroz, trigo, maíz y avena), hortalizas (remolacha, repollo, lechuga y acelga y legumbres) y frutas. Linares es la principal provincia productora de arroz, en Chile; de hecho, el 78% de la producción nacional de este cereal se da en esta provincia, especialmente en la comuna de Parral.
texts.en:
Mercedes is part of the communal bank "The Pioneers" belonging to the city of Linares. She has had a grocery shop in her house for 3 years, selling mainly groceries. This business, although it has not produced many profits because of nearby supermarkets and street markets, has enabled her to live, covering her basic necessities (food and bills). She lives with her husband. With this loan, she will purchase merchandise, since, due to the recent earthquake of February 27 of this year, Mercedes lost 90% of her merchandise because of a small collapse of one wall in her house. She suffers constant pain in one of her legs because of varicose veins, but she has been able to keep herself going by keeping up with her business, including her dream to have a small bakery. Loans have very much helped Mercedes to get ahead in her business. She also very much enjoys the relationships among her fellow group members, the good treatment from her consultant, and classes about how to correctly help clients.
Linares is an important urban center in the Maule region, located in the central region of the country. In this zone, agricultural production and wine production have been developed in an important way, excelling in the export sphere. They emphasize cultivation of cereals (rice, wheat, corn and oats), produce (sugar beets, cabbage, lettuce, chard, and other vegetables) and fruits. Linares is the principal provincial rice producer in Chile; in fact, 78% of the national production of this grain is done in this province, especially in the municipality of Parral.

loans.use: Mercadería

loans.name: Ariel

texts.es: El  Sr. Ariel es  soltero, ya que debido a su situación económica-social y a la vez que es un negocio que aprendio desde muy joven  se ha tenido que dedicar a la mecánica  de autos con la especialidad en arreglos de motores de vehículos. El  joven Ariel  viene trabajando desde ya hace bastante tiempo en el rubro de la mecánica   y por lo tanto a aprendido a detectar las épocas de bastante movimiento;  a la vez ya que su trabajo es de  sol a sol , el crédito que necesita es para la construcción de un tinglado en su propio taller ya que para estas fiestas de fin de año  ya que tiene  mas demanda de clientes es para eso prácticamente lo que le ha llevado a solicitar el crédito para esta temporada la compra de material de construcción, esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Ariel is single owing to his socio-economic situation.  He learned this business at a very young age and he has had to work as a car mechanic, specializing in repairing vehicles' engines.  Young Ariel has been working as a mechanic for quite a long time and he has learned to detect periods when there is a lot of business.  He works from sunrise to sunset.  He needs this loan to build a shed for his auto repair shop.  During the end-of-year festive season he has a lot of demand from his customers.  He is requesting a loan so that he can buy building materials.  He is grateful to the institution for the support they have provided.

loans.use: To build a shed for his auto repair shop

loans.name: Brigida Juana

texts.es: La Sra. Brígida cuenta con la actividad D. venta D. comida en un kiosco ubicado en la zona D. Achachicala ya lleva varios años con esta actividad con lo que ayuda en los gastos familiares a su esposo,  el crédito que solicito es para la refacción D. su kiosco ya que sufrió un accidente y se quemo parte del mismo, así también su persona también sufrio D. quemaduras  muy leves en las manos, aun así no dejo D. cocinar y seguir con sus actividades para poder cumplir con sus responsabilidades, ella es una cliente antigua desD. la gestión 2007 trabaja con la institución, es una Sra. Muy trabajadora y responsable, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs. Brígida sells food in a kiosk in the Achachicala zone. She has been doing this for several years, and uses this work to help her husband with the household costs. The loan that she is requesting is for the refurbishment of her kiosk, since there was an accident and part of it was burned. She also suffered very slight burns on her hands, but she has not stopped cooking and working in order to fulfill her responsibilities. She is an old customer of this institution and has been working with them since 2007. She is a very hard-working and responsible woman. She is grateful to the institution for the support that they offer.

loans.use: the purchase of material to rebuild her kiosk

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.es: La Señora María  tiene un consultorio medico en la Zona Garita de Lima en el cual brinda sus servicios como enfermera a los distintos pacientes que la visitan brindándole los servicios de curaciones,  test de embarazó, enfermedades de trasmisión sexual, control pre natal, Papanicolaou ella realiza también charlas de planificación  familiar gratuitas, además de brindar sus servicios en brigadas de salud con una institución de apoyo a las cuales va dos veces por mes, La Sra.  María tiene un hijo en edad escolar del cual se encarga ella sola, el crédito que esta solicitando es para realizar la instalación de un segundo consultorio en la Ciudad del Alto con el cual quiere darle un mejor futuro a su hijo, mejorando su calidad de vida, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
María has a medical office in the Garita Zona de Lima.  She provides nursing services to the different patients that go to see her.  She deals with treatments, pregnancy tests, sexually transmitted diseases, prenatal care, and pap smears. 

She also gives free talks on family planning.  In addition, she provides her services to a health team with a supportive institution.  She goes there twice a month. 

María has a school age child whom she is raising alone. 

She is requesting the loan in order to establish a second medical office in the city of Alto.  With this second office, she wants to give her son a better future and improve their quality of life.

She is very grateful to the institution for this loan.

loans.use: To open a second medical office

loans.name: Benita Soledad

texts.es: La Señora Benita  es cliente nueva de la institución, la señora Benita tiene un pequeño hijo al cual esta educando sola ya que su marido falleció hace dos años, la señora Benita se dedica a la peluquería en un pequeño salón que se encuentra en la zona de villa armonía ella trabaja todos los días exceptuando los jueves y domingos  ya que estos días se dedica a la venta de electrodomésticos en la feria 16 de julio en la ciudad del Alto, doña Benita se esfuerza mucho por salir adelante ella esta solicitando el préstamo para la compra de material  como ser champú , tintes para el cabello, liquido para permanente y otros productos que ella necesita para su salón, es una persona muy trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar de sus hijo, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del credito
texts.en: Mrs Benita is a new client of the institution. She has a small child whom she is raising alone, since her husband passed away two years ago. She is a hairdresser in a small salon in the Armonia Village. She works every day except for Thursdays and Sundays, as on these days she sells home electronics in the 16 de Julio Market in the city of El Alto. Benita works hard to get ahead. She is requesting this loan for the purchase of materials such as shampoo, hair dye, permanent dye and other products that she needs for her salon. She is a very hard-working person who is always thinking of the well-being of her son. She is grateful to the institution for the support offered through the authorization of this loan.

loans.use: The purchase of merchandise: shampoo, dyes, permanent liquid dyes and others

loans.name: Luis Carlos

texts.es: El Sr Luis es un Joven muy trabajador que dice que le debe todo lo que es a su madre ya que ella sola supo sacarlo adelante, El Sr Luis a su corta edad ya es propietario de un vehículo al cual lo hace trabajar como taxi de aquello recibe una renta diaria, el dinero que solicita es para el mantenimiento de su vehículo  y además de la compra de llantas nuevas para que este en buenas condiciones para este fin de año que mas ingresos tiene por las fiestas de esta época. El Sr Luis  indica que con el tiempo se comprara un segundo vehículo y uno le regalara a su madre a quien le esta profundamente agradecido por todos sus cuidados, es un joven muy responsable y esta agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mr Luis is a very hard-working youth who says that he owes all that he is to his mother, because she alone know how to make him succeed. At his young age he is already the owner of a car with which he works as a taxi driver. From this, he receives a daily income. The money that he is requesting is for the maintenance of his vehicle, and for the purchase of new tires so that it will be in good condition for the end of the year, when he will make more income because of the holidays. Luis says that in time he will buy a second vehicle and give one to his mother, to whom he is profoundly grateful for all of her care. He is a very responsible youth and is grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: the purchase of tires

loans.name: Jose Uriel

texts.es:
MICROEMPRESARIO: José Uriel T. V.
 
Hace 5 años José Uriel T. V. tuvo un infortunado accidente; al caer involuntariamente de un segundo piso quedó discapacitado, lo cual trajo consigo su imposibilidad para trabajar, puesto que se desempeñaba como oficial de construcción, labor que requería de todas sus facultades.
 
A raíz de esta difícil situación, su vida desmejoró mucho. Fue entonces cuando en su afán de salir adelante y generar sus propios ingresos, decidió empezar a hacer faroles y adornos navideños con materiales reciclables. 
 
Gracias a su empuje y enormes deseos de salir adelante, su negocio  ha crecido de manera considerable, teniendo la fortuna de conseguir nuevos clientes; es por ello precisamente, que requiere de un crédito para comprar insumos que le permitan tener mayor capacidad de producción y así mejorar cada día su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Small Businessman: José Uriel T. V.

José Uriel T. V. had an unfortunate accident five years ago.  An accidental fall from the second floor left him disabled.  He could not work any longer because he used to work in construction, and that required all of his faculties.   

Due to this difficult situation, his life got much worse.  That was when, in his desire to get ahead and generate his own income, he decided to start making lanterns and Christmas ornaments with recyclable materials.

Thanks to his drive and his enormous desire to get ahead, his business has grown considerably.  He has the good fortune of getting new customers.  That is precisely why he needs a loan to buy supplies.  The supplies will allow him to have a greater production capacity.  That will make his quality of life improve each day.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Agustina Reina

texts.es:
Agustina de 56 años, es una mujer trabajadora que hace años atrás con poco capital compro papelería para venderla a sus vecinos y conocidos pero por la buena administración que le dio a los ingresos obtenidos pudo ubicar una papelería.  

Viviendo en una zona urbana llamada Orquídeas ha trabajado durante año vendiendo papelería, cuadernos, y algunos víveres de primera necesidad ya que ella se ha acoplado a las necesidades que quieren las personas.  En la actualidad trabaja desde las 07h30am hasta las 22h00pm todos los días. Tiene preciosos económicos como por ejemplo una pluma a $ 0.25, un enlatado a $ 1.35, etc. 

Quiere seguir progresando para asegurar su vejez por eso quiere con el préstamo comprar enlatados, papelería, plumas etc. Uno de sus objetivos con el negocio es ampliarlo y seguir asegurando el capital para su negocio.
texts.en: Agustina, age 56, is a hard-working woman who started a stationery store a few years ago with a small amount of capital, to sell to her neighbours and acquaintances. Thanks to her good management of her income, she was able to open her stationery store. She lives in an urban zone called Orquideas and has worked for years selling stationery, notebooks and various basic staples, as she provides various necessities that people want. She currently works from 7:30 am until 10:00 pm every day. She has very good prices; for example, a pen for $0.25 or a canned good for $1.35, etc. She wants to continue progressing in order to secure her retirement, and so she wants a loan to purchase canned goods, stationery, pens, etc. One of her goals with her business is to expand it, and to continue securing capital for her business.

loans.use: stationery, notebooks, canned items

loans.name: Julieta

texts.en: Julieta B. is from the town of Sto. Niño, Agusan Del Sur. She is 44 years old, married and has a 22-year-old child. Julieta's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Julieta hopes for her business to grow so she can continue to provide for her family. Julieta joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Julieta is requesting a new loan of 16,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to buy fertilizers and other farm inputs.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Crucerito Group

texts.es: ESTE GRUPO SE LLAMA CRUCERITO. ESTA UBICADO EN EL ESTADO DE MEXICO. EL GRUPO ESTA CONFORMADO POR 9 INTEGRANTES Y ES LA 3 VEZ QUE SOLICITA UN CREDITO A CREDICOMUN. JUANA G. A. ES LA TESORERA DEL GRUPO. TIENE 32 AÑOS, ESTUDIO HASTA EL 3 DE SECUNDARIA ES CASADA  TIENE  2 HIJOS  1 MUJER Y 1 VARON. ELLA SE DEDICA AL COMERCIO,VENDE FANTASIA NEGOCIO QUE INICIO HACE 3 AÑOS. SOLICITA EL PRESTAMO PARA DIFERENTES COSAS COMO: COMPRA DE FANTASIA, PAPELERIA Y COLCHAS. TAMBIEN CONFECCIONA VESTIDOS TIPICOS DE LA  REGION SUS CLIENTES SON DE LA MISMA LOCALIDAD Y VECINOS. SUS VESTIDOS LOS VENDE A LAS DIFERENTES ESCUELAS PORQUE ESTOS LOS UTILIZAN CUANDO REALIZAN BAILABLES FOLCLORICOS. AL MOMENTO DE SOLICITAR ESTE PRESTAMO SE SIENTE FELIZ Y COMPROMETIDA PORQUE CUENTA CON UN CAPITAL PARA PODER INVERTIRLO EN SU NEGOCIO Y DE ALLI PODER OBTENER ALGUN INGRESO EXTRA PARA SOLVENTAR LOS GASTOS DE SU FAMILIA PRINCIPALMENTE LA DE SUS HIJOS PORQUE QUIERE LO MEJOR PARA ELLOS, DESEA QUE ESTUDIEN Y TERMINEN UNA CARRERA PARA QUE TENGAN UN FUTURO PROSPERO.EL EXITO DE SU NEGOCIO ES TENER TODO BIEN SURTIDO PARA QUE CUANDO SUS CLIENTES SOLICITEN ALGUNA COSA LO TENGA A TIEMPO Y BUEN PRECIO.
texts.en:
This group is called 'Crucerito' and is located in the State of Mexico.  The group has 9 members and this is the third time that they have requested a loan from Credicomun.

Juana G. A. is the group's treasurer.  She is 32 years old and studied up to the third year of high school.  She is married and has two children: one girl and one boy.

Juana's business is selling imitation jewelry.  She started her business 3 years ago and is requesting this loan for different things such as buying imitation jewelry, stationery and bedspreads. 

Juana also makes traditional, regional dresses.  Her customers are people who live in the same town and her neighbors.  Juana sells her dresses to different schools who use them when they do folk dancing.  As she requests this loan she is feeling happy and committed because she has capital to invest in her business and she can therefore make extra income to cover her family's expenses, particularly those of her children because she wants the best for them.  Juana would like her children to study and continue on to university so that they can have a prosperous future.  The success of Juana's business lies in having everything well stocked so that when her customers ask for something she has it on time and at a good price.

loans.use: To buy merchandise to sell in her business

loans.name: Lolita

texts.en: Lolita's main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Lolita also plants and harvests cassava. She is a 43-year-old married woman from the town of Sto. Niño. She has three children, ages 20, 18 and 6. Lolita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living conditions and enable her to engage in business activities. Lolita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Lolita is requesting a new loan of 15,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to buy additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to support her family financially.

loans.use: To buy additional seeds, fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: Maria Guadalupe

texts.es:
La Señora María Guadalupe, tiene 64 años de edad, viuda, tiene tres hijos, habita en la Comarca Llano de Colon, Estelí.
Cuando su esposo falleció y quedo sola con sus hijos, se decidió a sembrar en las tierras que su esposo le había dejado, hace más de 25 años y poco a poco fue ahorrando para poder sembrar y también se dedico a la Compra Venta de Ganado.
Pero también tuvo una pulpería durante 14 años, pero con el tiempo decidió dedicarse a la Siembra y a la  Crianza y Producción de Aves de Corral.
Espera que este crédito le ayude a mejorar un poco sus ingresos y mejorar poco a poco sus condiciones de vida y su humilde casita.
texts.en: Mrs María Guadalupe, age 64, is a widow with three children. She lives in the Llano de Colon region of Esteli. When her husband passed away and she was left alone with her children, she decided to sow the lands that her husband had left her. It has been over 25 years and bit by bit she has been saving to be able to sow. She also buys and sells livestock. She has also had a convenience store for 14 years, but with time she decided to dedicate herself to farming and to raising barnyard birds. She hopes that this loan will help her to improve her income a little and improve her living conditions and humble home bit by bit.

loans.use: the purchase of inputs for the sowing of cabbage and onion

loans.name: Alicia

texts.es: El señora Alicia dedicada a la venta D. productos variados como Papel higienico, cervilletas, lavavajillas, ambientadores, etc. ya hace bastante tiempo se dedica a la venta D. estos productos, ella trabaja sola y arduamente durante toda la semana en el mercado mas concurrido D. nuestra ciudad, ella venD. los dia D. feria que son los dias miercoles y sabado,  este crédito  será D. gran ayuda para la clienta ya que desea comprar mercaderia comprando cervilletas por mayor y asi incrementar su capital para estas fechas D. fin D. año donD. tiene mucha mas venta, es una persona, muy trabajadora siempre pensando en el bienestar D. su familia, esta agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Mrs Alicia has sold various products like toilet paper, napkins, dishwashing detergent and air fresheners for  quite some time. She works alone and very hard all week in the most busy market of our city. This loan will be a great help to her as it will increase her capital and enable her to buy napkins in larger quantities  for the end of the year when she has many more sales. She is a very hard-working person who is always thinking of her family's well-being. She is grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: the purchase of merchandise

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is a farmer. She owns and tills a piece of land in Sto. Niño, where she grew up. She says her parents taught her farming. Now that she has her own family, she used her skills to start her business. She plants and harvests rice and then sells it on the market. She has been engaged in rice farming for quite a while now. She hopes to make her business stable so she can help support her family.

Lorna is in need of fertilizers and other inputs. She is requesting a loan of PHP 6000 to buy what she needs for her farm. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers like manure.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El Sr.  julio se dedica a trabajar de pintor de viviendas tanto interior como exterior,  se dedica a esta actividad desde hace cinco años tiene muchos clientes que solicitan sus servicios para el pintado de sus casas, solicita el crédito para comprar una caseta para la venta de sándwich dicha caseta será atendida por su esposa y de este modo colaborar con los ingresos en la familia,  vive en domicilio de propiedad de sus suegros quienes apoyan a julio en sentido material y moral, su familia esta compuesta por su esposa su hija y el, son una familia muy unida se apoyan entre ellos, están muy agradecidos con la institución por el apoyo brindado
texts.en: Mr.  Julio works as a house painter, interior and exterior. He has been doing this for five years and has many customers who request his services for the painting of their houses. He is requesting this loan to purchase a hut to sell sandwiches. This hut will be attended by his wife, and this way they will both contribute to the household income. He lives in a home owned by his parents-in-law, who support him materially and morally. His family is made up of his wife, his daughter and himself. They are a very united family who support each other. They are very grateful to the institution for the support offered.

loans.use: the purchase of a hut to sell sandwiches

loans.name: Nicolas

texts.en:
Nicolas C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is 40 years old, and married. To make a living, Nicolas owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nicolas wants to be able to provide all that his family needs.

Nicolas joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nicolas has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nicolas is requesting a new loan of 10,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To buy seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Nora

texts.en:
Nora P. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 44 years old. Nora is married and has five children. Her eldest child is 25 years old, while the youngest is only 8. To make a living, Nora owns and operates a business raising crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Nora also buys and sells bananas.

Nora joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Nora has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Nora is requesting a new loan of 16,000 PHP, which will be used to buy farm supplies and more bananas to resell. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy farm supplies and more bananas to sell.

loans.name: Wilmar Del Carmen

texts.es:
El Señor Wilmar V., tiene 25 años de edad, vive en la Comarca El Coyolito, en Estelí, casado y tiene 4 hijos.
Desde los 10 años ayuda a sus padres en la siembra de Tomate, no quiso seguir estudiando para dedicarse únicamente a trabajar con sus padres.
A los 18 se caso, pero siguió viviendo con sus padres, no posee casa propia; trabaja a medias con sus hermanos, pero su meta es independizarse para que los ingresos solo sean para el.
Este crédito lo solicito para la siembra de cebolla en especial.
Actualmente tiene muchos sueños, entre ellos, comprar su casa, su terreno, ganado, para ser totalmente independiente, y espera que este crédito y otros mas que desea realizar le ayuden a ir realizando uno a uno sus sueños.
texts.en:
Wilmar V. is 25 years old and lives in El Coyolito district, in Estelí.  He is married and has four children.

He has been helping his parents to grow tomatoes since he was 10 years old.  He didn't want to continue studying but instead commited himself to working with his parents.  He got married at 18 but continued living in his parents' home.  He doesn't have his own house.  He works alongside his siblings but his goal is to become independent so that he can make his own income just for himself.

He is requesting this loan for sowing onions.

Currently he has many dreams such as buying his own house, a plot of land and some livestock so that he can be completely independent.  He hopes that this loan and subsequent loans which he would like to take will help him to realize his dreams one by one.

loans.use: For sowing onions

loans.name: Victor

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

El socio es el Sr. Victor; el tiene 32 años de edad y es casado y tiene 3 hijos; El socio alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de videos turísticos, el vende en forma independiente, el socio trabaja desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 6:00 p.m y por medio de este negocio el socio saca adelante a sus hijo, el socio quiere mejorar el negocio de venta de videos turísticos. El  socio solicita el préstamo para comprar videos turísticos al por mayor.

El socio está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Victor belongs to the "BUENA ESPERANZA" (Good Hope) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Victor is 32 years old, married and has 3 children.  He divides his time between his daily activities and his business selling tourist videos.  He sells his products independently.  Victor works from 8.00am to 6.00pm and, through his business, he gets his children ahead in life.  He would like to improve his business selling tourist videos.

Victor is requesting this loan to buy tourist videos wholesale.  He is happy to be receiving the loan and pledges to make his repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy tourist videos wholesale

loans.name: Ofelia

texts.en:
Ofelia C. is 63 years old and married with three children. She is from the town of Sto. Niño. To make a living, Ofelia owns and operates a business raising crops. Her main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. 

Ofelia joined CEVI to gain access to financial services. She is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP to purchase fertilizer such as manure. Ofelia wishes to improve her family’s living conditions and plans to use the revenue generated by the loan to supplement her family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer

loans.name: Perla

texts.en:
Perla is 39 years old and married with a 9-year-old child. She is from the town of Sto. Niño. Perla grows rice and pigs and manages a sari-sari (general) store. Her husband, who is a farmer, does the major farming tasks, while Perla fattens the pigs and runs the store. 

Perla joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Perla has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. She is requesting a loan of 8,000 PHP to buy farm inputs, feed and additional merchandise to sell. Perla hopes to be able to maintain the family’s farm, pigsty and store. She plans to use the additional revenue generated by the loan to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs, feed and store merchandise

loans.name: Roque

texts.en: Roque C. is from the town of Sto. Niño. He is married and has four children, ages 19, 16, 13 and 4. To make a living, Roque owns and operates a business raising livestock. His main source of income comes from fattening pigs for sale. Roque also buys and resells dried fish to his neighbors. He displays the dried fish in his wife's sari-sari store. Roque joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. He has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Roque is requesting a new loan of 18,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase feeds, vitamins and more dried fish to sell. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase feeds, vitamins and more dried fish to sell

loans.name: Rosa Adilia

texts.es:
La Señora Rosa López, tiene 45 años de edad, casada, tiene un hijo solamente y vive en la ciudad de Estelí, pero es originaria de la Comarca El Regadío, pero para mejorar su nivel de vida emigro hace unos 25 años a la ciudad, tiene mas de 10 años de experiencia en el sector comercio, tiene una pequeña pulpería y una tortillería.
 Cuando ella inicio su negocio iba hasta Managua, a comprar verduras y gaseosas para vender, pero poco a poco fue surtiendo mas la pulpería con el tiempo. Su esposo le ayuda a cuidar la pulpería mientras ella atiende por la madrugada la venta de tortillas, y cuando ella termina con las tortillas, se va a la pulpería.
Realizo este crédito para compra de insumos para la tortillería, pues su demanda a crecido mucho, y espera pagar rápido este préstamo para adquirir un nuevo y aumentar su producción de tortillas y su pulpería.
texts.en:
Rosa López is 45 years old, married and has one child.  She lives in the city of Estelí but is originally from El Regadiío district.  In order to improve her standard of living, she emigrated to the city 25 years ago.  She has more than 10 years' experience in sales.  She has a small grocery store and a tortilla bakery.

When Rosa set up her business, she used to travel to Managua to buy vegetables and soda to sell but she gradually stocked her grocery store with more and more products over time.  Her husband helps her to look after the grocery store when she is selling tortillas in the morning and when she finishes with her tortillas she takes over in the store.

Rosa is requesting this loan to buy supplies for her tortilla bakery since demand has risen a lot.  She hopes to be able to pay off her loan quickly so that she can take another to increase her tortilla production and make progress in her grocery store.

loans.use: To make tortillas / grocery store

loans.name: Tessie

texts.en:
Tessie A. is 55 years old and married. She is from the town of Sto. Niño. To make a living, Tessie owns and operates a business raising crops. Her main source of income comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Tessie works hard so that her business can grow. 

Tessie joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Tessie is requesting a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy sacks of fertilizer and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to make improvements to her family’s house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and farm inputs

loans.name: Lola Angelita

texts.es:
La Señora Lola O. es socia del banco comunal 12 de Abril, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su naturaleza, cuenta con su centro histórico el mismo que en diciembre de 1999 fue nombrado como patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente mantiene sus tradiciones y cultura.

Doña Lola se encuentra en el crédito 23 que realiza en el banco comunal, tiene un puesto en el mercado en donde se dedica a la venta de almuerzos, esta labor la realiza hace 28 años, trabaja desde las 9 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde  de lunes a viernes.
 
La Señora. Lola tiene 72 años de edad, es una mujer muy luchadora ya que es madre soltera de 5 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, casados y viven independientes. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.
 
El dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para prepara sus almuerzos. Su sueño es conservar su salud para seguir trabajando.
texts.en:
Lola O. is a member of the community bank "April 12", she lives in the city of Cuenca, this city is known for its natural beauty, it's historic downtown was named Cultural Heritage of Humanity on December of 1999, its people continue to keep its traditions and culture.

Lola is currently on the 23th loan with the community bank, she has a stand in the market where she sells lunches, she has done this for 28 years, starts working at 9 in the morning and finishes at 6 in the afternoon from Monday to Friday.

Lola is 72 years old, she is a hardworking woman, a single mom of five children who are now adults, married and live independently.  She doesn't have a house of her own and lives with a family member.

The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of groceries to prepare the lunches.  Her wish is to stay healthy to keep working.

loans.use: Buy groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To pay back relatives the money she borrowed for her wedding

loans.name: Nancy

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Nancy; ella tiene 32 años de edad y es casada y tiene 3 hijos; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de ropa, ella vende pantalones, polos, casacas, blusas y chompas, ella vende en forma ambulatoria desde las 8:00 a.m hasta las 7:00 p.m, la socia quiere ampliar y mejorar el negocio de venta de ropa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar ropa al por mayor.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Our associate is a member of the “Buena Esperanza” (Good Hope) communal bank, located within the district, province, and department of Cusco.

Nancy is 32 years old, married, and has three children.  She sells clothing, such as pants, polo shirts, jackets, blouses, and sweaters.  She sells on foot from 8:00 AM to 7:00 PM and wants to expand and improve her clothing sales business.  She is requesting this loan so that she can buy clothing in large quantity.

She is happy about this loan and she is committed to making her payments on time.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Vergelita

texts.en:
Vergelita L. is from the town of Sto. Niño. She is 43 years old. Vergelita is married and has two children. To make a living, Vergelita raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Vergelita has been farming for more than 12 years. 

Vergelita joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Vergelita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Vergelita is requesting a new loan of 16,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm inputs

loans.name: María Angelita

texts.es:
La Señora María L. es socia del banco comunal 12 de Abril, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su naturaleza, cuenta con su centro histórico el mismo que en diciembre de 1999 fue nombrado patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente mantiene sus tradiciones y cultura.

Nuestra socia tiene 60 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 2 hijos de 38 y 32 años  que son casados y viven independientes. Con su trabajo ha logrado comprar una casa la misma que se encuentra pagando y esta feliz por ello.

Doña María es negociante de frutas y verduras, esta actividad la realiza hace 15 años y cuenta con su propio puesto en el mercado, trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 6 de la mañana hasta las 6 de la tarde.

Este es su primer crédito y fue invitada por una amiga, su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de más frutas y verduras para su negocio. Su meta es crecer mucho más en su negocio.
texts.en:
Ms María L. is a member of the 12 de Abril (April 12) Communal Bank. She lives in the city of Cuenca, a town renowned for the beauty of its nature. Its historical center was nominated Word Heritage Site in December 1999, and its inhabitants preserve their traditions and culture.

María is 60 years old, she is a single mother of two children aged 38 and 32, who are married and live independently. Thanks to her job she has succeeded in buying a house she is still paying for, and she is happy about it.

Maria is a saleswoman: she has been selling fruits and vegetables for 15 years, and she has her own stand in the market; she works from Sunday to Sunday from 6 in the morning to 6 at night.

This is her first loan; she has been invited by a friend and she will use the loan to buy more fruits and vegetables for her shop. Her goal is for her activity to grow even more.

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: María Maricela

texts.es:
La Señora. María M. es socia del banco comunal 12 de Abril, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su naturaleza, cuenta con su centro histórico el mismo que en diciembre de 1999 fue nombrado  patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente mantiene sus tradiciones y cultura.

La Señora María es madre soltera de 2 hijos de 12 y 8 años de edad, su primera hija   estudia en el colegio y su segunda hija esta en una escuela de la ciudad. No tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de su madre en la que viven arrendando y ayuda en la economía de su hogar.
 
Doña María se dedica a la venta de jugos en un mercado de la ciudad, lleva realizando esta labor hace 14 años, cuenta con un puesto propio en el que trabaja de domingo a domingo desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.

Es socia del banco comunal hace 2 años,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas, de bebidas como maltas para la realización de sus jugos. Su meta es  crecer más en su negocio.
texts.en:
María M. is a member of the '12 de Abril' community bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca which is well known for its natural beauty.  Its historic center was named a World Heritage Site in December 1999.  The people in the city maintain its traditions and culture.

María is a single mother who has 2 children aged 12 and 8.  Her eldest daughter is in middle school and her youngest is in elementary school.  They don't have their own home but live in her mother's house.  They pay her mother rent and help with the household finances.

María's business is selling juice in a market in the city.  She has been in this business for 14 years.  She has her own stall in which she works from Sunday to Sunday, from 8.00am to 5.00pm.

María has been a member of her community bank for 2 years.  She will invest her loan money in buying fruit and malt drinks for making her juices.  Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: To buy fruit and drinks

loans.name: Zoila Nadier

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “BUENA ESPERANZA”; El banco está ubicado en el distrito de Cusco, perteneciente a la provincia de Cusco y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Zoila Nadier; ella tiene 24 años de edad y es conviviente y tiene 1 hijo; La socia alterna sus actividades diarias con el negocio de venta de productos de belleza, ella vende en forma independiente llevando a diferentes instituciones y al público en general, ella quiere tener una tienda para vender los productos de belleza. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar productos de belleza como cremas, lápiz labial, lápiz para ojos y perfumes. 
                                                         
La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Zoila Nadier is a member of the "BUENA ESPERANZA" (Good Hope) community bank which is located in Cusco district, in the province and department of the same name.

Zoila Nadier is 24 years old.  She lives with her partner and has one child.  She divides her time between her daily activities and her business selling beauty products.  She makes her sales independently, selling in different institutions and also to the general public.  She would like to have a store where she could sell her beauty products.

Zoila Nadier is requesting this loan to buy beauty products such as creams, lipsticks, eye liners and perfume.  She is happy to be receiving a loan and pledges to make her repayments on time.

loans.use: To buy beauty products such as creams, lipsticks, eye liners, and perfume

loans.name: Teresa De Jesús

texts.es:
La Señora. Teresa M. es socia del banco comunal 12 de Abril, vive en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es reconocida por la belleza de su naturaleza, cuenta con su centro histórico el mismo que en diciembre de 1999 fue nombrado patrimonio cultural de la humanidad, su gente mantiene sus tradiciones y cultura.

La Señora Teresa tiene 47 años, está separada hace 4 años y tiene 5 hijos de 28, 27, 25, 23, 20 años de edad, todos sus hijos son solteros, cuatro de ellos trabajan y ayudan en la economía del hogar solo su segunda hija vive independiente. No tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.
 
Doña Teresa se dedica a la venta de frutas, esta labor la realiza hace 14 años, cuenta con un puesto propio en un mercado de la ciudad en donde labora desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde  de domingo a domingo.
 
Se encuentra dos años en el banco comunal y le gusta ya que tiene muy buenas amigas,  el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de frutas. Su meta es  crecer mas en su negocio.
texts.en:
Teresa M. is a member of the “12 de Abril” (12th of April) communal bank.  She lives in the city of Cuenca, which is known for its beautiful natural surroundings.  It has an historical center, which was named to be the “Cultural Heritage of Humanity” in December of 1999.  Its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Teresa is 47 years old, has been separated for four years, and has five children, ages 28, 27, 25, 23, and 20.  All of her children are single.  Four of them work and help with the household finances.  Only her second oldest daughter lives on her own.  They live in a rented home.

Teresa has been selling fruit for 14 years.  She has her own stall in one of the city markets, where she works from 8:00 AM to 5:00 PM, seven days a week.

She’s been a member of the communal bank for two years and she enjoys it because she has good friends there.  She will use the money from this loan to invest in more fruit.  Her goal is to grow her business.

loans.use: Inventory

loans.name: Antonio

texts.en:
Antonio B.'s main source of income comes from planting and harvesting corn for sale. He is 46 years old, married and has four school-aged children. They are from the town of Surallah. Antonio wants to provide all that his family needs. He wants his family to be happy and healthy.

Antonio joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living conditions and enable him to engage in business activities. Antonio has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. He is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippine pesos (PHP) which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers. He plans to use additional income to improve his business.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Khalil

texts.en:
Khalil is an applied chemistry student at Hebron University. Khalil is 19 years old and he works to cover his school expenses.

He is working hard to achieve a degree in applied chemistry. He took a loan from FATEN to pay for tuition fees, as he couldn't make enough money in time to pay for his school.

Khalil appears in the picture here.

loans.use: To pay for school tuition fees

loans.name: Deolita

texts.en:
Deolita V. is from the town of Surallah. She is 40 years-old and unmarried.  To make a living, Deolita owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising livestock. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes from raising pigs for fattening and sale. Deolita also raises some chickens. 

Deolita joined Kiva partner CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Deolita has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Deolita is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase feed and medicine. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business.

loans.use: To purchase feed and medicine.

loans.name: Elnar

texts.en:
Elnar L. is from the town of Surallah. He is 36 years-old. Elnar is married and has an 11-month-old baby. To make a living, Elnar owns and operates a business in the agriculture sector raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elnar's wife also helps in providing their daily needs by managing their sari-sari store. 

Elnar joined Kiva partner CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elnar has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elnar is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies. He plans to use the additional revenue generated to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Nelly Leonor

texts.es:
La Señora. Nelly D. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Juventud y vive en la parroquia de Tarqui, esta parroquia es conocida por sus llanuras en donde la mayor parte de su población se dedica a la ganadería, mucha de su población ha migrado en busca de estabilidad económica para su familia.

Nuestra socia es comerciante de ropa, actividad que la realiza hace 4 años, labora de domingo a domingo y cuenta con un puesto propio en un mercado de la ciudad, trabaja desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 5 de la tarde.

Doña Nelly tiene 23 años, está separada y tiene un hijo de un año de edad, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de sus padres y ayuda en la economía de la casa, su papá es chofer y su mamá comerciante,sus padres  tienen casa propia.

Se encuentran en su tercer crédito que realiza en el banco comunal y lo va a invertir en la compra de más ropa para surtir su negocio. Su meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Nelly D. is a member of the 'Nueva Juventud' (New Youth) community bank and lives in Tarqui district.  This district is known for its plains where most of the residents are livestock farmers.  Much of the population has migrated in search of financial stability for their families. 

Nelly's business is selling clothes.  She has been in this business for 4 years.  She works from Sunday to Sunday and has her own stall in a market in the city.  She works from 7.00am to 5.00pm.

Nelly is 23 years old.  She is separated and has a one year-old son.  She doesn't have her own home but lives in her parents' house and helps with the household finances.  Her dad is a driver and her mom is a saleswoman.  Her parents own their own home.

This is Nelly's third loan with her community bank and she will invest her loan in buying more clothes to stock her business.  Her goal is to own her own home.

loans.use: To buy clothes

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa C. is from the town of Surallah. She is 48 years old. Elsa is married. To make a living, Elsa raises crops. The main source of income for the business comes from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Elsa also has some pigs she grows in her backyard. She fattens the pigs and sells them to the market.

Elsa joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Elsa has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Elsa is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase farm inputs and pig feeds.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and pig feeds

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma J. is from the town of Surallah. She is 46 years old. Gemma is single. To make a living, Gemma raises chickens to produce and sell eggs. Gemma also owns and manages a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells coffee and other kinds of products.

Gemma joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gemma has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. 

Gemma is requesting a new loan of 8,000 Philippines pesos, which will be used to purchase feeds and vitamins. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement her family's income.

loans.use: To purchase feeds and vitamins

loans.name: Jenedina

texts.en:
Jenedina P. is from the town of Surallah. She is married and has two children aged seven and nine. To make a living, Jenedina owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn to sell. Jenedina also raises pigs for breeding. 

Jenedina joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jenedina has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jenedina is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers like manure. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.es:
El Señor Reynaldo R., tiene 74 años de edad, vive en el Barrio El Calvario, en Estelí, actualmente esta soltero y tiene 2 hijos.
Inicio muy jovencito a trabajar, el recuerda que trabaja desde los 11 años de edad como Peón de una Finca, pero luego se quiso independizar y puso una sastrería, luego un pequeño restaurante con pista de baile, en Jalapa, pero por su edad ya no pudo seguir con ese tipo de trabajo y decidió poner alquiler de Sillas para todo tipo de Eventos y Venta de Ropa Americana.  Es decir que tiene más de 60 años de trabajar y una basta experiencia en el sector servicio y comercio.
Tiene a su cargo un nieto de 11 años, a quien el dice estar ensenándole poco a poco todo lo que el sabe.
Realizo este Crédito para comprar mas mesas y sillas para su negocio, pues la demanda ha incrementado  y algunas con el tiempo se han dañado y necesita cambiarlas.
texts.en:
Reynaldo R. is 74 years old and lives in the Barrio El Calvario neighborhood of Estelí. He is currently single and has two children. He started working at a very young age. He remembers that he began working as a farmhand when he was 11 years old. Later on, he wanted to become more independent so he opened up a tailor's shop, then a small restaurant with a dance floor in Jalapa. However, because of his age he couldn't continue this kind of work and decided to open up a business renting chairs for all kinds of events and to start selling American clothing. All this to say that he has worked for over 60 years and has a lot of experience in the service and commercial sectors.

He takes care of an 11-year-old grandchild, whom he says he is teaching everything he knows, bit by bit. He requested this loan in order to buy more tables and chairs for his business. The demand for his rentals has increased. Also, a few tables and chairs have gotten damaged over time so he needs to exchange them for new ones.

loans.use: Purchase of goods/ Business renting chairs for events

loans.name: Bertha Esperanza

texts.es:
