La Señora Bertha L. es socia del banco comunal Nueva Juventud, vive por el sector del Cristo del Consuelo en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se caracteriza por mantener su cultura y tradiciones, su centro histórico es muy hermoso, su gente es cordial y amable.
 
Doña Bertha tiene 28 años, es casada y tiene 3 hijos de 5, 4 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeras hijas estudian. Su esposo es de profesión gasfitero, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando.

La Señora Bertha tiene un taller propio de costura, actividad que la realiza hace 6 años, para tener su taller estudió y  tiene el titulo de maestra de confecciones industriales. Confecciona ropa de niño, camisetas, etc., no tiene un horario fijo de trabajo y labora de lunes a sábado.

Se encuentra en su segundo crédito que realiza en el banco comunal, el dinero de su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de materia prima para su negocio como  tela, hilo etc. Su meta es tener un taller más grande.
texts.en:
Bertha L. is a member of the community bank, Nueva Juventud (New Youth). She lives in the Cristo del Consuelo area of the city of Cuenca. This city is known for having preserved its culture and traditions. Its historic downtown is very beautiful and the people of Cuenca are friendly and kind.

Bertha is a 28-year-old married woman. She has three children who are five, four and two years old. Her elder two daughters are in school. Her husband works as a plumber. They don't own a house which is why they are renting their home.
 
Bertha has her own sewing shop and has worked in this field for six years. She studied in order to have her own shop and she is a certified teacher of industrial garment production. She makes children's clothing and shirts etc. She works long hours and works from Monday through Saturday.

This is the second loan she will have received through the community bank. She plans to use the funds to purchase raw materials for her business such as fabric and thread etc. Her goal is to have a bigger shop one day.

loans.use: Purchase of fabric, thread, buttons, closures etc.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.en:
Jorge T. is from the town of Surallah. He is 31 years old. Jorge is married and has two children aged two and four. To make a living, Jorge owns and operates a business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting rice for sale. Jorge wants to be a progressive farmer. He hopes to have a stable income to sustain his family. 

Jorge joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Jorge has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Jorge is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and fertilizers

loans.name: Kris

texts.en:
Kris A. is from the town of Surallah. He is 22 years old and married. To make a living, Kris operates a family member's business venture in the agriculture sector, raising crops. While not the only means for generating revenue, the main source of income for the business comes primarily from planting and harvesting corn for sale. Kris also raises pigs for fattening. He sells the pigs at the market.

Kris joined CEVI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Kris has successfully repaid a previous loan from CEVI. Kris is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase farm inputs and feeds.

loans.use: To purchase farm inputs and feeds

loans.name: Teresita Elizabeth

texts.es: La Srita. Teresita Elizabeth Rodríguez, es una persona joven que vive en casa de sus padres, y ella hace mas de un año que inicio el negocio de la venta de ropa seminueva, y al paso del tiempo a hecho muchos clientes, por este motivo, ella nos ha solicitado un crédito, porque desea que su negocio crezca y comprar mas mercancía para tener que ofrecer una mayor variedad de mercancía  a sus clientes, ella piensa que al tener mas mercancía la gente la va a recomendar, y así  poco a poco  el negocio ira prosperando y además porque ella apoya económicamente a sus padres, ya que viven en la misma casa, aunque cuenta con el apoyo de su papa, pero como hija mayor ella siente que al aportar un apoyo a la casa, su padre no se vera tan presionado con los gastos.
texts.en:
Teresita Elizabeth Rodríguez is a young woman who lives in her parents' home.  She started her business selling lightly-used clothes over a year ago and, during this time, she has gained a lot of customers.  She is requesting a loan because she would like her business to grow and she would like to buy more merchandise so that she has a wider variety to offer her customers.  

Teresita believes that if she has more merchandise, people will recommend her business and this will mean that her business will gradually become more successful.  Teresita supports her parents financially since they live in the same house.  She has her father's support but as the eldest daughter, she feels that if she helps support the family her father will not be so pressured with their expenses.

loans.use: To buy merchandise

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Sharito Group

texts.es:
Este grupo lleva por nombre "Sharito", esta localizado en la comunidad de xalpatlahuac perteneciente al municipio de Tecoanapa Guerrero, las personas que lo conforman decidieron ponerle este nombre por que así es como se llama uno de los hijos de la señora que formó el grupo y que además es la presidenta, la historia es acerca de la señora Celina C. X., ya que es la presidenta, tiene 36 años de edad, es madre soltera y tiene 4 hijos Luis ángel de 10 años, Eleazar de 8, Sharito de 5 y Alberto de 2 años de edad, de los cuales solo tres estudian dos primaria y la niña esta cursando el segundo año de preescolar, ya que el menor todavía es muy pequeño. 
La señora Celina tiene una tienda de abarrotes con la cual lleva mas de 7 años. Ella dice que decidió iniciar con este negocio, por que quería buscar la forma de sacar a sus hijos adelante y darles una mejor calidad de vida y una buena educación, aparte de que esta actividad le permite estar al pendiente de ellos y no descuidarlos, el crédito que pidió lo va usar para invertirlo en la compra de mas mercancía de abarrotes como son: leche, aceite, refrescos, huevos, pastas, arroz, azúcar, sal, agua, papel higiénico y jabón, ya que es lo que mas vende.
Con las ganancias obtenidas de su negocio se esta beneficiando bastante por que esta sacando a sus hijos adelante, y mejorando mucho mas su calidad de vida, aparte de que ahora puede apoyarlos al cien por ciento con sus estudios, para que tengan un mejor futuro.
Comenta que con su negocio también esta beneficiando mucho a las personas de su comunidad, ya que como es la única que tiene una tienda de abarrotes, todos compran ahí y así no tiene que ir hasta el otro pueblo a comprar y así se ahorran tiempo y dinero. 
La meta que se ha puesto doña Celina es darles una educación a sus hijos, para que asi puedan estudiar una carrera y obtener una muy buena profesión y puedan tener un mejor futuro, también quiere hacer crecer mucho más su negocio, ya que esta pensando en ampliar un poco mas su local para tener mucho mas surtido y mas variedad de productos, para mejorar e incrementar sus ganancias.
Ella dice que todos sus compañeros del grupo, son personas responsables, que cumplen con sus obligaciones y les gusta mucho trabajar, para superarse y sobresalir ante cualquier dificultad.
Doña Celina le da las gracias a nombre de ella y de su familia a FRAC y a kiva  por que gracias a ellos pudo cambiar su vida y la de sus hijos, puesto que ahora tendrán una mejor educación y calidad de vida.
Los integrantes "sharito" y las actividades a las que se dedican cada uno de ellos, son las siguientes:
Embertina B. G.-venta de pollos
Velia B. A.-venta de ropa
Celina C. X.-tienda de abarrotes
Natividad H. H.-venta de dulces
Vianey R. B.-venta de pan
Epifania R. A.-frutería
Irma Z. C.-bordadora
Cirila C. G.-venta de choco miles
Leonarda G. Z.-venta de masa
Lucina S. G.-venta de aguas frescas
texts.en:
This group is called 'Sharito' and is located in the community of Xalpatlahuac, in the town of Tecoanapa Guerrero.  The members of the group decided to give it this name because it is the name of one of the children of the lady who formed the group.  This lady is also the group's president. 

This story is about Celina C. X. since she is the group's president.  She is 36 years old and a single mother.  She has four children: 10 year-old Luis Ángel, 8 year-old Eleazar, 5 year-old Sharito and 2 year-old Alberto.  Three of her children are in school.  Two are in elementary school and her daughter is in the second year of pre-school.  Her youngest is still too young for school.

Celina owns a grocery store which she has had for more than 7 years.  She says that she decided to set up her business because she wanted a way of getting her children ahead in life and providing them with a better quality of life and a good education.  Her business also allows her to look out for her children and not neglect them.  She will use her loan money to invest in buying more groceries for her store such as: milk, oil, soft drinks, eggs, pasta, rice, sugar, salt, water, toilet paper and soap since these are the products that sell the most.  She uses the profits from her business to get her children ahead in life and improve their quality of life.  She can also now support them 100% with their studies so that they can have a better future.

She comments that her business is also benefiting the people in her community since she is the only person to have a grocery store and everybody shops there as it means that they don't have to go to another town to do their shopping which saves them time and money.  Celina's goal is to provide her children with an education so that they can study at university and get into good professions so that they can have a better future.  She also wants to grow her business a lot more.  She is thinking of expanding her premises a bit more so that she can have more stock and a greater variety of products to improve and increase her profits.

Celina says that all her fellow group members are responsible people who fulfil their obligations and they all really like to work to improve themselves and overcome any difficulties.  Celina thanks FRAC and Kiva on behalf of herself and her family because thanks to them she has been able to change her life and her children's lives since they will now have a better education and quality of life.  The members of 'Sharito' and the business activities that they carry out are as follows:


Embertina B. G. - chicken sales
Velia B. A. - clothes sales
Celina C. X. - grocery store
Natividad H. H. - sweet sales
Vianey R. B. - bread sales
Epifania R. A. - fruit store
Irma Z. C. - embroidery
Cirila C. G. - chocolate milk sales
Leonarda G. Z. - dough sales
Lucina S. G. - 'aguas frescas' sales ('aguas frescas' are drinks made from fruit, cereals or seeds mixed with sugar and water)

loans.use: To invest in buying more groceries such as: milk, oil, soft drinks, eggs, pasta, rice, sugar, salt, water, toilet paper and soap

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To improve the cafe and replace old tables and chairs

loans.name: Los Saucitos Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama "los saucitos", decidieron ponerle este nombre por que así se llama la localidad donD. viven y todos son originarios D. esta población, la  historia es acerca D. la señora Elideth R. P., ya que es la representante D. dicho grupo, cuenta con 27 años D. edad y es soltera, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta D. pan, lleva mas D. 15 años realizando esta actividad.

Ella eligió esta negocio, ya que quería buscar la manera D. apoyar a sus padres, con los gastos económicos y tener una mejor solvencia económica, para así mejor su calidad D. vida, aparte D. que es una muy buena fuente D. ingresos, ya que también es el negocio D. su familia, es por eso que decidió empezar con este negocio, con el préstamo que recibió va a continuar invirtiendo en su panadería, en la compra D. mas materia prima como son: sal, azúcar, harina, huevos, manteca y levadura, para así tener una mejor producción y variedad D. pan en su negocio.

Su negocio le esta sirviendo D. mucho, ya que D. las ganancias obtenidas, esta sacando para continuar apoyando a sus padres con sus gastos personales e ir mejorando cada vez mas su calidad D. vida, además D. que esta ahorrando para comprarse una lavadora, ya que no cuenta con una y le hace mucha falta . 

Doña Eli dice que su meta es la D. hacer que su negocio crezca empresarialmente, ya que quiere construir un local más granD., ya que quiere poner una panadería y así D. esta forma tenerla muy bien surtida y así obtener más y mejores ganancias.  

Ella dice que conoce muy bien a sus compañeros y nos comenta que son personas muy responsables, gente trabajadora, confiable que tienen ganas D. salir adelante y superarse y por lo mismo en ninguna ocasión se han atrasado o fallado con los pagos D. su crédito, ya que quieren seguir contando con el apoyo D. mas prestamos.

Da las gracias a los prestatarios D. kiva, por darle la oportunidad y confianza, pero sobre todo por creer en ella, puesto que gracias a su ayuda pudo invertir en su negocio y asi tener una mejor calidad D. vida junto con su familia y un mejor futuro.

Los integrantes del grupo D. los saucitos y las actividades que realizan son:
Florencia R. G.- venta D. refacciones 
Lucia J. R.-venta D. plásticos
Hilaria A. E.-venta D. pollos
Isabel P. R.-venta D. pan
Ludivina S. L.-frutería
Adela D. J. L.-venta D. ropa
Leonardo C. D. J.-venta D. nieve
Albertina E. N.-venta D. antojitos
Arelia G. B.-venta D. pollos
Maria erid G. M.-venta D. refrescos
Elideth R. P.-venta D. pan
texts.en:
This group is called 'Los Saucitos'.  The members decided to give the group this name because it is the name of their town and they were all born in the town.

This story is about Elideth R. P. since she is the group's representative.  She is 27 years old and single.  Her business is making and selling bread and she has been in this business for more than 15 years.  She chose this business because she wanted to find the best way of supporting her parents with their financial expenses and to proviD. them with better financial solvency so that they could improve their quality of life.  It is also a very good source of income since it is her family's business.  This is why she decided to set up in this business.

Elideth will use this loan to continue investing in her bakery, buying more ingredients such as salt, sugar, flour, eggs, butter and yeast so that she can produce more bread and a better variety of bread in her business.  Her business is very helpful as she is using the profits she makes to continue supporting her parents with their personal expenses so that they can continue improving their quality of life.  She is also saving to buy a washing machine since she doesn't have one but really needs one.

Eli says that her goal is to grow her business.  She would like to build bigger premises as she would like to set up a well-stocked bakery so that she can make more profits and better profits.  She says that she knows her fellow group members very well and she tells us that they are responsible, hard-working and trustworthy people who have a great desire to get ahead in life and improve themselves.  They have never fallen behind in or failed to meet their loan repayments since they would like to continue receiving support with further loans.

Eli thanks Kiva lenders for giving her this opportunity and placing their trust in her but, above all, for believing in her since thanks to your help she is able to invest in her business and enjoy a better quality of life together with her family and a better future.

The members of the 'Los Saucitos' group and the business activities that they carry out are as follows:

Florencia R. G. - spare parts sales
Lucia J. R. - plastic sales
Hilaria A. E. - chicken sales
Isabel P. R. - bread sales
Ludivina S. L. - fruit shop
Adela D. J. L. - clothes sales
Leonardo C. D. J. - flavored iced water sales
Albertina E. N. - appetizer sales
Arelia G. B. - chicken sales
Maria erid G. M. - soft drink sales
Elideth R. P. - bread sales

loans.use: To buy more ingredients such as: salt, sugar, flour, eggs, butter and yeast

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en: Rabia is a 37-year-old married woman living in Baalbeck with her husband and four children. Rabia has been the owner of a baby clothes shop since 2003. This shop was a challenge for her because, like many men in this region, her husband was refusing the idea of letting his wife start a business of her own. Rabia is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to increase her baby collection for the holiday season. Rabia is proud of what she has achieved and willing to expand her business and prove herself even more to her husband and relatives.

loans.use: To increase her capital

loans.name: Elena

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Judas Tadeo.

La señora Elena, lleva 14 ciclos en el  Banco comunal y le gusta por los beneficios adicionales que brinda la institución y porque los intereses son muy bajos. Tiene 31 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos  hijos de 15 y 11 años, los cuales estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Tiene un negocio de comida rápida en el cual prepara tortillas de maíz, yuca, bolones, corviches, café, chocolate,  además también vende gaseosas y aguas. Trabaja de lunes a sábado, en la elaboración de alimentos los mismos que su esposo lleva a distribuir en la cooperativa de transportes Coactur.

Este crédito lo va a utilizar en comprar productos e ingredientes necesarios para la elaboración de los alimentos. Sus sueños son tener un gran restaurante.
texts.en: In the outskirts of Portoviejo, a beautiful city of green mountains and enchanted landscapes, we find the place where the members of the San Judas Tadeo communal bank gather every 15 days. Ms. Elena has been with the communal bank for 14 cycles and she enjoys the low interest rates and the additional benefits offered by the institution. She is 31 years old, married, and has two children who are 15 and 11 years old and attend high school and primary school, respectively. Her husband is a businessman. She has a fast food business for which she prepares corn tortillas, cassava, bolones [smashed banana balls stuffed with cheese or pork rinds], corviches [deep-fried stuffed pastries made with bananas, fish and onion], coffee and hot chocolate. She also sells soft drinks and fresh juices. She works preparing these dishes from Monday to Saturday, and her husband then brings them to sell on buses of the Coactur transportation system. Ms. Elena will use this loan to buy necessary products and ingredients for preparing her dishes. Her dream is to have a large restaurant.

loans.use: to buy products and ingredients for preparing dishes

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy tints, scissors, combs, conditioners, and other beauty products for her salon

loans.name: Pedro Agustin

texts.es:
El Señor Pedro tiene 36 años de edad, vive en el Barrio El Calvario, en Estelí, con más de 20 años de experiencia en el sector agrícola.
Desde pequeño comenzó ayudándole a sus padres en la siembra, específicamente de Frijoles y Cebolla. Se independizo a la edad de 15 años y por falta de dinero no pudo seguir estudiando.
Las primeras veces que sembró, tuvo que hacerlo en sociedad, ya que el no podía cubrir todos los gastos para sembrar de manera independiente cebolla y frijoles. También se dedicaba a la compra venta de hortalizas y verduras.
Realizo este crédito para compra de insumos para la siembra de Cebolla, y espera que esto pueda mejorar un poco sus ingresos.
Sus metas son muchas pero las más importantes son enseñarles a sus hijos como trabajar la tierra que posee para que ellos puedan mejorar su nivel de vida.
texts.en:
Mr. Pedro is 36 years old and lives in the neighborhood of El Calvario ["The Calvary"] in the department of Estelí.  He has more than 20 years of experience in agriculture.

At a very young age, he started helping his parents with planting beans and onions.  He became independent at the age of 15 and for lack of money, he was not able to continue attending school.

The first few times he planted, he had to do so in partnership with others because he couldn't cover all the costs of planting onions and beans on his own.  He also buys and sells vegetables and greens. 

Pedro is taking out this loan to buy supplies for planting onions.  With it, he hopes to be able to improve his earnings a bit.  He has many goals but most importantly, he wants to teach his children how to work the land he owns so that they can improve their living standards.

loans.use: to buy supplies for planting onions

loans.name: Zeina

texts.en:
Zeina is a 40-year-old, married woman from Baalbeck, the mother of four children and owner of a grocery store since 2007.

Zeina is requesting a loan for the ninth time from Al Majmoua, in order to increase her capital and to expand her business. Zeina is a loyal client in Al Majmoua, she’s an upstanding person and pays always on time. She works hard on expanding her business and on providing the best to her family. She helps her husband in their family’s income and outcome, and she hopes to achieve more in the future. Her clients believe in her ambitions and know that when she insists on doing something she will definitely do it and succeed in it.

loans.use: To increase her capital.

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es:
Noemí  vive en Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, es casada con el señor Arisain Trejo Estrada  del cual tiene  dos niños a su responsabilidad y son: Daniel de ocho  años, Hilton de cuatro años.
El préstamo solicitado lo invertirá en la compra  de ingredientes para elaborar panes como son: harina, aceite, huevo, leche, queso entre otros y para tamales son: maza, aceite, carne, chile ancho entre otros más, y con ellos apoyar se para elaborarlos.
Ella se dedica a esta actividad ya que su familia es lo más importante para ella, y para salir  adelante necesitaba comenzar a trabajar pero sin descuidar a sus hijos, por ésta razón ella empezó a elaborar tamales y panes y a venderlos con sus vecinos.
De lo que ella va obtenidiendo de ganancias en su negocio compra más ingredientes para seguir con su negocio además de guardar dinero por alguna necesidad que pueda presentarse, como una enfermedad, un gasto adicional en la escuela, etc.
Noemi nos dice: "Gracias a Fundación Realidad y a KIVA por poner su confianza en personas como yo y que nos apoyan en nuestros negocios".
texts.en:
Noemí lives in Coapilla, in the State of Chiapas, in Mexico.  She is married to Arisain Trejo Estrada and they have two children in their care: 8 year-old Daniel and 4 year-old Hilton.

Noemí will invest her loan in buying ingredients for making bread such as: flour, oil, eggs, milk, cheese, etc. and ingredients for making tamales such as: corn, oil, meat, poblano chili peppers, etc.  This will help her in making her products.

Noemí is in this business because her family is the most important thing for her and to get them ahead in life she needed to start working but without neglecting her children.  For this reason, she started making tamales and bread and selling them to her neighbors.

Noemí uses the profits from her business to buy more ingredients so that she can continue in her business and also saves some money for any need that might arise such as an illness, an additional school expense, etc.

Noemí says "Thank you Fundación Realidad and KIVA for putting your trust in people like myself and for supporting us in our businesses".

loans.use: To buy ingredients for making tamales and bread such as corn, oil and meat

loans.name: Angela Trinidad

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Judas Tadeo.

En este lugar encontramos a la  señora Angela. Tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos  hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, además esta criando un niño de tres años el cual lo cogió a su cargo cuando la mama  murió y es como su hijo. Los tres viven en su casa. Su esposo es chofer de taxi. Lleva 3 años  en el  Banco comunal y le gusta porque los intereses son muy bajos.

Se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo, su forma de  ventas es puerta a puerta además también vende en su  casa, nos cuenta que  le realizan pedidos sus clientes. Trabaja todos los días en las mañanas  y los fines de semana todo el día, deja a crédito a sus clientes  y cobra cada quince días. Su mercadería la compra en  Guayaquil, Portoviejo y otra parte la compra en Quito, este negocio lo empezó con el primer crédito que recibió de la institución.

Este crédito es para comprar la  ropa como. Pantalones, camisas, blusas, etc. Sus sueños son tener su propio almacén de ropa.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of Portoviejo, a beautiful city of verdant mountains and enchanting landscapes, we find the place where the members of the San Judas Tadeo Communal Bank meet every 15 days.

This is where we find Ms. Angela.  She is 50 years old, married, and has two grown children from her marriage.  She is also raising a three year-old boy whom she took into her care when his mother died, and he is like her own child.  The three of them live together in her house.  She has been a member of the communal bank for three years and likes it because the interest rates are very low.

Angela sells all types of clothing.  She sells from door-to-door as well as from her house, taking orders from her customers.  She works every morning and all day on weekends.  She offers products to her customers on credit and then collects payments every 15 days.  She buys some of her merchandise in Guayaquil and Portoviejo and the rest in Quito.  She started this business with the first loan she received through Fundación ESPOIR.

She is taking out this loan to buy clothing like pants, shirts, blouses, etc.  Her dream is to have her own clothing store.

loans.use: to buy pants, shirts, blouses, etc.

loans.name: Maria Delia

texts.es:
La señora María Delia A. Álvarez, vive en Coapilla Estado de Chiapas México, vive en  unión libre con el señor Isidro Velázquez Velázquez, en  donde procrearon una hija de nombre María de los Ángeles de cuatro años de edad y es su motivo de salir adelante.
     
         Ella ha estado trabajando en la venta de pollos aliñado y en pie en donde lleva dos años y cuatro  meses practicando esta actividad, y comenta que le ha ido bien ya que le ha dejado buenos ingresos en su hogar.

         Se animo a realizar esta actividad ya que una de su vecina la animo y solicito el préstamo para apoyarse comprando  los pollos por reja para que su clientela le compre agusto su mercancía que consumen varia veces a la semana.

       De la  ganancia que obtiene lo invierte en lo mismo  pues le da poco cuando menos para cubrir sus gasto pequeños que se generan en su familia, pero aun así sigue trabajando y ver un mejor resultado.

       El sueño más grande que quiere realizar es que pueda guardar un dinero y así construir una casa de donde vivan cómodamente con su pequeña familia.
texts.en:
María Delia A. Álvarez lives in Coapilla in the state of Chiapas in Mexico.  She is in a common-law marriage with Isidro Velázquez Velázquez.  They have one daughter, four year old María de los Ángeles.  Her daughter is her motivation to get ahead.

She has been working selling dressed chickens and chickens by the piece.  She has been doing this business activity for two years and four months.  She says that it has gone well for her because it has given her good income for her household.

She started this business activity because her neighbor encouraged her.  She is requesting the loan to help her buy chickens by the crate so that her customers can easily buy her merchandise, which they eat several times a week.  

She puts the earnings that she gets back into the business.  That gives her little when the small amount of expenses the family generates is subtracted.  However, she continues working and seeing a better result.

Her biggest dream is that she is able to save money to build a house where her little family can live comfortably.

loans.use: To buy chickens by the crate in order to sell them

loans.name: Minerva

texts.es:
Minerva Rodríguez, es casada con el señor Enrique Velazco Balcázar, tiene un hijo de nombre José Antonio de catorce años que van en segundo grado en la telesecundaria.

        Ella se dedica a la crianza de pollos de rancho  en donde lleva mucho tiempo practicando  esta actividad  y con ello a estado obteniendo buenos resultados  en su  negocio y familia, aun así cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo que también trabaja para que los dos aporten.

        Se animo a esta actividad ya que es un negocio bueno del cual se invierte pero también se obtiene  buen resultado ya que la gente le compra al precio que sea  y pues también  depende el tamaño del pollo.
 
        De lo que vende lo ahorra para que así le compre alimento a los que le queda y sigan criando, así es como ella ha estado trabajando durante todo este tiempo.
 
         Lo que más desea es que con sus ahorros  y su esfuerzo logre tener una casa de losa y bonita, como también darle lo mejor a  su hijo que está estudiando y sea un profesionista.
         Ella quiere darle las gracias a FRAC y a KIVA por brindarle este apoyo económico
texts.en:
Minerva Rodríguez is married to Enrique Velazco Balcázar.  They have a 14 year old son, José Antonio.  He is in his second year of distance learning.

Minerva raises chickens on a farm.  She has been doing this for a long time.  She has gotten good results in her business and her family.  She still has her husband’s help.  He also works so that they both contribute.  This activity keeps her spirits high because it is a good business, which she invests in.  She gets good results because people buy at whatever price.  The price depends upon the size of the chicken.

She saves what she gets from her sales.  That way she buys feed for the chickens that are left, and she continues raising them.  That is how she has been working this entire time.

What she wishes for the most is to use her savings and her efforts to manage to have a pretty house made of stone.  She also wants to give her son, who is studying, the best so that he will become a professional. 

She wants to thank FRAC and KIVA for providing this financial support.

loans.use: To buy chickens to fatten and then sell when they are bigger

loans.name: Jawaher

texts.en:
Jawaher is a 47-year-old widow living in Nabatieh with her single child. Jawaher has worked as a tailor since 2006 and has 30 years of sewing experience. Jawaher is working hard for her living since her husband died; she believes that she has to work hard for her small family after the loss of her husband. She had to prove to relatives and friends that she’s strong enough to take care of her family. 

Jawaher is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy textiles she likes with a good wholesale price. The price is so very special that she can’t resist buying them. Jawaher is planning to expand her business more and more since she received her friends' and relatives' blessings and support.

loans.use: To buy special-price textiles

loans.name: Nueva Esperanza Group

texts.es: Gladis tiene 57 años de edad, es socia de la Alcancía Comunal “Nueva Esperanza” es casada y tiene 4 hijos quienes son mayores de edad, pero se hace cargo de un nieto suyo como si fuera su hijo  el cual tiene 12 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de desayuno como ambulante además de eso prepara dulces para las distintas fechas de fiestas como: chocolates, mazamorra, gelatina y turrones, con los ingresos de su pequeño negocio ayuda a cubrir los gastos de su casa y los estudios de su menor hijo. Ella solicitó el préstamo a EDAPROSPO para comprar  un exprimidor  y un pelador de naranjas para poder vender jugo de naranjas durante el verano. En la foto podemos apreciar que las socias están contentas en compañía de sus hijos.
texts.en: Gladis is 57 years old and a member of the “Nueva Esperanza” ["New Hope"] communal bank. She is married and has four grown children. She is also in charge of a 12 year-old grandson who is like her own son. Gladis sells breakfasts in an ambulatory manner, and she also prepares sweets for the various holidays. She prepares sweets like chocolates, mazamorra [corn pudding], gelatin, and nougat. With the income from her small business, she helps cover her family's household expenses and helps send her youngest son to school. She is requesting this loan through EDAPROSPO in order to buy a juicer and an orange peeler so that she can sell orange juice during the summer. In the photo above, we can see how happy the members of this group are in the company of their children.

loans.use: to buy a juicer and an orange peeler

loans.name: Alba Esmeralda

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Judas Tadeo.

La señora Alba es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta todo, las charlas, las reuniones, etc. Tiene 65 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene 6 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, dos viven con ella, Su esposo era chofer pero ya no trabaja porque esta enfermo.

Es una ama de casa que para obtener sus propios recursos se dedica a la venta de ropa de dormir, sabanas. Además de productos de Yanbal (productos de belleza, cosméticos, perfumería y accesorios para damas). Trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 14h00, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada semana o cada quince de acuerdo a lo que quieran sus clientes. Lo que es ropa y sabanas los compra en Santo Domingo.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa de dormir y sabanas ya que tiene algunos pedidos. Su sueño es tener su almacén para vender sus productos sin tener que salir a la calle.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of Portoviejo, a beautiful city with beautiful green mountains and alluring landscapes we find the place where the members of the San Judas Tadeo Communal Bank meet every two weeks.

Mrs. Alba is a founding member of the Communal Bank, she enjoys everything, the talks, reunions, etc. She is 65 years old, married and from this relationship she got 6 children, all are grownup, two live with her, her husband was a chauffeur but is no longer working because he is sick.

Mrs. Alba is a homemaker and to have her own income, she sells pajamas and sheets. She also sells Yanbal products (beauty products, makeup, perfumes, and accessories for women). She works everyday from 8:00 a.m. to 2:00 p.m., Mrs. Alba leaves her products on credit and she collects every week or two weeks according to what’s convenient for her customers. The clothing and sheets she buys in Santo Domingo.

This loan is to buy pajamas and sheets since she has some orders. Mrs. Alba’s dream is to have her own store to sell her products without selling her items in the street.

loans.use: To buy pajamas and sheets.

loans.name: Teresita De Jesus

texts.es:
Teresita de Jesús E. García, es originaria de  Coapilla Estado de Chipas México, es casada  y tiene cuatro hijos a  su responsabilidad y son: Víctor Manuel de diecinueve años,  el otro es Lázaro de  diecisiete años, Mariza del Rosario de quince y el más pequeño es Luis Antonio.
        Esta vez que solicitó el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de productos por catálogos de las marcas "AVON y Fuller", ésta es una actividad que ella quiere empezar, ya que una amiga la invitó a vender éstos productos pues con ello tendrá buenos ingresos.
        Ella decidío empezar una actividad económica para poderle ayudar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa ya que en ocasiones no es suficiente con el dinero que le da su esposo, nos comenta: "Necesito una actividad que me permita obtener ingresos pero sin descuidar a mis hijos, ya que ahora son adolescentes y ésta es la etapa más dificil, una mamá debe de estar muy cerca de sus hijos adolescentes para que los guíe, no puedes descuidarlos".
        De lo que vaya obteniendo de su primera venta lo estará  ahorrando para que con ello mismo siga trabajando su actividad de venta de catalogo.
texts.en:
Teresita de Jesús E. García is from Coapilla in the state of Chiapas, Mexico.  She is married, and she has four children under her care.  Víctor Manuel is 19 years old, Lázaro is 17 years old, Mariza del Rosario is 15 years old, and the youngest is Luis Antonio.

She requested a loan this time to buy Avon and Fuller brand products by catalog.  This is a business activity that she wants to start.  A friend invited her to sell these products because she will have good earnings.  She decided to start this business activity in order to be able to help her husband with the household expenses.  

Sometimes her husband does not have enough money to cover expenses.  She says, “I need an activity that will allow me to get income without neglecting my children.  Now that that they are adolescents and in the most difficult phase, a mother should be very close to her adolescent children in order to guide them.  You cannot neglect them.”

She will be saving what she gets from her first sale in order to continue working and selling by catalog.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics like perfume, lipstick, deodorant, and others

loans.name: Maria Lucita

texts.es:
La señora María Lucita Rodríguez C., vive en Coapilla Estado de Chipas México, es casada con el señor Constancio Pérez Pérez, y con él procreo cuatro hijos  y son: María Elena  de dieciseis años de edad, la otra es Rocío Guadalupe de trece años, la otra es Gladis Antonia de  nueve  años y el último es Luis Antonio de siete años.
           
         Se dedica a vender pollo aliñado (destazado), donde comenta que le va muy bien en su actividad, a pesar de que lleva pocos meses le ha dejado buenos ingresos en su hogar, como también  en su logrando estar ahorrado para su familia.
       
        Por su propio mérito decidió poner esta actividad ya que para apoyar a su esposo tiene que  tener un trabajo  en el cual le dejara ingresos y así poder aportar ella también  en los gastos que se generan del diario.

        De la ganancia que va obteniendo lo invierte  comprando otras cosas que también le hacen falta y así su actividad crezca día  a día, pues para ella es muy importante en agrandarlo más.
         
        Otra actividad que realiza Maria Lucita es la elaboración de pan, por el momento solo lo hace ocasionalmente pero ésta actividad le gusta mas que la venta de pollos.

         Su deseo es comprar un local en donde pueda poner su negocio  de pollos, como también la venta de panes que es la actividad que más le agrada tener ya que para eso ya tiene su clientela del cual le compran al mayoreo.
texts.en:
María Lucita Rodríguez C. lives in Coapilla, in the State of Chiapas, in Mexico.  She is married to Constancio Pérez Pérez and they have four children: 16 year-old María Elena, 13 year-old Rocío Guadalupe, 9 year-old Gladis Antonia and 7 year-old Luis Antonio.

María sells seasoned, cut-up chicken.  She tells us that her business is doing very well.  Although she has only been in the business for a few months she has made good income for her household and she has also managed to save some money for her family.

María decided to set up this business on her own initiative since in order to support her husband she had to find work that would make her some income so that she could help with their daily expenses.  

María invests her profits in her business, buying other items that she needs and, consequently, her business grows day by day.  It is very important for her to grow her business.

Another business activity that María carries out is baking bread.  At the moment, she only pursues this business activity occasionally but she likes it more than her business selling chickens.

María's wish is to buy premises where she can set up her chicken business and also sell bread which is the business she likes the most since she already has customers for this business who buy from her wholesale.

loans.use: To buy chickens to sell seasoned and cut up

loans.name: Sofia

texts.es:
Sofia V. tiene 69 años de edad y vive en el municipio de Coapilla, Estado de Chiapas México, es casada y a pesar de que sus hijos ya son casados ella se hizo responsable de un niño que desde pequeño ha criando, el niño se llama Román y tiene 14 años de edad. 

             Solicito el préstamo para comprar alimento y criar  pollos de rancho  para luego venderlo en la misma localidad, dice que con la bendición de dios le va bien ya que lleva un año y no ha tenido ningún problema  con su negocio.
           
             Para iniciar esta actividad se inspiro por si sola ya que su esposo también necesita apoyo para dar ingreso en su hogar a pesar de que ya todos sus hijos están casados  no quiere que les haga falta nada.
             
            De lo que aporta de su venta lo está ahorrando para que con ello logre comprar un terrenito para el niño que está con ellos aun que no es nada de ella lo quiere como su hijo.
            
            Su sueño es seguir trabajando hasta que dios le preste vida y así logre comprar el terreno que desea tener para su hijo.
texts.en:
Sofia V. is 69 years old and lives in the municipality of Coapilla in Chiapas state, Mexico.  She is married and although her children are already married, she is responsible for a boy who she has raised since he was small.  His name is Román and he is 14 years old.

She requested this loan to buy feed for and to raise ranch chickens, which she will then sell in the town where she lives.  She says that with the blessing of God, her business is going well.  She has been doing this for a year now and has not had any problems with her business.

She started this business on her own inspiration, as her husband needed support to make enough income for their household.  Although all of their children are married, she doesn't want them to lack anything.
             
She is saving up her income from selling chickens so that she can buy a small plot of land for the boy they are raising.  Although he is not her son, she loves him like her own.
            
Her dream is to continue working until God decides it is her time to go, and by doing so, to be able to buy the piece of land she would like her son to have.

loans.use: to buy ranch chickens and food for raising them

loans.name: Rosa Alcira

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Judas Tadeo.

La señora Rosa es socia fundadora del Banco comunal y le gusta todo del Banco, sobre todo por la ayuda que brinda la institución a personas que quieren salir adelante con sus negocios. Tiene 65 años de edad, es madre soltera pero  de una  relación que tuvo hace muchos años tiene 6 hijos los cuales ya son mayores de edad, ella vive en la casa de una de sus hijas rodeada del cariño de su hija y dos nietas.

Se dedica al comercio en lo que es venta de productos naturales de la marca Nature Garden. Trabaja tres días a la semana por las tardes unas tres a cuatro horas por dia, los productos que mas vende son los multivitaminicos, hepalive, gel Garden, vitatoro y otros, deja sus productos a crédito y cobra cada quince días.

Este crédito es para comprar más de sus productos, vitaminas, hepalive entre otros. Sus sueños son ver que su familia este bien y que sean felices.
texts.en:
On the outskirts of Portoviejo, a beautiful city with green mountains and alluring landscapes, we find the place where the members of the San Judas Tadeo Communal Bank meet every two weeks.

Mrs. Rosa is a founding member of the Communal Bank and she enjoys everything about it, especially the help that the institution gives to people which helps them prosper in their businesses. She is 65 years old, is a single mother but from a relationship that she had many years ago, she has 6 children who are grownup, she lives with one of her daughters, it is a home that is filled with her daughter and granddaughters’ love.

Mrs. Rosa sells natural products of the Nature Garden brand. She works three days a week in the evenings, some three to four hours per day, the products that she sells most are multivitamins, hepalive, gel Garden, vitatoro, and others, she leaves her products on credit and collects every two weeks.

This loan is to buy more products, vitamins, hepalive among others. Mrs. Rosa’s dreams are to see that her family is well and happy.

loans.use: To buy multivitamins, hepalive, gel garden, vitatoro, etc.

loans.name: Dalal

texts.en: Dalal is a 52-year-old married woman from Saida and owner of  a lingerie shop (selling special women's underwear). Dalal is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua to buy special occasion designs that are requested from her clients during this season. Dalal’s shop is well known among her friends, relatives, neighbors and friends of friends. She is up to date with all the recent designs and keeps her clients up to date too. She is willing to open another branch soon and hopes to have the same success as with the present one. She helps her husband in their living and, at the same time, her husband is very proud of her.

loans.use: To buy requested special occasion designs

loans.name: Wafae

texts.en: Wafae is a 56-year-old married woman living in Saida with her husband and three children. Wafae has owned a grocery store since 1997. She’s requesting a loan from Al Majmoua, for the 10th time, in order to buy olives produced on her neighbors land for the whole year to sell at retail. Wafae's previous loans were very useful and productive and she is a very good borrower. She helps her family with their needs as she struggles for a better living . She hopes to expand her business.

loans.use: To buy olives to sell

loans.name: Martha Floresmila

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Judas Tadeo.

En este lugar encontramos a la  señora Martha. Tiene 35 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos  hijos el varón de 13 años y una linda niña de 10 años, los mismos que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es controlador en una cooperativa de transporte interprovincial.

Se dedica al comercio en lo que es venta de sabanas, toldos, cortinas,  su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, trabaja todos los días desde las 8h00 hasta las 11h00, ya que de allí tiene que llegar a atender a sus hijos que a esa hora llegan de sus respectivos centros educativos, es por eso que aprovecha las mañanas ya que en las tardes tiene que ayudarlos en sus tareas, compra sus productos en Santo Domingo una vez al mes, deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días.

Este crédito es para comprar más sabanas y cortinas ya que tiene algunos encargos. Está en el Banco Comunal hace dos años y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos. Sus sueños son tener su casa propia ya que donde vive es alquilado.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Portoviejo, a beautiful city of green mountains and charming landscapes, there is a place where, every 15 days, the members of the San Judas Tadeo Communal Bank meet.
Here we meet Martha. She is 35 years old, and lives with her partner and their two children, a 13-year old boy and a pretty 10-year-old girl. Both attend school. Her husband is a controller in an interprovincial transportation cooperative.
She makes a living selling sheets, canopies, and curtains. She sells door to door every day from 8:00 until 11:00 in the morning because that is when her children arrive home from school. She takes advantage of the morning since she helps them with their homework in the afternoon. She gets her products in Santo Domingo once a month. She sells on credit and collects her payments every 15 days.
This loan will be used to buy more sheets and curtains to fulfill some orders. She has been with this Communal Bank for two years. She likes it because the loans are fast. Her dream is to have her own house as she currently lives in a rental.

loans.use: Purchase of sheets and curtains

loans.name: Vicenta Elicenia

texts.es:
En las afueras de Portoviejo, ciudad hermosa de verdes  montañas y paisajes  encantadores, encontramos el lugar donde se reúnen cada quince días las socias del Banco Comunal San Judas Tadeo.

En este lugar encontramos a la  señora Vicenta. Tiene 32 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos  hijos una niña de 10 años y un varón  de 6 años, los mismos que estudian en  escuela. Su esposo es chofer. Ella estudia educación parbularia en la Universidad Eloy Alfaro a distancia.

Trabaja como maestra parvularia en un jardín, pero también se dedica al comercio en lo que es venta de ropa de todo tipo, aunque reconoce que lo que más vende es ropa de damas, trabaja en su negocio de lunes a viernes por las tardes ya que en las mañanas está en su trabajo en el jardín, aunque aquí también aprovecha para venderles a sus compañeras de clases y padres de familia que son sus clientes, la mercadería la compra en Portoviejo.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas, y ropa de niños. Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 6 años es la fiscal de pagos y le gusta porque los pagos son fáciles de hacer. Sus sueños son terminar su carrera y obtener el nombramiento para seguir impartiendo sus conocimientos.
texts.en:
In the outskirts of Portoviejo, a beautiful city of green mountains and charming landscapes, there is a place where, every 15 days, the members of the San Judas Tadeo Communal Bank meet.
Here we meet Vicenta. She is 32 years old, and lives with her partner and their two children, a 10-year-old girl and a 6-year-old boy. Both attend school. Her husband is a chauffeur. She studies elementary education by correspondence at the Eloy Alfaro University.
She works as a kindergarten teacher, but she also sells clothing of all kinds, and mostly women’s clothing. She works the business in the afternoon Monday to Friday since she works at school in the morning. She also sells her products to co-workers and parents who are her customers. She buys her merchandise in Portoviejo.
This loan will be used to buy more merchandise, such as pants, blouses, shirts, and children’s clothing. She has been with this Communal Bank for six years and she is in charge of collecting the payments. She likes it because the payments are easy to make. Her dreams are to finish her degree and to be appointed as a teacher so that she can continue passing on her knowledge.

loans.use: Purchase of pants, blouses, shirts and children's clothing

loans.name: Fawziye

texts.en: Fawziye is a 58-year-old married woman; the mother of five children. She has been working as a tailor from home for 30 years. Fawziye is good at her work and well known in her area. She lives in a popular neighborhood. Fawziye is requesting a loan from Al Majmoua in order to buy a modern sewing machine that can ease her work and help her finish it faster. Fawziye hopes to open a shop in the future and expand her business more.

loans.use: To buy a modern sewing machine

loans.name: Luisa María Elena

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

La señora Luisa es socia fundadora  del Banco Comunal, es la fiscal de pago  y  está  muy contenta, le gustan las charlas más que todo las de salud, además de los créditos que le brindad una gran ayuda en su negocio. Tiene 47 años de edad, está casada y fruto de esta relación tiene tres hijos todos mayores e independientes. Su esposo es chofer en la aviación civil.

Se dedica al comercio tiene un pequeño local en su casa donde distribuye mariscos como pescado, camarón, etc. trabaja tres  días de la semana, durante todo el dia ya que como el negocio lo tiene en su casa no se le hace difícil atender a cualquier hora. Sus productos los va a comprar a Manta.

Este crédito es para ir a manta a comprar pescado picudo y camarón que es lo que más vende. Sus sueños son tener un local en centro.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Luz De América' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  This city has been known for many years as the 'City of the Royal Tamarind Trees'.

Luisa is a founding member of her community bank.  She is the bank's payment officer and is very happy.  She likes the talks, particularly the health talks.  She also likes the loans which are a great help to her in her business.  Luisa is 47 years old, married and has three grown-up children who live independently.  Her husband is a civil aviation driver.

Luisa has small premises in her home where she sells seafood such as fish, shrimp, etc.  She works three days a week and works whole days because, as her business is located in her home, it isn't difficult to serve her customers at any hour of the day.  She buys her products in Manta.

Luisa will use this loan to buy blue marlin and shrimp since that is what she sells most of.  Her dream is to have premises in the city center.

loans.use: To buy blue marlin and shrimp

loans.name: Martha Verónica

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Martha, tiene 31 años  de edad,  mantiene una relación de unión libre y de esta relación tiene dos hijos de 9 y 4 años, ambos estudian en escuela y jardín de infantes. Su marido tiene un taxi amigo y es comerciante. Ella es nacida en Guayaquil pero hace seis años se vino  a vivir a  esta linda ciudad.

Ella tiene una tienda de viveres de consumo, en el que vende desde arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, hasta artículos de bazar. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde, nos cuenta que lleva en su negocio por seis años y que le ha ido muy bien, los productos  compra en el centro de Portoviejo aunque la mayoría de sus productos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y artículos de bazar. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 3años y le gusta porque a través de los créditos a podido financiar su negocio. Sus sueños son tener un local propio ya que donde tiene su tienda es arrendado.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Luz De América' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  This city has been known for many years as 'The City of the Royal Tamarind Trees'. 

Here we meet Martha who is 31 years old.  She lives with her common-law husband with whom she has two children aged 9 and 4.  Her children are in elementary school and nursery school.  Martha's husband is a taxi driver and salesman.  Martha was born in Guayaquil but six years ago she came to live in this beautiful city.

Martha has a grocery store in which she sells rice, sugar, oil and detergent and other general household items.  She works every day from 6.00am to 8.00pm and sometimes until even later.  She tells us that she has had her business for six years and it has been very successful.  She buys some of her products in the center of Portoviejo although most of her products are delivered direct to her premises.

Martha will use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other household items.  She has been a member of her community bank for 3 years and she likes it because the loans help her to keep her business running.  Martha's dream is to have her own store since her current premises are rented.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and household items

loans.name: José Lizandro

texts.es:
José Lizandro tiene 51 años de edad, es soltero y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de regular movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica desde hace ocho años a brindar servicio de reparación y mantenimiento de vehículos motorizados, en su mayoría motocicletas y mototaxis. El cuenta con un taller situado en una de las calles más céntricas de su distrito. Su negocio cuenta con un buen número de clientes y como en la localidad las motocicletas y mototaxis son el medio de transporte más utilizado, el siempre tiene trabajo que realizar.

José desea adquirir repuestos para poder contar con un inventario estable que le permita mejorar su atención y brindar un servicio más completo, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles que le permita lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
José Lizandro is 51 years old, single, and lives with his family in the district of Olmos, an agricultural zone with steady commercial activity.  It is located in the province of Lambayeque, more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo.

For the last eight years, José has offered an auto repair and maintenance service, primarily for motorcycles and moto-taxis.  He has a workshop located on one of the district's central streets.  His business has a good number of clients because motorcycles and moto-taxis are the most common mode of transportation in the area.  José always has work to do.
 
José would like to acquire spare parts so that he can count on a stable inventory of them, which will allow him to offer better and more complete service to his clients.  For this reason, he decided to request a loan of 2,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  This loan will make it possible for him to achieve his goal.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle and moto-taxi repair business

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es: El. Sr. Julio Cesar R. Pérez trabajador de una compañía de trailers el desde muy chico empezó a trabajar en la compañía y con el paso del tiempo se hizo chofer y ahora el maneja uno de  los trailers y sale de viaje muy seguido y desea construir un cuarto para ampliar su casa ya que la compro por medio de Infonavit y dice que esas casas son muy pequeñas por lo cual el desea hacer un cuarto al frente de la casa y dice que el crédito es una muy buena opción ya que le agrado que se le de la oportunidad de ampliar su casa y poder pagar en abonos.
texts.en:
Mr. Julio Cesar R. Pérez works for a tractor-trailer company.  He started working for the same company when he was very young and with time, he became a driver.  Now he drives one of the trailers and goes on trips very often.

He would like to build a room to expand his house, since he bought his home through INFONAVIT [a social service program that helps workers purchase houses at a below-market interest rates] and says that these homes are very small.  He would like to construct another room at the front of his house and says that this loan is a good option.  He also says that he is grateful to be given the opportunity to expand his house and pay in installments.

loans.use: to build a room onto the front of his house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Juana María

texts.es:
Juana María tiene 47 años D. edad, es casada y resiD. junto a su esposo y a sus tres hijos en el centro poblado Lagunas, una comunidad pequeña situada a la orilla del mar. Pertenece al distrito del mismo nombre y se encuentra situada a más D. una hora D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo.

Se dedica desD. hace más D. dos años a la comercialización D. productos D. primera necesidad y abarrotes en una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ella ofrece a sus vecinos diversos productos D. uso diario que usualmente serían difíciles D. conseguir debido a su ubicación retirada D. otros núcleos urbanos. Este factor ha hecho que su negocio cuente con muy buena acogida, ello hace que siempre se esfuerce más por brindar a sus clientes una buena atención y productos D. calidad. Los ingresos que ella percibe D. esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento D. la economía D. su familia.

Juana desea adquirir más mercadería para poder ampliar su negocio y sus ventas, D. este modo planea aumentar sus ingresos y ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Para lograr su objetivo se ha visto en la necesidad D. solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito D. 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Juana María is 47 years old, is married and lives with her husband and three children in the center of the Lagunas town, a small community located on the seashore. It belongs to the district of the same name and is located more than an hour away from the city of Chiclayo.

Juana for more than two years has sold basic household goods and groceries in a small grocery store in her home. There she offers her neighbors different products for daily use that are usually difficult to find due to their distance from other cities. This has maD. her business very well received and she always works hard to bring her customers the best care and quality products. The income that she receives from her job she uses to help her husband take care of the family finances.

Juana wishes to have more merchandize to be able to expand her business and sales and she wants to increase income to help her family get ahead. To meet her goal she has sought Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva’s field partner) to help for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: To buy more merchandize to expand her business and sales.

loans.name: Celinda Margarita

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a Celinda, tiene 59 años  de edad,  está soltera y vive con su hermana y una sobrina. Está en el Banco Comunal hace 4 años y le gusta Ya que le han ayudado mucho y porque los créditos son rápidos sin tantos requisitos.

Ella se dedica al comercio,  vende ropa de todo tipo, su forma de venta es puerta a puerta, aunque también vende en su casa, nos cuenta que lo que más vende es ropa de mujer y de niñas.  También prepara comida para vender por lo general prepara hasta 10 almuerzos al dia solo para entregar. Trabaja todos los días  desde las 8h30 hasta las 16h00. Su mercadería la compra en Guayaquil una vez al mes o cuando necesite.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa sobretodo de mujer y de niñas, además de ingredientes para preparar los alimentos. Sus sueños son agrandar su casa.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Luz De América' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  This city has been known for many years as the 'City of the Royal Tamarind Trees'.

Here we meet 59 year-old Celinda.  She is single and lives with her sister and a niece.  She has been a member of her community bank for 4 years and she likes it because it has helped her a lot and because the loans are quick and don't have too many requirements.

Celinda is a saleswoman.  She sells all kinds of clothes.  She makes her sales door to door although she also sells clothes from her home.  She tells us that what she sells most of are women's and girls' clothes.  Celinda also makes meals to sell.  She generally makes up to 10 meals a day which she delivers to her customers.  She works every day from 8.30am to 4.00pm.  She buys her goods in Guayaquil once a month or whenever she needs to.

Celinda will use this loan to buy clothes, especially women's and girls' clothes.  She will also buy ingredients for making her meals.  Her dream is to extend her house.

loans.use: To buy women's clothes, girls' clothes and ingredients for making meals

loans.name: Angela Paola

texts.es:
Angela tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera y reside junto a su madre en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona de clima semitropical caracterizada por producir frutas como mango, limón y maracuyá. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega que se encuentra instalada en la vivienda donde reside. Allí ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de uso diario, brindándoles una buena atención, el negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida por lo que Angela siempre se esfuerza por satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes. Adicionalmente ella complementa su negocio con la comercialización de prendas de vestir.

Angela desea adquirir más mercadería para ampliar su negocio y de esa manera poder satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles.

Angela es una joven bastante trabajadora y que gusta mucho de colaborar con los demás, los ingresos que percibe de su negocio los utiliza para ayudar a su familia a salir adelante. Adicionalmente trabaja como profesora para un centro educativo impulsado por la municipalidad de su distrito que tiene como finalidad reforzar la educación que se les ofrece a los niños de su localidad.
texts.en:
Angela is 28 years old, single and lives with her mother in one of the hamlets that make up the district of Tambogrande, an area with semitropical climate, characterized by its fruits like mango, lemons, and passion fruit. It belongs to the Piura region and it is located some four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Angela sells basic household goods and groceries in a store in her home. She offers her customers different products for daily use, as well as the best care. The business is accepted very well because Angela always works hard to help meet the needs of her customers. In addition to groceries, Angela offers her customers a clothing selection as well.

Angela wishes to have more merchandize to expand her business so that she can meet the needs and demands of her customers, which is why she asked Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva’s field partner) for their help of a loan of 1000 nuevos soles.

Angela is a hardworking young woman who likes to work with others. The income that she receives from her business, she uses to help her family get ahead. In addition to her store, Angela also works as a teacher in an education center sponsored by the municipality of her district; its goal is to reinforce the education that is given to the children of the area.

loans.use: To get more merchandize to expand her business and in this way meet the demands of her customers.

loans.name: Fany

texts.es:
Fany es una madre de familia de 38 años de edad que reside junto a su esposo y a sus dos hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola de clima semitropical que produce principalmente frutas como el mango, la maracuyá y el limón. Pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra ubicada a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la comercialización de productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes en una bodega que se encuentra instalada en su domicilio. Ella ofrece a sus clientes diversos productos de consumo diario a sus clientes, los cuales prefieren su negocio debido a que siempre encuentran productos de calidad y son atendidos amablemente. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a su esposo a sacar adelante a su familia.

Fany desea ampliar su bodega adquiriendo más productos de modo que pueda satisfacer la demanda con la que actualmente cuenta, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Fany is a mother and is 38 years old; she lives with her husband and two children in the district of Tambogrande, an area with semitropical climate, characterized by its fruits like mango, lemons, and passion fruit. It belongs to the Piura region and it is located some four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.

Fany sells basic household goods and groceries in a store that is located in her home. She offers her customers different products for daily use, Fany’s customers prefer her business nice they can always find quality products and are treated with kindness. The income that Fany receives is used to help her husband get their family ahead.

Fany wishes to expand her business by getting more products that will help her meet her customers’ demands, which is why she has asked for Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva’s field partner) help for a loan of 800 nuevos soles that will help her meet her goals.

loans.use: To expand her business by getting more products that will help her meet her customers’ demands.

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora Francisca, tiene 60 años  de edad y hace algunos años el compañero de su vida falleció y quedo sola, pero de esa relación tuvo cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, uno de ellos vive con ella, hace varios años aprendió corte y confección.

Tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde desde hace muchos años se dedica a coser ropa, pero lo que mas elabora son sabanas las mismas que después las venden a clientes que le piden sus obras.  También vende productos naturales de la marca Forlive, ventas que les hace al mismo tiempo que entrega sus obras ya estas también le compran sus productos. Trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 22h00 y a veces hasta más tarde cuando tiene pedidos que entregar.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas, otros materiales para la costura y productos naturales. Esta casi desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos sin tantos requisitos y los pagos fáciles de cumplir. Sus sueños son tener buena salud ella y su familia.
texts.en: In the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as the city of the Reales Tamarindos Stadium, the members of the Luz de America Community Bank meet every fifteen days. Here we meet Francisca, who is 60. Her life companion passed away and she has been left alone, but she has four children from that relationship, all grown, one of whom lives with her. She learned dressmaking several years ago. She has a small dressmaking workshop where she has made clothing for many years. However, what she makes most are sheets, which she later sells to customers who request her work. She also sells Forlive brand natural products, sales that she makes at the same time as she sells her work. She works every day from 6 am to 10 pm, and sometimes later when she has orders to fill. She will use this new loan to purchase natural products, fabrics and other materials for clothing-making. She has been part of her Community Bank almost since its beginning, and she likes it because her loans are fast and without too many requirements, and the payments are easy to make. Her dreams are for her and her family to have good health.

loans.use: To purchase fabrics, sewing materials and natural products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy special occasion gifts

loans.name: José Victor

texts.es:
José Victor es un padre de familia de 24 años de edad que reside junto a su esposa y a sus tres hijos en uno de los caseríos que conforman el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona que produce principalmente frutas como el mango, limón y maracuyá. La zona pertenece a la región Piura y se encuentra situada a cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a trabajar como obrero en una de las plantas procesadoras de mango que se encuentra situada  cerca a la zona en donde reside. Adicionalmente trabaja junto a su esposa en un negocio de venta de ropa, para lo cual tiene un pequeño establecimiento en su negocio. Ellos ofrecen su mercadería en venta a los vecinos de la zona en donde reside y los ingresos que perciben de esta actividad son utilizados para sacar adelante la economía de su familia. Esta es una actividad bastante importante para su sostenimiento por lo que siempre tratan de mantenerla del mejor modo posible.

José desea ampliar su negocio adquiriendo más prendas de vestir de modo que pueda aumentar sus ventas y percibir mayores ingresos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 800 nuevos soles que le ayuden a lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
José Victor is a 24-year-old family man who lives with his wife and their three children in one of the villages that make up the agricultural district of Tambogrande, a zone that mostly grows fruits like mangos, lemons and passion fruit. The zone is part of the Piura region and is located four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.
He works at one of the mango processing plants located near the zone where he lives. He and his wife also run a clothing business, for which they have a small establishment in their home. They offer their merchandise for sale to their neighbours and the revenue is used to improve the family’s financial situation. This business is a fairly important source of income for the family, which is why they try to keep it running in the best way possible.
José would like to expand his business by acquiring more clothing such that he can increase his sales and take in more revenue. This is why he has requested an 800 PEN loan from Edpyme Alternativa to help him reach his goal.

loans.use: Purchase of clothing to expand his business

loans.name: Mercedes Auxiliadora

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen cada quince días  las socias del Banco Comunal Luz De América.

En este lugar encontramos a la señora Mercedes, tiene 64 años de edad y hace ocho meses su esposo falleció y quedo ella viuda, pero de esa linda y recordada relación tuvo siete hijos los mismos que ya son todos mayores de edad, tres de ellos viven con ella.

Ella tiene una tienda de víveres de consumo en su casa, en la cual vende productos como: arroz, azúcar, aceites, detergentes, en la cual trabaja todos los días desde las 6am hasta las 20h00 y a veces hasta más tarde ya que como esta en su casa no se le dificulta atender hasta más tarde, nos cuenta que en su tienda ella se entretiene y olvida un poco su pérdida, sus hijos le ayudan en su trabajo cuando tienen tiempo. Los productos los compra en el centro de Portoviejo y algunos los recibe en su local.

Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir mas su tienda, va a comprar arroz, azúcar, aceite, detergentes, embutidos y otros productos de primera necesidad. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el principio, es la presidenta del Banco  y le gusta por la solidaridad del grupo. Sus sueños son tener su casa bien arreglada y un negocio más grande.
texts.en:
Every two weeks, the members of the 'Luz de América' community bank meet in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí.  This city has been known for many years as the 'City of the Royal Tamarind Trees'.

Here we meet Mercedes who is 64 years old.  Eight months ago her husband died and she was left a widow.  However, she had seven children from this beautiful relationship.  All her children are now grown up and three still live with her.

Mercedes has a grocery store in her home where she sells products such as rice, sugar, oil and detergents.  She works in her store every day from 6.00am to 8.00pm and sometimes until even later because, as she works from her home, she doesn't find it hard to serve her customers until later.  She tells us that her store keeps her occupied and helps her to forget her loss a little.  Her children help her in her work when they have time.  She buys some of her products in the center of Portoviejo and some are delivered direct to her premises.

Mercedes will use this loan to better stock her store.  She will buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other essentials.  She has been a member of her community bank from the beginning.  She is president of her community bank and she likes it because of the solidarity of the group.  Her dreams are to have a well-sorted house and a bigger business.

loans.use: To buy rice, sugar, oil, detergents, sausages and other essentials

loans.name: Hem

texts.en: Hem S., 41, is requesting a loan of USD 1000 to purchase a motorbike with a trailer attached, which his wife will use for selling meatballs. In the future, he would like to use any additional profit to repair his house. S. is a police officer, earning an income of USD 5 per day. S. is married and resides with his wife and a child in Phnom Penh City, Cambodia, the most populated city in the country. The family has to spend USD 70 on food, USD 10 on electricity, and USD 20 on other necessary expenses every month. This is S.'s first loan from CREDIT, a long-standing Kiva partner in Cambodia.

loans.use: To buy a motorbike with a trailer attached.

location.town: Mean Chey District, Phnom Penh City
